Saing H. needs to pay the school fee for her two children, but her personal account does not have enough funds. To solve this problem, Saing H. would like to request a loan to pay her children's school fee.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married, with a son and a daughter. He is a farmer in the town of Vodyanoye, in a predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine. There are very few employment options there, which is why many people in town are struggling to survive. Viktor was one of them, but he managed to launch a small agricultural venture 16 years ago. Since then, his greenhouse business has grown and expanded to a scale Viktor couldn’t even think of. Currently, Viktor owns four spacious greenhouses. He plants 5,000 tomatoes every year. He has 52,000 Grivnyas invested in this business.

Viktor is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase tomato seeds. Last year Viktor tried planting tall-grown tomatoes and was very satisfied with quality and quantity of his harvest. Therefore, he is hoping to plant solely tall-grown tomatoes this farming season, thus ensuring a stable income for himself and his family. Viktor is hoping to save some money and reinvest it in much-needed reconstruction of two of his greenhouses that are old and need to be refurbished.

loans.use: To purchase tall-grown tomato seeds.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis L. G. tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Luis es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.  

Luis comenzó su negocio de sembrio de cacao desde hace 1,5 años. El compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther. El solicita este crédito para seguir plantando cacao y para comenzar a plantar yuca también. Con este crédito el desea mejorar su servicio. 

Sus metas para el futuro son tener una propia casa, una finca y un carro. El desafío que el enfrenta en su negocio es la época de invierno cuando no se puede cosechar. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el indoor, escuchar música y descansar.
texts.en:
Luis L. G. is 28 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Luis is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new loan group is located in Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office, in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in a number of different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Luis started his business growing cacao one and a half years ago.  He buys and sells his products in Matilde Esther.  He is requesting this loan so that he can continue planting cacao and so that he can start planting cassava too.  He would like to use this loan to improve his service.  His goals for the future are to own his own home, a farm and a car.  The challenge that he faces in his business is the winter season when he can't harvest.  In his spare time he likes to play indoor soccer, listen to music and relax.

loans.use: To continue planting cacao and to start planting cassava too

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To build on her land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Doris Elena

texts.es:
Doris, de 43 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Pedro (45), que es albañil  y de su hijo que es mayor y trabaja y ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

Hace 8 años, emprendió el negocio de fabricación de muebles con su esposo, y desde entonces ella se dedica a coser, y durante los fines de semana cuando él descansa empiezan ambos con el armado de muebles. Está muy satisfecha pues como trabaja por pedido no tiene perdidas, y le gusta porque es un negocio  que les permite cubrir mejor con los gastos del hogar. Pero lo que no le gusta es que cuando demoran en entregar los muebles listos, éstos se llenan de polvo, pues por la zona donde vive hay bastante tierra. Manifiesta que tiene varios clientes fijos que le compran con regular frecuencia su mercadería pues saben de la calidad y comodidad de sus muebles. Además es una mujer emprendedora ya tiene planeado para el futuro ampliar su negocio y producir mayor cantidad de muebles. Doris tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de material (tela y maderas) que le hacen falta para terminar con un pedido que tiene pendiente, y espera aumentar sus ganancias.

Es el  segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Doris is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Pedro, age 45, who works as a mason. Her grown son works and helps with the household expenses.

Eight years ago, Doris and her husband started a furniture manufacturing business. Since then, she spends most of her time sewing. On the weekends when her husband is resting, they both will spend some time assembling furniture. Doris is very satisfied because their business has not experienced any losses since their work is done according to order. This business has enabled her to do a better job of covering the household expenses. However, Doris dislikes those instances when her customers delay the delivery of completed furniture because the pieces collect dirt since she lives in a dusty area. She says that she has several established customers who buy merchandise from her regularly because they know that her furniture will be comfortable and of good quality. In addition, Doris is an enterprising woman who has future plans to expand her business and produce a higher quantity of furniture. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of materials (fabric and wood) that she is lacking so that she can complete an outstanding order and hopefully increase her earnings.

This is her second loan with MFP. Doris promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad in the eyes of those responsible for making this loan possible so that she could continue working and moving forward.

loans.use: Purchase fabric & wood

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat T. is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Chantha Chhin is 39 years old.  They have been married since 2002 and they have a young daughter. The family lives about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Sinat T. is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan, for $700, to repair the roof of the family's home.

loans.use: To repair the roof of their home

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

He has operated a carpentry shop for the past year, selling to the local residents. He makes furniture like beds and tables for sale. Jumaa faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in his products. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase timber, glue and nails. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber, glue and nails.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is married with three children, two boys and one girl. Her husband is employed and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business. She sells in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Salma faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Blanca Betty

texts.es: Blanca tiene 49 años de edad. Vive en hogar estable con su esposo y sus 02 hijos en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, unas 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Blanca se dedica a la agricultura, contando con un terreno que su esposo recibió en herencia de sus difuntos padres. El cultivo que tiene es mango y maracuyá, la cual está por abonarse y a la fecha está con buen desarrollo y vigor. Cosecha su cultivo semanalmante. Su esposo es profesor nombrado y con su sueldo cubre obligaciones familiares y crediticias. Blanca solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para su maracuyá y también para labores de control de plagas de su cultivo. Con esta inversión, podrá asegurar una buena producción de su cultivo. Por ello, Blanca solicita un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Posee muy buenas referencias laborales y personales de sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en: Blanca is 49 years old. She lives in a stable home with her husband and their 2 children in the district of Las Lomas, an agricutural zone in the province of Piura, some 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Blanca works in agriculture, and has some land that her husband inherited from his parents. She has crops of mango and passion fruit, which are fertilized and currently in good growth and vigorous. She harvests her crops weekly. Her husband is a teacher and his salary covers the family obligations and credit. Blanca is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her passion fruit and also to keep pests from her crops. With this loan, she will be able to ensure a good harvest. For this reason, Blanca is requesting $550  from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). She has good work and personal references from her neighbors and others who know her.

loans.use: to by fertilizer for her passion fruit crop

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachel is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school.  To earn a living, she runs a retail shop.  She also practices dairy farming for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business and begin saving money.  She hopes to expand her business further in the future by opening other outlets.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy cooking fat, sugar, maize flour, and salt for her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, maize flour, and salt.

loans.name: Sunnatullo

texts.en:
Sunnatullo is married with two children. He is a private entrepreneur who sells car spare parts. Sunnatullo is very disciplined. One of his strong characteristics is his ability to listen and persuade, which helps him in his work with customers. Sunnatullo has been in the market for 12 years. His main goal is to provide his family with a decent life and stable future. He has always tried to achieve financial and economic independence and make a career. Sunnatullo is hoping to see his business flourish and succeed. Sunnatullo believes this loan of 8,000 TJS will allow him to purchase spare car parts for his business and will be one of the steps towards his goal. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase car spare parts for his business

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Juboo du Banc villageois de Ndiongué est créé le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de quinze femmes issues du même village et ont les mêmes activités (petit commerce et embouche ovine).



La responsable Fatou est âgée de 31 ans, elle est veuve et a sept enfants en charge dont deux de sa coépouse. Elle s'active depuis quatre ans dans le petit commerce de poisson fumé et d'huile et fait parallèlement de l'embouche ovine. Elle s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire et vend dans le village. Sur la photo elle est à gauche habillée en mauve avec un châle blanc et a levé la main droite.


Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa capacité de vente pour se faire plus de revenus.


Elle a la charge de toutes les dépenses familiales mais souhaite avec ses bénéfices augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Juboo of the Banc Villageois of Ndiongué was established on May 12, 2010. It is comprised of fifteen women from the same village who have the same occupation (small-scale commerce and the fattening of sheep).  

Fatou, aged 31, is the group’s official. She is a widow and has seven children to support. Two of the children belong to her co-wife. Fatou has been active for four years in a small business selling smoked fish and oil. At the same time, she fattens sheep. She gets her supplies at the weekly market and makes her sales in the village. In the photo, she is the one at the left raising her right hand. She is dressed in mauve and wearing a white shawl.

Her loan will enable her to bolster her sales capacity, so as to bring in more revenue.  

She is responsible for all family expenses but would like to use her profits to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and smoked fish to be sold

loans.name: Sant Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 27/06/2008.IL est composé de 17 membres issus du meme quartier.
Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Rokheyatou à l’extrême droite,est responsable du groupement.Elle a pour domaine d'activité la vente de poisson.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir exercer depuis plus de 02 ans.

Son prêt lui permettra de se ravitailler en poisson.

Son objectif est de construire sa propre maison et de s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on June 27, 2008. It is made up of 17 members who come from the same district. Their principal business is selling various small items. 

Madame Rokheyatou, on the far right, is the leader of the group. Her business is selling fish. She has a lot of experience in this activity as she has been working in this field for more than two years. Her loan will allow her to stock up on fish. 

Her goal is to build her own house and to see to the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Married to a driver, Adjoa bakes bread for distribution at Ankaful-fie, a village near Abura. She has been in the bakery business for four years. She wishes to increase the quantities of bread supplied to her customers; a loan from Kiva will help her buy the ingredients to be used to bake to increase her sales. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional oven. She is standing close to the oven she uses to bake.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to be used in baking to increase her sales.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to Marwan, who is photographed instead of her as she is a conservative woman. Muna and her husband run an internet cafe and research preparation center. Muna wants to have a women-only section in the cafe where women can use the internet, work on their research. etc.
Muna has taken out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to purchase two extra computers, plus tables and chairs, for the cafe where her husband is photographed.

About this loan product
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fee. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: to prepare a women-only section of her internet cafe.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 38-year-old man who is married and lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He has four school-aged children. He makes a living by buying empty bottles or used materials suitable for recycling and sends them to companies for a good price. He is helping our environment minimize waste items that are not properly disposed of. He has been doing this good activity for five years already and gets a monthly income of PHP 6,440 (~$160). 

Rolando has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to add more capital for buying empty bottles or used materials suitable for recycling. He has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. He hopes to sustain his business for long, long years, find good buyers and earn more income from it.

loans.use: to buy more empty bottles and used materials for recycling.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El señor Oscar recibe un bono que el Estado Boliviano le brinda por la edad que tiene (75 años) y también recibe giros que su esposa y sus hijos le envían desde el exterior. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación del tratamiento de Diabetes al que se somete mensualmente. El señor vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene dos hijos que ya no dependen de él. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter social del mismo es que lo canalizamos a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Oscar gets a stipend from the Government of Bolivia due to his age (he’s 75 years old) and he also receives stipends that his wife and children send him from abroad.  He needs the loan to pay for Diabetes treatments that he receives monthly.  He lives in his own house that’s located in La Paz’s San Pedro zone.  He’s married and has two children that no longer depend on him.  This is the first time he’s gotten an IMPRO loan and because of its social character we are channeling it through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for his diabetes treatments.

loans.name: Sharifakhon

texts.ru:
Шарифахон умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и мать 4 детей. Более 16 лет Шарифахон занимается купля продажей домашних обуви и детских одежд. Она торгует на центральном местном рынке и у неё много постоянных клиентов. Она продает свои товары по низким ценам, чтобы привлечь еще много новых клиентов и максимизировать свою прибыль. Шарифахон хотела бы получит займ в размере 1300$ США для покупки домашних обуви и детских одежд, чтобы расширит свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она хочет заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу помощь и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Sharifakhon is a smart and honest women.  She is married and the mother of four children.  For more than sixteen years she has made her living buying indoor shoes and children's clothing and selling them in the central market to her many steady customers.  She sells her goods at low prices to attract a lot of new customers and maximize her earnings.  

Sharifakhon is seeking a loan of 1300USD to buy indoor shoes and children's clothing so she can expand her business and maximize earnings.  She would like to thank all of you in advance for your help and loving-kindness.

loans.use: to buy indoor shoes and children's clothing.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has 1 child who is currently in school. Joshua has a business, a small retail shop that sells video CDs and DVDs, which he has had for 2 years.         

To help expand his business, Joshua has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase video CDs and DVDs for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joshua hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Joshua hopes to expand his business. 

Joshua is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase video CDs and DVDs for resale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 8 children. 
Lourdes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 4 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Haliyangu

texts.en:
Haliyangu, a married woman with one child who attends school, lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators and dreams of establishing another business in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, with a loan of Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, washing soaps and rice.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, washing soaps and rice.

loans.name: Berman Martin

texts.es: Berman Martin de 32 años de edad es casado, habita junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus 2 niñas que actualmente cursan la primaria. Don Berman esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de construir un muro en su casa pra evitar que su patio se llene de agua cuando llueve, ya que no quiere que sus hijas se le enfermen por la humedad.
texts.en: Berman Martin is 32 years old, married and lives with his family composed of his wife and two children going to elementary school.  Berman is asking for his 3rd loan to build a wall at home to prevent his yard from flooding when it rains because he does not want his daughters to become ill due to the dampness.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Benvenida

texts.en:
Benvenida is a widow with six children. Her husband died three years ago. Benvenida strives hard to meet the family's daily needs. She presently lives in Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She has an agricultural business, operating and managing her corn farm. She has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly income of PHP 4,460. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer.

Benvenida joined GDMPC in 2010. She is now on her second loan cycle. In the future, Benvenida wants to purchase a motorcycle to be used in the village for "habal-habal" transportation to earn another income for the family. Now that her husband has passed away, she is both father and mother to her six children.

loans.use: to purchase corn fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old. She is married and has four school-going children. To make a living, she does mixed farming. She has been engaged in her farming for over eight years and earns approximately KES 5,000 a month for this activity. 

She has been a good client and this is her second loan which she plans to use to buy farm supplies including fertilizers and seeds. 


She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Yeris Antonio

texts.es: Yaris estudia Derecho, dentro de algunos años se mira trabajando en una institución pública del estado, espera apoyar y mejorar la atención al público que hace uso de éstas instituciones. Su amyor inspiración es su madre porque siempre me apoyaba y me impulsaba a salir adelante. Es una persona responsable con ética y principios morlaes. Ha tenido dificultad para costearse sus estudios y ya a la finalización de los mismos solicita el préstamo para pagar los módulos del curso de titulación
texts.en: Yaris is studying law.  In a few years time he sees himself working in a public state institution.  He hopes to support and improve the service provided to members of the public who use these institutions.  His biggest inspiration is his mother because "she always supported me and encouraged me to do well".  Yaris is a responsible person with ethics and moral principles.  He has found it difficult to pay for his studies and, now that he is at the end of his studies, he is requesting a loan to pay for his degree.

loans.use: to pay to obtain his degree

loans.name: Sokrin

texts.en:
Sokrin (pictured above) and her husband, Piseth, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1987 and have five children -- three sons and two daughters. Two have full-time employment and the other three are in school.

Sokrin is a weaver, while her husband is a security guard. She is asking for a loan of $600 to build a brick room under her house.

loans.use: To build a brick room under her house.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San salvador en la provincia de Pisac y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Antonia;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 2 hijos de  18, 14 años de edad; la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, la socia también tiene su tienda en la cual vende chicha y cerveza, la socia también cría animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cervezas para implementar su negocio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR” communal bank, located in the San Salvador district of the Pisac province, within the Cusco department.

She’s 38 years old, single, and has two children, ages 18 and 14.  She farms and also has a store where she sells chicha (fermented corn drink) and beer.  She also raises small animals such as chickens and Guinea pigs.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more beer to stock her business.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old married woman with three children; one of whom is in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for two years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nikki

texts.en:
Nikki is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Nikki is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Nikki runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. She sells items such as cigarettes, shampoo, and soaps. Nikki has had her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.

Nikki is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, Nikki joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situations. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María, habita en Quezalguaque municipio de León, madre de dos hijos,es ama de casa y comerciante, de dedica de lleno a  la crianza de cerdos los cuales vende en su comunidad. Ella inicio con este negocio a los 28 años de edad, anteriormente vendía granos básicos pero ahora trabaja junto con su esposo en la crianza y venta de estos animales. 
Ella realizo el crédito para la compra de cerdos, insumos para mantener la salud y alimentación de sus animales. Entre sus expectativas esta ampliar la producción de cerdos de raza, mejorar su casita que esta muy deteriorada y seguir luchando por mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, inhabitant of Quezalguaque in the municipality of León, is the mother of two children. She is both a housewife and a merchant. She makes a living raising pigs which she sells in the community. She started this business when she was 28 years old. Previously she sold staple grains but now she works together with her husband in the raising and selling of these animals.

She requests this loan to buy pigs and supplies to care for and feed her animals. Her hopes are to extend the production of breeding pigs, improve her home which is very run down and continue struggling to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: 5 mujeres  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellas son las integrantes del grupo comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” una de ellas es la Sra. Sandra de 37 años de edad casada  y con 3 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. Sandra se dedica ya hace 2 años al negocio de venta de calzado (zapatos y zapatillas para damas y caballeros) en un local que está ubicado en su propia casa donde labora todos los días. A la Sra. Sandra  en el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio en vender calzado para niños y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más calzado (zapatos y zapatillas para damas y caballeros) y así poder seguir generando más ingresos. La Sra. Sandra es la segunda de la mano izquierda se le distingue por su blusa de color negro y es la única que usa lentes en el grupo. Ella y el grupo se despiden con gran agradecimiento de Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.

loans.use: PARA COMPRAR MAS CALZADO (ZAPATOS Y ZAPATILLAS PARA DAMAS Y CABALLEROS)

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en:
Véronique A. was born in Tsévié in 1976. She finished middle school in Aného before returning to her hometown. No longer able to continue her education due to a lack of support, she trained as a seamstress. But with her instinct for business, she soon started buying and selling colorful traditional cloths between Togo and Côte d’Ivoire. Although the crisis in Côte d’Ivoire ended her business, she adroitly made use of the situation to start up her dressmaking shop again, which she calls «Dieu Est Grand», or God Is Great. Mrs. A. is the second wife of her husband, a medical assistant. Her husband is polygamous, irresponsible, and hardly bothers with the family. So everything rests on her shoulders.

Mrs. A. would like to add to her dressmaking business to boost her income. To do this, she is requesting a loan of $950 to buy a sewing machine, some traditional cloths, and boutique materials. The success of her plans will clearly augment her income and allow her to improve the living conditions for her two children and her little sister.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1976 à Tsévié, Madame A. Véronique a fait ses études primaires et secondaires à Aného avant de revenir dans sa ville natale. Ne pouvant plus continuer les études par manque de support, elle s’est formée en couture. Mais, ayant le goût du commerce, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce des pagnes entre le Togo et la Côte d’Ivoire. Avec la crise ivoirienne, ses affaires ne marchent plus et très ingénieuse, elle a profité de ce temps pour reprendre son atelier de couture. Elle est la seconde épouse d’un infirmier polygame irresponsable qui ne s’occupe guère de la famille et tout repose sur Véronique.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Véronique veut associer le commerce à la couture pour renforcer ses revenus. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour acheter une machine à coudre, des pagnes et les articles de mercerie. Il est évident que la réalisation de projet augmentera les revenus de Mme A. Véronique pour lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de ses deux enfants et sa jeune sœur.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, some traditional fabrics, and boutique materials

loans.name: Meddy

texts.en:
Meddy Semonobe is 48 years old and married. He has four children. The first born is a girl aged 16 years in senior five, the second is a boy aged 13 years in senior two, the third is a girl of 12 years in primary seven, and the fourth is a boy of 10 years in primary five.

He acquired driving skills in 1981 and has been employed as a driver for 17 years. He would like to lease a saloon car so that he can become self-employed.

The income will help him to meet the school fees for the children. In the future, he plans to save some money so that his wife can start rearing chickens to improve on the family income. He is going to use some of the savings to put a deposit on his lease.

loans.use: To lease special hire vehicle

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.en:
Ayoko K. was born in 1959 in Aklakou, where she currently lives. She is married and the mother of four. Selling porridge and cakes is her main business. Today, she has over 15 years of experience that has earned her a good reputation. Nicknamed « Mother Vivi Vi », she is loved by all. Her request is for a loan of $600 to buy sugar, corn, firewood, flour, and oil in order to produce more porridge. In this way, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née en 1959 à Aklakou où elle vit actuellement, Madame K. est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. La vente de bouillie et de gâteaux est sa principale activité. Aujourd’hui, elle a une quinzaine d’année d’expérience qui lui confère une bonne réputation. Surnommée « Maman VIVI VI » Madame Ayoko est aimée par tous. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour s’acheter du sucre, du mais, du bois, de la farine de blé, de l’huile afin de produire davantage de la bouillie. Par ceci, elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et augmenter son épargne.

loans.use: Acquiring corn, sugar, and other ingredients for making porridge

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa de Carmen is 53 years old and lives with one of her two children. She is part of a group pertaining to the communal bank El Bombonaje. She works selling various types of condiments in the central market in Rioja, in San Martin. She offers her clients pepper creams as well cilantro and garlic among other things. She works in this business because she likes it and she enjoys her customers. She has always been characterized by her strength and perseverence. She is a fighter. With the loan received by Manuela Ramos for approximately $160.00, she will buy cumin, garlic, cilantro, corn, coffee, different kinds of peppers. These will be processed and blended to be sold by the bag to meet her customer's needs. She will also buy seasonings in bulk to sell in smaller quantities.

La señora Rosa del Carmen tiene 53 años de edad y 2 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal El Bombonaje, se dedica a la venta de condimentos de todas las variedades, su puesto de venta se ubica en el mercado central de la localidad de Rioja, en el Departamento de San Martín. Atiende a su clientela con cremas de ajíes y algunas verduras frescas como: culantro, ajos, entre otros. Ella se dedica a este negocio porque le gusta y así se distrae con su clientela. Siempre se caracterizó por ser fuerte, perseverante y luchadora. Con el préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 500.00 (US$ 160.00 aprox.), comprará cominos y pimienta en granos (1 Kg. Diario de cada uno), ajos, culantro, albaca, maní, maíz, ajíes de diversas especies, café (5 Kg. aproximadamente semanal), luego, estos productos pasarán por un proceso de licuado y así podrá venderlos en el menudeo por bolsitas de S/. 0.10 a 0.50, según la necesidad de su clientela. Además comprará sazonadores en cajas y paquetes para vender al por menor.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase seeds and seasonings for her busines

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking woman who has been of much support to her husband through her business of selling of cooked water fufu and eru. Water fufu is grated and fermented cassava eaten with eru (a wild vegetable) and is an appreciated dish in this area.

To increase on her income, she decided to add embroidery and raising pigs to the existing business. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA ), she plans to cook and sell water fufu and eru, embroider dresses and fatten and sell pigs.

The profit raised will be used to pay the school fees for her three children. She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: Purchase of eru, water fufu, thread, cloth, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Phov

texts.en: Mrs. Phov S., age 27, is a housewife. Her husband is employed working on a golf course, earning about $4 per day. They have two children who are too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to finish building her house.

loans.use: To finish building her house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with three children and she is 31 years old. She is into sales of drinks and foodstuffs. She is a LAPO member from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She learned the business for 3 years and started her business in 2002.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in farming/rice crop and maintenance of livestock.

loans.name: Amina's Tunajiamini Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 28 year old married woman with one child, age 2. Amina is a wood seller. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 8 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $190.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more wood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell wood, bananas, and run a salon.

loans.use: To buy more wood for her business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is a mother of two children. She is forty two years old and she has been roasting and selling ground nuts for the past eight years. She travels to the northern part of Ghana to buy the nuts and then travels back to the south (Tema) to sell. Mariama wants to use her loan to buy more bags of groundnuts to reduce her frequent travels to the north and also to avoid price hikes.

She is a member of the group called “Baa Meyi” (meaning no one is bigger than God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Mariama would like to buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a married mother of four. Because her husband cannot find work, the economic well-being of her family depends upon selling the milk of her three cows at the bazaar. Habiba is seeking a loan to buy more dairy cows and expand production, allowing her to bring more milk to market; this will provide a greater degree of income stability for her family and establish a sustainable business for the future of her and her children.

loans.use: To expand her dairy cattle stock.

loans.name: Fabio Javier

texts.es:
Mr. Favio is 38 years old and he lives in Ticuantepe. He’s married and has three children, ages 4, 8, and 16. His children are students and his wife is a homemaker. Mr. Favio is in the business of growing pineapples and he has fifteen years of experience, and he began on his own initiative. With this loan he would like to buy agricultural supplies to improve production. In the future he hopes to increase his production and sales, as well as provide a good education to his children and to have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Favio tiene 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio de Ticuantepe, es casado y tienen tres hijos de 4, 8 y 16 años de edad que actualmente están estudiando, su esposa es ama de casa. El negocio del Sr. Favio es el cultivo de piña y lleva quince años de experiencia, e inició con esfuerzos propios. Con este préstamo lo quiere para compra de insumos agrícolas para mejorar la producción. A futuro es incrementar su producción y ventas, darles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener estabilidad económica.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Lorena De La Concepc

texts.es:
Lorena and her husband´s greatest wish is to provide good, safe living conditions for their nine-year-old daughter. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood where crime has been growing over the last few years. For this reason, they are asking for a loan to put a roof on the porch of their house.

Lorena's husband is a carpenter and she has been selling perfumes and cosmetics for three years. She is a street vendor and keeps inventory in her home. Her plans for the business include diversifying her product line and one day becoming a distributor. Her ultimate goal is to leave a good inheritance behind for her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva Volunteer

El mayor deseo de Lorena y de su esposo es poder darles condicion de vida y seguridad a su pequeña hija de 9 años, ellos habitan en el barrio Memorial Sandino donde la inseguridad ha crecido en los últimos años es por eso que con el crédito planean poner techo en el porche de su vivienda.

El esposo de Lorena es ebanista y ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos, desde hace 3 años empezó este negocio que lo realiza de manera ambulante y también tiene inventario en su casa de habitación. Los planes para su negocio son diversificar los productos que ofrece y espera algún día poder poner una distribuidora porque quiere dejarle un buen patrimonio a su pequeña hija.

loans.use:
Build a roof over the porch of her house

Construir techo en el porche de su casa de habitación

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase various goods to replenish her grocery store.

loans.name: Novinyo Yao

texts.fr:
Novinyo Yao E. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il est revendeur de « sodabi », une boisson locale tant appréciée par la population, à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Yao désire par ce crédit faire de stock en sodabi afin d’eviter des ruptures de stocks en période de pénurie. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour gagner sa vie.
200 000 12 mois
texts.en:
Novinyo Yao E., 42, is married and the father of 5 children. He sells "sodabi," a local drink much appreciated by the populace in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Yao wants to use this loan to stock up on sodabi so as to avoid running out of it when there is none to be had. He is counting on this opportunity to support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying "sodabi" for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Chhay Kemheng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of twenty-one members who are located in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Chhay K. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. She owns a small store where she sells dinnerware (plates, glasses, chopsticks…etc).  Her business is going well and she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more dinnerware to resell to her customers. 

Her husband, Mr. Chum Routha, has a small business in which he uses electricity to charge customers' batteries. 

Mrs. Chhay K. is 34 years old and the mother of three children, a 3-year-old, and two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more dinnerware to resell

loans.name: Sokhoin

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoin V., 29, and her husband, Mr. Bunthorn Oung, 33, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 2000, they have two young sons. Mrs. Sokhoin bakes and sells different types of Cambodian cakes from her house. Her husband is a chef at a hotel in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $500 to level up the foundation of her house.

loans.use: To level up her house foundation

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Senora Cruz began to sell sodas to her neighbors out of her home. She noticed it was going well and decided to expand the variety of products she offered her customers. She has a cart that she often takes out in the community as well to improve her sales

Senora Cruz has two children, ages 4 and 6. One is sick so the extra income helps pay for his medicines.

loans.use: additional products to expand her little store

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Eang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank that is requesting this loan consists of sixteen people who live in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province. 

Mrs. Seng E. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Suon Savath, are laborers who earn less income than they need to support their household. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Seng E. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business. 

She is 50 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer, while the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya (composé de 3 femmes  mariées et d’une célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des foyres polygames dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de Sikasso.(troisième région administrative da la république du Mali)
Elles  font essentiellement est la vente de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest) et real. En plus  de cette activité principale, elles font également la vente de condiments alimentaires et de la pâte d’arachide.
L’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso est en relation avec ce groupe depuis seulement  1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le premier prêt fut correctement rmboursé. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 6 pièces de pagnes wax et real, d’un baignoire de pâte d’arachide et 4 emballages de condiments alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso auprès des commerçants grossistes et font leurs ventes en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso, dans les quartiers et dans les foires des villages environnants à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 16.500 FCFA par mois dont elles prétendent  utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, aider leur mari pour certaines dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group, made up of three married and one single woman) average 25 years old and one child. They live in polygamous households in the Médine neighbourhood of the city of Sikasso in Mali. These women sell mainly Wax and Real (brand name) "pagnes", which are highly prized in West Africa. In addition to this main business, they also sell food condiments and peanut paste. The microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso has been working with this group for only one year. This is their second group loan. The first loan was fully repaid. They will use this loan to buy six lengths of Wax and Real "pagnes", a tub of peanut paste and four packages of condiments. They purchase their products locally in Sikasso from bulk resellers and then retail mainly to women at the markets of Sikasso, in the neighbourhoods, and in the markets of neighbouring villages. They hope to each make a monthly profit of 16,500 FCFA which they will use to repay the loan interest, to help their husbands with some of the household expenses and invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Wax and Real "pagnes" as well as foodstuffs such as condiments and peanut paste.

loans.name: Uamsho Group

texts.en:
Naisiligaki has been a  tailor in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 8.30am to 18.30pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Naisiligaki is 48 years old, married, and has one child, age 17. She also cares for three additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kanaely, who also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena F., 72, is married with 3 children.  She has 3 yearsexperience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers, 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~312 USD).  SPBD loans are Mena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy equipment needed to run the business. She said the remainder of her loan will help her pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy a plantsprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and knives

loans.name: Rith

texts.en: Mrs. Rith S. lives in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she makes thatch to cover the roofs. Although she tries to work hard, she still earns less income than she needs to support her family's living conditions. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Rith S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to breed and earn more income. She is 44 years old and a widow with one child who works in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
B. Julienne est née vers les années 1943; elle est mariée à AZONHATIN. Julienne est mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés. Julienne réside au quartier Gbégamey un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Julienne vend de pots de peinture, de bidons et oreillers dans le marché de Gbégamey. Julienne s’approvisionne en ces différents articles à Tokpa, marché International du Bénin. Julienne enregistre de plus en plus de demande de la part de ses clients; mais elle n'a pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour la satisfaire. C'est pourquoi Julienne sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
B. Julienne was born around 1943 and is married to AZONHATIN. She is the mother of three children, all in school, and she lives in Gbégamey, a working-class district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Julienne sells containers of paint, drums, and pillows at the Gbégamey marketplace. She supplies herself with these different goods in Tokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She’s noticing more and more the demand from her customers, but she doesn’t have sufficient financial means to satisfy it. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers of paint

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah I. sells foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Deborah is 38 years old and married with a child. She promises to repay her loan promptly. She says Thank You to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Rosielyn

texts.en:
"We started farming last 2005. We have two separate farms and we use our harvest to buy our family needs, especially for our children. We fish in the river for viands. Freshwater fish are tasty and very safe to eat," says Rosielyn T., a 22 year old mother of one child.

Rosielyn would like a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She needs more capital for land preparation. She will use the loan to purchase two quarts of fungicide and bags of complete fertilizers.

CEVI is reaching out to poor Filipino families to help sustain their livelihood. CEVI gives not just loans but also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase two quarts of fungicide and bags of complete fertilizers.

loans.name: Dương Thị

texts.en:
L. Dương Thị (525980641) is a 65-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 2 adult children. To earn a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,100,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Eloisa M. Vda. D. L. D. 47 años D. edad resiD. en Tonacatepeque junto a su hijo, nuera y un nieto. Ella posee 16 años D. tener una venta D. tortillas y una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad. Eloisa solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder surtir su tienda con muchos más productos, ya que solo D. la venta D. tortillas no obtiene el dinero necesario para solventar todos sus gastos, es por esto que desea aumentar sus ventas en la tienda y poder mejorar su forma D. vivir.
texts.en:
Eloisa M. Vda. D. L. is 47. She lives in Tonacatepeque with her son, daughter-in-law, and grandson. For 16 years she has sold tortillas and had a store selling basic needs products. Eloisa is asking for a loan to be able to stock her store with many more products. Selling tortillas does not give her enough money to pay all of her expenses. That is why she wants to increase her sales in the store and be able to improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Agyenkwa 1 Group

texts.en:
Joyce A. is twenty–nine years old. She is married and has given birth to one son, who is currently in primary school. Joyce is a trader who trades in textile materials. She hawks to sell in her community.

Joyce is the leader of a trust bank group called Agyenkwa, which literally means Saviour. She is first from the left in the photo. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses in providing for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional stock

loans.name: Eymin Johilia

texts.es: Eymin Johilia T. M. tiene la edad de 31 años. Es una mujer casada, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosmeticos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Es una mujer que muy responsable y que siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ya que viajaba a los departamentos para obtener clientes, y así decide incursionar en el mercado de la venta de cosmeticos. Uno de sus mayores desafíos fue aprender este negocio por cuenta propia para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de sombras,pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas y perfumes. Su mayor deseo es obtener un lugar propio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eymin Johilia T. M. is 31, married, and has one dependent child. She has been selling cosmetics for over six years. She is a very responsible woman, and she has always liked working. Because she traveled to different departments to get customers, she decided to enter the market of selling cosmetics. One of her biggest challenges was learning this business on her own in order to provide her family with their daily bread. The loan is for working capital to buy eye shadow, lipstick, nail polish, and perfume. Her biggest wish is to get her own place for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Djiguiya 4 De Wayere Farakala Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Djiguiya 4 sont tous des hommes mariés  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à WAYERE un des villages de la commune rurale de FARAKALA,  préfecture  de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs cultures de maïs. 
Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et comptent  acheter des engrais et des herbicides pour entretenir 7 hectares. 
Leurs productions sont vendues au niveau du village, dans les marchés de FARAKALA  et  de SIKASSO après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes souvent venant de BAMAKO ou du SENEGAL. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénefice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
NB: Daouda B. est absent de la photo car était allé accompagner son épouse au centre de santé.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Djiguiya 4 group are all married men with an average age of 35 and on average, 4 children. They mostly live in traditional extended families in Wayere, one of the villages of the rural township of Farakala, prefecture of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can successfully raise their maize crops. They are working with the institution for the first time, and they intend to buy fertilizer and herbicides to maintain 7 hectares.

Their crops are sold in the village, in the markets of Farakala and Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women, often coming from Bamako or from Senegal. They expect to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA per growing season.

Note: Daouda B. is not in the photo because he had gone to accompany his spouse to the health center.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are 20, 17, and 1. Her two eldest are studying in a technical institute and she takes care of her 1-year-old daughter.

Silvia started selling beauty products via catalogue. She joined her village bank four years ago and decided to start a convenience store. She began buying showcases and supplies and little by little her store has been growing.

Since she joined FINCA Silvia’s working capital has increased and her business has grown. She is happy because she has received rewards for making her loan payments on time.

Silvia needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy a freezer because she doesn’t want her food to spoil. Her dream is to grow her business and to renovate her showcase cabinets.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for her store

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en: Enriquita L. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Enriquita owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Enriquita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Enriquita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for the business. A portion of the loan will be used to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and provide a comfortable shelter in which to live. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 39 años, está separado de su pareja. Tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años, con los que vive  en su casa. Tras el abandono de su esposa, Jaime adquirió mayor responsabilidad por el bienestar de sus hijos. Ahora se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y posteriormente trabajar en sus chacras de café o en las de sus vecinos, macheteando y quitando los arbustos, por lo que le pagan 18 soles diarios. En el caso de realizar sus propias cosechas de café sus hijos se suman a la recolección, ya que con su producción abastece a una a asociación de productores, quienes le compran a precio razonable. En esta labor Jaime se siente muy bien, sobre todo porque tiene tiempo para compartir con sus hijos, a quienes ama mucho.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que está muy contento de ser parte de un banco comunal y asimismo se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de fungicidas para sus plantaciones de café.

loans.use: Compra de fungicidas

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry P.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has three grown children. She is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. Cherry has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Cherry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cherry is requesting a loan of 5000 pesos which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use her additional income to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona M.'s business involves purchasing and reselling sheep with her husband. She is 49 years old and married with four children. She has requested a loan of 1606 Azerbaijani manats in order to purchase additional sheep to meet customer demand. Sona believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional sheep and further increase their income to aid her children's education. You can become an important part in the life of Sona and her family. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
Through patience and sacrifice, Lyne M. was able to graduate from college with a BS in nursing. Currently, she is happily married to Emerald M.. They are gifted with two children named Mark Jeremy M. and Maye Jeanne M.. Being parents, they are concerned for their children's future and strive hard to earn enough money to support their studies.

Her husband is a member of the Barangay Council in their village and uses their motorcycle to earn income while Lyne works as a government employee in Bayombong. Since their income only covers their basic needs and allowances of their children, Lyne wants to borrow Php6,000 from KIVA lenders to be used in the maintenance of their motorcycle. She believes that they can earn more money and finance their children's schooling with this financial assistance.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of their motorcycle

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en: Ejiro sells cooking oil at the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. The demand for her cooking oil is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She is 39 years old, married with two children. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Katerinne

texts.es:
Katerinne, de 18 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Su negocio es la venta de regalos para matrimonios, todos los días ella sale a vender de forma ambulatoria sus preciosos artículos para el hogar, pero donde le va mejor es cuando se ubica en la puerta de las iglesias, pues aprovecha para vender a las personas que asisten a las bodas.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es envolver los regalos, ya que se divierte mucho haciéndolo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil tener que caminar todo el día bajo el ardiente sol. 
Espera que con el tiempo pueda tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus artículos con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Katerinne con MFP, se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Katerinne is a hard-working and cheerful young woman of 18 years. She lives in her parents' home, and what she most wants is to excel in life. Her business is the sale of wedding gifts. Every day she goes out on foot to sell her beautiful household goods, but she is most successful when she stands outside churches and takes advantage of the opportunity to sell her items to wedding guests. What she likes most about her job is wrapping the gifts because it's fun. She has two years of experience, and the most difficult part of the work is having to walk all day under the blazing sun. She hopes that in time she will be able to open a store to sell her items in a more leisurely manner. This is Katerinne's first loan with MFP, and she is very happy about the opportunity and intends to make all of her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank. With the seven hundred nuevos soles requested, she will purchase more merchandise to improve her business's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita O. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 50 years old. Melita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from transportation services. Melita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Melita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Melita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Patricia Jeannette

texts.es: Patricia Jeannette R. V. de 41 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Durante nueve años Patricia se ha dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzos, así mismo hace platillos típicos como tamales, enchiladas y yuca frita. Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico el cual es el mercado de San Juan Opico, el cual cuenta con gran afluencia de personas durante todo el día, así mismo posee clientes frecuentes los cuales trabajan dentro del mismo mercado y que comercializan productos diferentes. Patricia solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar aceite, arroz, maíz, vegetales y otros productos más los cuales son utilizados para la elaboración de los alimentos. Patricia es una personas que ha sabido salir adelante por sí misma, esforzándose mucho por brindarles todo lo que sus hijos necesita, debido a  que patricia es madre soltera, se siente con el reto de ser mejor cada día y buscar la forma de optimizar su negocio, para que jamás le haga falta nada a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Patricia Jeannette R. V., 41, lives in San Juan Opico, La Libertad department, with her three minor children, who are in school. For the last 9 years, Patricia has sold prepared, typical meals, such as: tamales, enchiladas and fried yucca. Her eatery is strategically located in San Juan Opico's market which receives many visitors daily. She also has regular customers who work in the market itself selling different products. Patricia needs financing to buy cooking oil, rice, corn, vegetables, among other ingredients, which are the most used in her meals. Patricia has always known how to get ahead on her own, working hard to provide her children with everything they need, because Patricia is a single mother. She feels challenged daily with being better and finding the way to improve her business so that her little ones will never lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, corn and vegetables.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is from the town of Alicia,Isabela. She is 39 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie is starting a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosemarie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the village of Menongan, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Wilma is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a variety store. The store sells food and other daily-used products in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her store's product offering

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes T. tiene 49 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.
