El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, trigo, papas, y también tiene una tienda en donde vende productos de primera necesidad, los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria le  gusta caminar 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes T. is 49 years old. She is single, and she does not have children. She lives in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the Grupo Enmanuel Communal Bank. It is an area that is located 45 minutes from the Guaranda Canton, the capital of the Bolívar province. There are 17 members in all. It is a farming and livestock community. They are indigenous people, and they all speak Quechua. Maria works in farming to increase the family economy. The crops that do the best are corn, wheat, and potatoes. She also has a store where she sells basic needs products, and she sells these products in her house. What she grows she sells in the Guaranda wholesale market every six months. The principal cultural event of the area is the Carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. Also, Maria likes to walk. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for working in the field. Mostly she will buy chemical and natural fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good economic activity for her family. The challenges she faces are climate problems and illnesses that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Jasmina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Jasmina del Socorro M. R., es trabajadora de la escuela Marcos Dessys se desempeña como directora del centro, es casad con tres hijas todas estudian.

La señora M. R. solicito el crédito para reparar su casa de habitación ya que se acerca el invierno y se le pasa el zinc.
texts.en:
Sra. Jasmina del Socorro M. R. works for the Marcos Dessys School as the center’s director. She is married and has three daughters in school.

Sra. M. R. is requesting a loan to repair her house, which is lacking zinc, in anticipation of winter.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for home repairs such as zinc, cement, and blocks

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. lives in Ogoo farm with her husband and three daughters, two in primary school and one in nursery school.  Kadiatu, 26, has a shop where she sells drinks and slippers, a business she has operated for 10 years now. She is a LAPO, SL client and has taken three previous loans, all used to expand her business, pay her children's school fees, and help feed her family.  Kadiatu now needs a new loan of 2,000,000 Leones to buy baby clothes to add to her shop inventory.

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes, slippers and drinks for her shop

loans.name: Feliz

texts.es: Félix tiene 56 años, vive con su esposa en su casa que es propia, juntos tienen 9 hijos, quienes son mayores e independientes.  Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia, hoy sus hijos tiene sus propios hogares, por lo que solo trabaja para él y para su esposa. En  épocas de siembra  trabaja con 2 toros que posee, que la ayudan arar la tierra, de esta manera logra obtener cosechas muy satisfactorias, además que sus campos de cultivo están en una zona estratégica en donde hay canales de riego que ayuda también en el desarrollo de su siembra. Una vez obtenida esta producción son vendidas en el mercado de su zona, Félix ve su recompensa en las ganancias, por lo que espera continuar trabajando en la agricultura. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, por tanto promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para sembrar nuevamente papa.
texts.en:
Félix, age 46, lives with his wife in their own house. They have 9 children who are grown and independent. All his life he has been involved with farming, an activity that has allowed him to support his family. Today, his children have their own households, and he only works for himself and his wife.

During the planting season, he works with two bulls that help him plow the land. In this way he succeeds in obtaining very satisfactory harvests. Furthermore, his planted fields are strategically located in an area where there are irrigation canals that help with the development of his crops. From the time he first sold his harvest in the local market, Félix saw his reward in his earnings. That’s why he hopes to continue working in farming.

This is his fifteenth loan with MFP, and he promises to be very responsible with his payments. He believes this loan will be very useful for the progress of his business. With the loan he is applying for he will buy sacks of fertilizer for planting potatoes again.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying food to sell

loans.name: Blessing Children Group

texts.en:
Alfred W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Blessing Children. He is 52 years old, divorced, and has two children, 18 and 23 years old. He was able to attend school only through 7th grade due to financial difficulties. He also cares for three siblings. All of the children are attending school.

For four years, he has been selling creme, soap, hair grease, perfume etc. in West point Market, Monrovia, Liberia.  He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more creme, soap, hair grease, perfume etc. to sell.  His dream is to expand his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Isaiah is inset at lower right because he was absent during the group interview.

loans.use: To buy more creme, soap, hair grease, perfume etc.

loans.name: Carmen Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen E. es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive por la Ciudadela Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca capital del Azuay, por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente, su gastronomía siendo nombrada como Patrimonio cultural del Ecuador en 1999.

Nuestra socia se encuentra de 59 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 4 hijos que se encuentran de 35, 33, 31y 25 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente con sus nuevas familias y sus dos últimos hijos trabajan y son quienes le ayudan económicamente a su hogar, su esposo es de profesión Tipógrafo y con el esfuerzo del trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Carmen se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual vende recorriendo los mercados de Azogues y Gualaceo, realiza esta labor hace 10 años, trabajando todos los días, pero hay veces que no sale a vender y se dedica a realizar comida la misma que vende en su casa.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 4 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para comprar mas mercadería, su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar ropa para su exigente clientela.

Espera gozar siempre de buena salud para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen E. is a member of the Communal Bank “Fe y Alegría” (Faith and Joy). She lives in the Uncovia neighborhood of the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay. Cuenca is well-known for its beautiful architecture, its people, its cuisine, and was named a World Heritage Site for Ecuador in 1999.

Carmen is 59 years old, married, and has given birth to four children who are now 35, 33, 31, and 25 years of age. Her two oldest children are married and live independently with families of their own. The two youngest children work and help with the household finances. Her husband is a professional typographer. By working together, Carmen and her husband have been able to build their own home.

Sra. Carmen sells clothing by traveling to the markets of Azogues and Gualaceo. She has been in this line of work for ten years. During the times she does not travel to sell clothing, Carmen prepares food and sells it from her house. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for four years and has benefited from the loans in order to buy more merchandise. This loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing for her existing customers.

Carmen hopes to always be in good health so that she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase T-shirts, blouses, dresses, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Phavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phavy C. is a group leader who has been selected by four group members who live in Chong Kaoh-I village in Kandal province. All the group members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 


Mrs. Phavy C. is 41 years old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. She faces an obstacle in that her field is infertile. So, to improve production, Mrs. Phavy C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. 


She is a widow with six children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kerubo

texts.en:
Kerubo is 55 years old. She is married and has been blessed with eight children between the ages of 14 and 30. Three of the children attend school.

She is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya, where she has been practicing mixed farming for over twenty years. Her farm produces maize, beans, bananas, vegetables and milk which she sells to the local market. She faces the challenges of high cost of farm supplies, the fluctuating prices of her products and her lack of knowledge about disease and pest control.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES to expand her cereal business. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for her children and build a house. She plans to open a big cereal bank in a more strategic place in the future.

She appreciates the partnership with Juhudi Kilimo and acknowledges the fact that she has been able to educate her children with the profits from this business.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Sope Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE MOHAMED a été mis sur pied le jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL dont il fait partie. Il est composé de 12 femmes. Outre les liens de parenté qui les lient, les femmes partagent le même air géographique. Le petit commerce est leur activité principale.

Madame Ndoumbé M. debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, de blanc vêtue est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de 3 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais au marché du quartier. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des voitures en provenance des villages de pêcheurs.

Son crédit lui permettra d’acheter plus de paniers de poissons frais afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices.

Ses bénéfices lui offrent la possibilité de renforcer son épargne et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Mohamed has been created the day the Banc Villageois of DVF Gueoul (to which it belongs), was launched. The group is composed of 12 women. Besides being relatives they also live in the same area. Their main business activating is retail. Mrs. Ndoumbé M., standing to the far right in the photo, dressed in white, is the group’s leader. She is married and the mother of seven dependent children. She also has three other children in her care, entrusted to her by the relatives. She sells fresh fish at the local market. She purchases her stocks from the trucks near the fishermen’s villages. Her credit will permit her to purchase a larger number of baskets with fresh fish in order to increase her income. Her revenues allow her to bolster her savings and provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fresh fish

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 44 años, ella tiene la venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos en su vivienda. Este negocio lo aprendió por su mama ya que se dedicaba a  esta actividad con el paso del tiempo ella decidió hacerse cargo y mantener a su familia por medio de su negocio. Inicio por la falta de oportunidades ya que no tenia un trabajo estable para poder mantener a sus hijos. Para poder continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar frijoles, maíz, entre otros productos. En el futuro quiere mejorar la calidad de sus tortillas y mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Cristina, 44, sells tortillas and cooked beans from her home. She learned this business from her mother who also worked at it. In time, she decided to take over and support her family through this work. She started this business because she didn't have a stable job to support her husband and children and there weren't many other opportunities available. To continue with this work she wants to buy beans and corn among other products. In the future she’d like to improve the quality of her tortillas in order to improve her income and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans and corn.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”, ubicado en la provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 05 hijo.
La señora estudió educación secundaria (completo).

La señora María esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses como grupo mientras tanto y en la actualidad como Banco Comunal,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad la señora  solicitará un nuevo crédito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para incrementar el capital de su negocio y poder comprar más productos, nos cuenta también que tiene una fotocopiadora donde realiza servicio de fotocopias.

Su sueño para el futuro  es incrementar su capital  para hacer crecer el negocio y tener una casa.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Las Perlas II” communal bank, located in the Huancané province, in the Puno department. She is 39 years old, has a junior high school education, is married, and has five children. María has been working with “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for eight months as a group, and now as a communal bank. She tells us that the first loan of 500 PEN allowed her to increase her grocery business’ working capital. Now she is asking for a loan of 800 PEN ($300). This money will help her increase her working capital to invest in more products. She also tells us that she has a photocopier with which she provides copy services. Her dream is to increase her capital so that she can grow her business and build a house. What she likes the most about her communal bank is its punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, Lucia viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana, en donde compra cereales variados y luego los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa y necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de trigo, maíz y haba.
El sueño de Lucia es ahorrar para comprar un carro que le ayude a transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucia is married and has four children one of whom is still in school. Lucia travels to the regional markets three times a week to buy assorted cereals that she later sells in Ayacucho’s wholesale foodstuffs market. Lucia is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) communal bank and needs a 2000 sol loan to buy wheat, corn and lima beans. Lucia’s dream is to save up to buy a car that will help her transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, corn and lima beans.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
He is a 41-year-old farmer. He is married with five children aged 17, 15, 13, 8 and 3 years and is named Alfred. Alfred lives in Fort Portal, Uganda in his own house but dreams of having a commercial building for rentals one day and of buying more land for his family. 

Alfred’s wife is also a farmer and together they have a plantation and also rear goats to sell after maturity. He says theft and price fluctuations are his biggest threats in his business activities. This is Alfred’s first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to use the funds to buy fertilizers for his plantation and one Boer goat to rear.

loans.use: Buying fertilizers for his plantation and one goat to rear

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more oranges, bananas, mangoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   farming, rice retailer and food vending businesses. She lives in Catlagan, Bgry. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard at her farming, rice retailing and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. Elizabeth is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase a transport vehicle.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of transport vehicle

loans.name: Ung's Group

texts.en: This loan group consists of four members in Barku village in Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Ung M., born in 1969, as the group leader. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Ung M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she is also rice middleman to earn additional profits to support her family. In order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions, she would like a loan to buy more rice and grow her current business. Mrs. Ung M. is a widow with a child who helps her in the business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Soeng Rem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeng R. is the mother of three children, all of whom are students; they also help their parents in their work. She and her husband, Mr. Pheap Len, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Pheap is also a laborer.

Soeng is the president of the village bank in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She was selected by ten loan members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so as to improve their family's living conditions.

On Soeng’s plantation it is time to grow rice, but she does not have enough rice seed. So to improve production, Mrs. Soeng R. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: 10-11-04 Group

texts.en:
Nam N. T. is a 53 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Nam is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04-Dong Son (10.13.04).


Nam is married and has 1 adult-aged child.  To making a living, Nam owns and operates a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling poultry products in the local community.  Nam has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,100,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Nam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nam is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Nam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Bich is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


2.  P. T. Toan is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  N. T. Nga is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


4.  N. T. Mai is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  N. T. Chuan is a 62 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


6.  N. T. Dung is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


7.  N. T. Hieu is a 55 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nam N. T. (33) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Nam là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04-Dong Son (10.13.04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ thịt gia cầm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nam thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nam kiếm được khoảng 2.100.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nam đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nam đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Bich (12) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  P. T. Toan (13) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  N. T. Nga (14) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4.  N. T. Mai (15) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  N. T. Chuan (16) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


6.  N. T. Dung (20) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


7.  N. T. Hieu (21) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark M. has been in the pool business for 22 years.  His in-laws pulled him into the business just as the technology was changing and the industry was growing.  Mark worked for the family business for a while and then started another business with a friend.  When the economy tanked, he decided to reduce his overhead costs and open his own business, Floppy Hat Pool Service.  He has had some of the same customers the entire time he has been in the pool business.  At the moment he has 70 different clients that he goes to regularly and has had as many as 108.  He is the only employee, so his 70 clients keep him extremely busy.  He is looking to hire another employee starting in April because he is expecting to have more customers in the high season.

Mark found out about ACCION Texas-Louisiana through a small business development advisor who had helped him with business issues in the past.  Mark had set a hard date to open Floppy Hat, whether he had a loan or not.  When he got in touch with ACCION, he told his loan officer that he was working with a short time frame.  He was grateful for the guidance from ACCION and was ecstatic when he received the loan before opening the business.  The loan gave him the working capital to allow Floppy Hat to take off.  Mark was able to go straight to his distributor and buy products to sell to his clients.  He was also able to pay for basic operating costs such as his insurance and worker’s compensation.  

Mark describes himself as a workaholic, but hopes to have someone working under him in the future.  He wants to have more time for other things.  He would love to be able to spend more time with his four grandchildren and to play his trombone.  

Mark believes it is important to watch overhead costs and to only spend the money that the small business has.  Mark’s motto is that “hard work never hurt anybody.”  He enjoys working hard and seeing how all that hard work pays off.

loans.use: buying wholesale products and for operating costs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru:
Aydin M. 53 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Aydin jenat i imeyet 2 detey.
 On uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji tovarov dlya remonta( kraski, kistochki, shpateli i t.d) Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari dlya svoyeqo magazina chtob pereprodat ix.
texts.en: Aydin M. is 53 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Dispaced Person).  He moved from the Fuzuli region and now lives in the city of Baku together with his family.  Aydin is married and has 2 children.  He has been involved in the business of selling repair tools (paint, paint brushes, paint tools, etc.) for 9 years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy goods for his store for subsequent resale.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for resale

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 34 años. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco III en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace cinco años, se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra y vende limón. Realiza esta actividad en un pequeño terreno que heredó de su padre. Vende sus productos a una clientela ya establecida en el mercado local. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección este rubro.

José desea comprar fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de limón. Espera mejorar su producción y la calidad del producto para que pueda venderlo para un buen precio. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in his own home in the rural area known as El Porvenir Hualtaco III in the district of Tambogrande.  This agricultural area is located in the province of Piura, some four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For five years now he has been growing and selling lemons on a small plot of land that he inherited from his father.  He sells his products to an established customer base in the local market.  He learned his business from his father and knows it very well.

José wants to buy fertilizer for lemon crop maintenance.  He hopes to improve production and product quality so he can sell at a good price.  To reach his goal he has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his lemon crop

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang Y., a 54-year-old widow who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province, is a mother whose children are all single and live under her management. Her husband died of senility many years ago. Hang has worked in the farming sector since 1990, with most of her income derived from growing rice crops. Hang usually generates around $2.50 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. She will use her loan to pay for a few domestic laborers to help with the rice harvest.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting costs.

loans.name: Manzanita Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó gracias a la señora Digna Rosa L. que vive en la cuidad de Villarrica. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras nombrando al grupo "Manzanita".
Las integrantes se dedican a la artesanía, especialmente a confeccionar atuendos tradicionales, ropas artesanales, por ello solicitan el crédito para poder comprar telas, lienzos, agujas especiales para este tipo de confecciones, y ao po'i.
La sra. Oilda C. es artesana desde hace mucho tiempo, ella desea poder superarse económicamente porque anhela poder brindar un futuro mejor a su familia. Sabe que es muy difícil conseguir un apoyo financiero pues ha intentado obtenerlo en otras instituciones y no lo ha logrado, por eso se encuentra muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, pues en ellos encuentra la oportunidad de conseguir aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Digna Rosa L. who lives in the city of Villarrica.  The women were delighted to join the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program and named their group 'Manzanita'.

The members of this group work in handicrafts, especially making traditional outfits and hand-made clothes.  They are requesting this loan to buy fabric, linen, special needles for this type of dressmaking and ao po'i (a fine cotton cloth).

Oilda C. has been a craftswoman for a long time.  She would like to get ahead financially because she would like to be able to provide her family with a better future.  She knows that it is very difficult to get financial support since she has tried to obtain such support from other institutions and was not successful.  For this reason, she is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva because they are providing her with the opportunity to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, linen, thread and needles for working with ao po'i (fine cotton cloth)

loans.name: Good Samaritan Group-Mukono

texts.en: 37-year-old Alice N. is one lady who exudes confidence and a sense of purpose. These attributes have been her business stocks in trade over the course of the last 4 years as she goes about her business rounds, which are tailoring and bricks sales. These businesses are situated in Kitale-Mukono. Before this happily married mother of 5  ventured into any of the above businesses, she was doing mostly agriculture. Weekly, she says her tailoring business generates 200,000 shillings in profit. With this loan, Alice says she is going to purchase more cloth-making textile to make more clothes and also more bricks to resell. Alice belongs to Good Samaritan group.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to make clothes and bricks to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for gara cloth production

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia M.  is a 65-year-old married woman living in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.  Letecia has run a rice farming business for 30 years. This business earns 10,000 PHP per month.

Letecia will use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. 

In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business and earn a larger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 33 years old, and married with three children. He runs Jorafam Scales where he sells and repairs weighing scales.  He has six years of experience in the business. He says that he has achieved a lot since he became a member of Faulu Kenya.  He has managed to stabilize his business and build a house through his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy a weighing scale.

loans.use: To buy a weighing scale

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school.  Teo runs a retail shop.  She has been in this business for seven years and works six days a week. Teo sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  

The main business challenges for Teo include seasonality, transportation, and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to build her own rental house.  Teo lives in a home which she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Martha Olivia

texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old and lives in the city of San Gabriel with her younger children. Three of her children are older and are on their own. One of these children studies in Quito, the nation's capital. Her two younger children are in school. Martha is a hard-working person dedicated to raising pigs. She owns a small piece of land where she breeds and sells her pigs. As the number of animals she owns increases, Martha says she sees a better income and tries to give her children the best she can. 

She began her business with the help of a loan from FODEMI. In the past she had kept livestock, but upon the death of her parents she had to sell everything. She is seeking her second loan to buy and raise more pigs. She believes that this loan will help her family, because with the money she makes she wants to help her children study. Her goal is to continue to move her business forward and to see her children have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy and care for pigs.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Amivi est une femme âgée de 23 ans. Elle est célibataire.
Amivi a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des sachets plastiques de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Amivi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 30 balles de sachets plastiques.
texts.en:
Amivi is a woman of 23. She is single. 

Amivi has worked at selling goods since 2004. She sells plastic bags by walking from place to place. She buys her products in Lomé.

Amivi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy 30 bales of plastic bags.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 30 years old and married. She has three children, ages 8, 6, and 1. She is a rice farmer working in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has been growing and selling rice for six years.

Analou has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest. Analou also hopes for her family to be in good health always.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en:
Tserennadmid lives with her husband and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her two children, age 1 and 6, stay home with their nanny while her husband works as an operator at a private company. 

She manages a bottle trading business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2003 and has been able to expand her business. With eight years of operating her business, she has gained much experience and built a good relationship, both with her partners and her suppliers. She contributes all her business earnings for her family's use. She is an honest and diligent woman who is planning to continue her business in the future. She says, "Since my business operation I have been able to improve my family's living conditions." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more bottles for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Afi Justine

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 41ans, elle est mariée à un cultivateur. Elle est mère de Trois enfants.
Couturière de profession, Afi travaille aujourd’hui comme revendeuse et ce depuis 1990.Elle revend des produits de mercerie à Baguida en allant à Adamavo et pour cela elle achète à la capitale .Elle ne se fait pas aider  dans son commerce. 
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de mercerie.
texts.en:
Afi is 41 years old and married to a farmer with whom she has three children. She is a seamstress by training but began working as a tradeswoman in 1990. She sources haberdashery from the country's capital and sells it at Baguida and Adamavo. She works completely on her own. 
Afi is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase haberdashery products.

loans.use: to purchase haberdashery

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years.  She is 39 years old, married to John, and they have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods for resale in her retail shop, like sugar, bread and salt.

In future, Patricia hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods for resale, like sugar, bread and salt.

loans.name: Aloise

texts.en:
Aloise is 37 years old, married to Irene, and they are blessed with three school-going children. He has been running his general store for the last nine years, earning a monthly profit of KES.8,000, and will use this KES.10,000 loan to purchase additional store stock including bales of rice, flour, beans, sugar, tea leaves, and salt.

With the anticipated profits, Aloise plans to expand his store and apply some starting capital to venture into the quarry business. in the future he hopes for business growth and the finances to educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to add store stock such as bales of rice, flour, beans, sugar, tea leaves, salt, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old.  She is the owner of a tricycle transportation business, and, because of old age, her son is the one who operates her tricycle.  Virginia is still working hard to provide their needs.  Aside from the transportation business, she also accepts laundry as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy new tires and to save some for future use.  She is still dreaming of lifting their life from poverty and experiencing a better living.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a part of it is to save for future use

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal  is 31 years old. He is married with two children. Vusal sells detergents in the central local market. He has been in this business for 10 years. This kind of product is very popular among local people. His monthly income from selling detergents is about 250 USD. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Vusal's business is quite successful and brings a stable income for the family. Today, Vusal requests 1,500 AZN  to purchase more items with the purpose of increasing his range of goods to sell. This will be his second loan from AqroInvest.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 41 years old, is a construction worker with her husband. They each earn $3 per day. They have four children: two work earning $3 per day and the other two are still young. Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike to transport grass to sell to earn additional income for the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport grass to sell.

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru: Курбон житель района Джиликул. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его дети учатся в России. Сам он занимается выращиванием овощей для торговли. Кроме того у него имеется сад фруктовых деревьев. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Kurbon lives in the Jilikul region. He is 57 years old. He is married and has two children. His children study in Russia.  Kurbon grows vegetables for sale. In addition, he has a fruit orchard. He is taking out a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Luchadoras de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, cuenta con 19 integrantes, en esta oportunidad se encuentran en el noveno ciclo D. Programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Todas ellas se reúnen cada cierto tiempo para darse apoyo y también realizan otras actividades en conjunto para seguir creciendo.
Un ejemplo de trabajo es la señora Martina, quien se dedica a la venta de pollos. Hace ya un buen tiempo trabaja en ello y gracias a eso formó ya una buena clientela. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajara y luchadora, que tiene como interés sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar en la casa, para que no les falte nada.
Ella comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio y quiere seguir invirtiendo en el, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos en cantidad, para que de esa forma tenga más cantidad y pueda hacer frente a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Luchadoras (Women Fighters) are from the city of Villa Elisa. They have 19 members and they are in the 9th cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs at the communal bank. They all get together every so often for mutual support and for other activities, which helps them to continue growing together.

An example of their work is Martina, who sells chickens. She has been doing this for a long time and thanks to that she already has a good business. She is known as a hard working, fighting woman, who is interested in moving her family forward and helping in her home, so that they don’t need anything. 

She says that the business is going well and that she wants to continue investing in it, so that is why she is asking for a loan, in order to buy chickens in quantity, so that in this way she will have them available in order to meet the requests of her clients.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell later

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 49 years old and a widow with two children. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. 

To make a living, Elsa operates a specialized retail business in the cloth and dressmaking sector. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cloths to sell and supplies to used. This will be the third loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloths to sell and supplies to use

loans.name: Yobannis Vicente

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a don Yobannis, tiene 44 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos de 20, 18 y 3 años de edad, los dos menores aun viven en su casa uno de ellos estudia el último año de colegio. Su mujer es comerciante.

El para ganarse el sustento diario y el  de su familia se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y ropa interior, una vez por semana  se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar la mercadería para luego trasladarse con la mercadería hasta Esmeraldas lugar donde realiza  sus ventas en forma informal o puerta a puerta, en esa ciudad se queda dos  a tres días o hasta que vende todo o la mayoría de su mercadería, lleva más de 15 años en este negocio y que le va muy bien ya que allá hay menos competencia para sus ventas.
p>
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa de todo tipo e interiores. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le han brindado en el Banco para recibir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a realizar sus recorridos
texts.en:
The communal bank San Vicente meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place that is known for its commercial activity, its traditional patron saint (San Pedro and San Pablo) festivities, and the happiness of its people.

Here we meet Yobannis, 44, who is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children aged 20, 18 and 3.  The two youngest still live in his house, and one of them is in the last year of school.  His wife is a merchant.

In order to provide daily sustenance to his family, Yobannis has a business selling all types of clothing and undergarments.  Once a week he sets out toward the city of Guayaquil to buy the merchandise that he later brings back to Esmeraldas, the place where he makes his sales.  He sells on the street or door-to-door.  He stays in this city 2 or 3 days, until he has sold everything or at least most of his merchandise.  He has had this business for 15 years and it is going very well, since in Esmeraldas he faces less competition for his sales.

He will use this loan to buy all types of clothing and undergarments.  He has been in his communal bank for 5 loan cycles, and he appreciates having the opportunity to receive these loans. 

His dream is to have a car to get around with.

loans.use: to buy clothing and undergarments

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith's group includes six hard-working women. Judith is 21 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Judith has been working hard to manage her small business, laying bricks. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials to make and lay bricks, and it will help Judith to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Judith hopes that, in the future, she will be able to purchase a motorcycle to help transport materials for her business and to help her family get around town. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make and lay bricks.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 6 children. 

Elenita has had a food shop or "sari-sari" store for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Elenita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 49-years-old, married to Joseph and they have two children. She has been operating a hotel and selling food to her clients for the last 22 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 13,600.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET ltd of Kes 10,000. She will use the loan to buy wheat flour rice, vegetables and cooking oil for cooking in the hotel. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits she will save and buy sheep.

She hopes to venture into livestock farming by buying sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and wheat flour for hotel use.

loans.name: Version Plus Group

texts.en:
Philo is the leader of the community bank named “Version Plus,” which is composed of nine members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Philo is 45 years old, married, and the mother of four children, whose ages range between 9 and 19 years old. Four of her children attend school. Philo has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2005. She operates a general store in the west of Kinshasa. She works hard and employs good management skills in order to realize her dream of someday becoming a main provider in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which currently earns her US $180 per week. Philo has already obtained and correctly repaid 21 loans from microfinance institution and Kiva partner HOPE DRC. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying four sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, two boxes of cans, and two boxes of soap to resell at a profit.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying four sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, two boxes of cans, and two boxes of soap to resell at a profit

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es: Arnulto habitante de Col.San Martin, desde hace aproximadamente 10 años acostumbra a realizar diferentes tipos de cultivos, los cuales se convierten en su principal actividad economica para el bienestar de su familia,  tambien hay que mencionar que se dedica al cuido de su pequeño inventario ganadero, estas actividades las realiza en conjunto con su conyuge de vida, nesecita este financiamiento para invertirlo en establecimiento de 2 Mzs del cultivo de Yuca, con lo que pretende realizar un buen manejo tecnico, esperando incrementar la produccion de dicho cultivo y fortalecer su economia, referencias lo consideran como una persona  trabajadora, responsable y de buenas culturas, desde ya agradece el apoyo a su solicitud para llevar a cabo proyecto agricola.

loans.use: Siembra de yuca

loans.name: Elias Isaias

texts.es:
Elias es un joven de 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, se cultivan productos típicos de la zona como son los pallares, frejoles, uva, algodón, entre otros. Co n cada amanecer Elias sale a trabajar como chofer de mototaxi, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, el cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y también porque conduce de manera responsable. 

Elias está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han  brindado el podrá comprar  una mototaxi, ya que actualmente la que conduce es alquilada, de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder tener un vehículo propio, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Elías, 28, is a young man who lives in the city of Ica which is known for its warm, welcoming climate.  The typical crops grown in the area are lima beans, beans, grapes, cotton and others.  Every morning Elías goes out with his motor-taxi and spends about nine hours a day attending to up to 15 customers.  He believes his business is doing well because he is kind to customers and drives responsibly.

Elías is very grateful to Kive lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy his own motor taxi.  He rents the one he currently uses, so he will be able to increase his income with his own vehicle.  This will allow him to continue in his daily struggle toward reaching his goal:  "To have his own home".

loans.use: To buy a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Ana Leonor

texts.es: Debido a los bajos ingresos que Ana obtiene en su negocio de venta de tortillas, las mejoras de su casa las realiza bajo un esquema de vivienda progresiva. Ha solicitado varios préstamos para lograr hacerlo. Con el crédito anterior compró materiales de construcción y mejoró parte de su vivienda, lo mismo que hará con este préstamo, ya que sus planes son poder llegar a tener una vida digna junto a sus hijos, por quienes ha luchado toda su vida para darles una vivienda digna.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construcción para continuar con mejora de su vivienda

loans.name: Haifa's Group

texts.en:
Haifa is a member of this group from Iraq. Haifa is 48 years old widow mother of one . Haifa started her sewing business five years ago with an old sewing machine. 
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provide for divorced and widow women to buy embroidery machine to help her increase her income.
She aims to open big place for her business and create jobs for other women.
The story of Haifa and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Haifa's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy embroidery machine.

loans.name: Imonlede Group

texts.fr: IMONLEDE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Irène (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans. Irène a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Irène est mariée à un certain Bienvenu. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Irène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Irène vend des biscuits, des conserves et du pain sucré dans sa région depuis dix ans. Irène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Irène sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe IMONLEDE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des biscuits, des conserves et du pain sucré.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan  es casado y tiene dos hijos,estudió en la escuela hasta cuarto grado luego se dedico a trabajar con su padre y hermanos en labores de agricultura y ganadería. El señor Juan quiere adquirir un sistema solar para poder  alumbrarse por las madrugadas y su esposa pueda cuidar mejor a los niños. El señor Juan estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.

loans.use: Sistema Solar de 65 watts

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Ms. Marie B. was born in Lomé in 1960. She is a married mother of two children and also takes care of her uncle’s two children. She is a trained hairdresser but no longer works as one because of the location of the salon. She is now in the business of selling cosmetics and soap (Lagosdi). It is a profitable business that allows her to earn a substantial income. Her husband is a driver who no longer has a car, so Ms. Marie B. is responsible for all of the family’s expenses.

She is requesting a loan of $1000, which will serve as the capital to buy cosmetics and soap. She will thus be able to earn a greater income and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Marie est née à Lomé en 1960. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) enfants de son oncle paternel. Coiffeuse de formation, elle n’exerce plus cette activité à cause de la situation géographique de l’atelier. Actuellement, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de la vente des produits cosmétiques et savons (Lagosdi). C’est une activité rentable qui lui procure un revenu substantiel. Son mari est un chauffeur qui n’a plus de voiture. Alors toutes les charges se reposent sur Madame B. Marie.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour l’achat des produits cosmétiques et savons. Elle pourra alors dégager des revenus conséquents en vue de l’amélioration des conditions de vie sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and soap

loans.name: Hj. Kasem

texts.en: H. K. is a 47-year-old married woman. All of her children are married and live separately. However, one of her children helps her to run the grocery store everyday. She sells household goods, which she buys from Sepatan market nearby. She is a member of MBK and requests a $50 loan to buy more goods. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Soégnéaméto

texts.en:
At 58 years of age, Mrs. Soégnéaméto K. has seven (07) children. Widowed for almost six years, she alone has to meet the needs of her children, of whom four have abandoned their studies in order to be apprentices. To make ends meet, she buys coconuts on credit, and then transforms them to prepare coconut oil, which is highly appreciated and consumed throughout the area. Often the object of insults and humilation of her creditors, and in danger of using up her supply of coconuts at any point, she is resorting to this plan to obtain a loan of $650. This will help her acquire a coconut farm at low price and then let her exploit it to satisfy in a timely way the demands of her clientele, and especially to increase her income and alleviate her own pain and suffering and that of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 58 ans Madame K. Soégnéaméto est mère de sept (7) enfants. Veuve depuis bientôt six ans, elle fait face seule à tous les besoins de ses enfants dont quatre ont abandonné leurs études pour l’apprentissage. Pour joindre les deux bouts elle achète à crédit des noix de coco qu’elle transforme pour préparer l’huile de coco très apprécié et consommé dans tout le milieu. Souvent objet de tous les injures et humiliation de ses créanciers, et dans le souci de disposer à tout moment de noix, elle a recours à ce projet pour bénéficier d’un crédit de $650. Ceci l’aidera à acquérir une cocoterais à vil prix et de l’exploiter pour satisfaire à temps les demandes de ses clients et surtout pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et alléger les peines et souffrance dont sont victimes elle et sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire a coconut farm at low price and then to exploit it  in order to prepare oil

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina B. B. is 27 and earns her monetary income by weaving beautiful Mayan huipiles, the traditional blouse the women wear in the mountains of western Guatemala. Weaving each huipil takes about two months' work, and she can sell one for almost US$200, making a profit of about US$150. As she has in her loans for the last few years, she'll invest in yarn for the weaving.

Two of Joaquina's four kids are in school, although she herself didn't make it past the second great and can only read a little bit (but she can sign her own name). Her husband works far away and she hasn't seen him for two years, but he faithfully helps with supporting the kids. Joaquina, however, has to take full responsibility for care of the kids. She's a member of the women's group "Flor de Nebaj".

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving huipiles

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa Q. de Mendoze is married and has 7 children. She is part of the association Dinamicas de Villa Tejada in the city of El Alto. Her principal activity is selling cinnamon ice cream, which she buys from a wholesaler to resell in all the fairs and sporting events in El Alto, as well as in La Paz.

Elsa works alone, and with only one provider who enables her to sell the product, she travels to other locations such as Desaguader, Patacamaya, SicaSica, Viacha, Tiwanaku and other cities, and only works Thursday through Sunday. It's been more than 6 years that she's been dedicated to this business, trying to generate sufficient economic resources to maintain her family and her 7 children. Elsa's intention is to be able to count on more capital and buy the product in greater quantity. This will make it possible to gain more business and generate more income.

Elsa Q. de Mendoza, casada y madre de siete hijos, pertenece a la asociación Dinámicas de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto. Su principal actividad es la comercialización de helados de canela, pero ella no los prepara, solo compra al por mayor y revende en todas las ferias y acontecimientos deportivos, tanto en el Alto, como en la ciudad de La Paz. Elsa trabaja sola, y con un solo proveedor quien le da las facilidades para la venta del producto, de esta manera ella realiza viajes a otras localidades, como ser Desaguadero, Patacamaya, SicaSica, Viacha, Tiwanaku y otros, y solo trabaja los días jueves, viernes, sábado y domingos. Ya son más de seis años que se dedica a esta actividad, tratando de generar los recursos económicos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia y a sus siete hijos. La intención de Elsa es poder contar con mayor capital y poder comprar el producto en mayor cantidad, lo que posibilitaría la contratación de dependientes que generen aún más ingresos.

loans.use: To buy her products in greater quantity and increase her income.

loans.name: Abdalah

texts.en:
Abdalah, age 42, is the father of 3 boys. He and his wife have started businesses within the past two years to support their family. In February 2006, Abdalah opened a shop where he sells vegetables, sodas, ice pops, and general-needs items. His shop has around 45 customers each day, and he makes a profit of around $9. In the past, Abdalah has taken out two successful loans. He hopes to take out a third loan, which will also be used to build up his shop’s inventory.

In January of this year, Abdalah’s wife was able to open her own breakfast café, which brings a profit of about $2.50 a day. Because of starting these businesses, Abdalah and his wife say that they no longer have problems paying general expenses such as school fees and hospital bills.

Abdalah belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and support one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Davronbeck

texts.en: T. Davronbeck lives in Mastchoh and he is married and has six children. He is the client of MicroInvest since 2006. His loan sums are permanently increased which shows the business stability and business income increase. Mr. Toiriv is very experienced in the livestock business and has the appropriate knowledge that he used in the practice. He has the business in the livestock raising and selling. It is the family business that brings the general family income (his wife is engaged in the milk production and other works). He dreams of the large flock and a horn pedigree bull purchasing. Now Mr.T. requests a loan of 2100 TJS for the pedigree bull purchase.

loans.use: to purchase a horn pedigree bull

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros U., 47, is a farmer growing seasonal rice crops. She typically makes around $2 each day. Her husband works at a carpentry store and generally makes around $5 each day. One of her children is employed by a nearby garment factory and the rest are currently unemployed. Mrs. Ros U. hopes to use this loan to purchase another piece of farmland to grow more of a variety of crops to enable her generate more income for her entire family.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of farmland to grow more of a variety of crops

loans.name: Ignacio Gustavo

texts.es:
Ignacio V. is originally from the city of Leon, specifically from the El Sauce municipality which is Leon's most profitable zone.

Ignacio V. sells milk obtained from his own cows. He raises and cares for these cows with great sacrifice so that they can produce milk and thus remain modest in their dependency on Ignacio.

Despite the economic situation he has traversed, he has maintained his business in his home and this he has managed through loans disbursed by Ceprodel. He has used these loans to purchase cows in order to maximize his profit and thus continue maintaining his household. He has asked for two previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Ignacio V. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de León específicamente del municipio El Sauce que es un lugar muy alejado de la ciudad siendo la zona ganadera de León.

Ignacio V. se dedica a la venta de leche obtenida de sus vacas que con mucho esfuerzo las cuida y alimenta para que produzcan la leche y así mantener a su humilde hogar que tanto necesita de el.

A pesar de la situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado, ha logrado mantener sus ventas en su casa de habitación y esto lo ha hecho a través de los créditos brindados en Ceprodel que los ha invertido en la compra de vaquillas para sacarle el máximo provecho para así seguir manteniendo su hogar. Su record crediticio es de dos créditos.

loans.use: To purchase milking cows

loans.name: Wanyange Lake F F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Esther Maitekyalo. She is currently in the business of sewing clothes and handicrafts making and is requesting a loan to purchase a designing sewing machine. Esther is 38 years old and is married with a husband. She has 4 children ranging from age 7 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Esther makes approximately UGX 91000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children Esther has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Esther is joined in her small group by Christine N., Tapensi M., Milly K., and Nubuwat K.. Christine N. has a business in selling new shoes and wants to buy more stock and start broiler poultry business. Tapensi M. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to start matooke business. Milly K. operates a business of bar and wants to buy a fridge and more equipment. Nubuwat K. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs and is requesting a loan to increase purchases.

loans.use: To add in tailoring business

loans.name: Abla Laurence

texts.fr:
Madame Abla Laurence A. was born July 21, 1970 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two. She is a hair stylist. She began her own salon called <> in 2002 in the district of Agoè in Lomé. She also sells hair extensions and cosmetic products. The high quality of the hair extensions and wigs she offers and the talent she possesses truly show off her professional skill. Her first loan of 300,000 FCFA will help her to purchase more hair extensions that she does not currently have in the salon. She would also like to purchase 150 sachets of the brand of hair extensions called Lora Bred, along with 30 new wigs.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Abla Laurence est née le 21 juillet 1970 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la coiffure. Elle a crée son salon qu’elle nomme « COIFFURE LAURENCE » depuis l’année 2002 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle vend également des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. La qualité des mèches qu’elle offre et le talent qu’elle utilise font d’elle une coiffeuse professionnelle. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir les types de mèches dont elle ne dispose pas dans son salon. Ainsi elle désire acheter 150 sachets de mèches de type outré et Lora Bred et 30 perruques.

loans.use: To purchase locks of hair (hair extensions) and wigs.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza belongs to the San Miguel of Ayacucho Communal Bank. She is from the community that has the same name. It is in a small valley where the majority of the settlers are dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables.

Esperanza lives in a shared home. She is 22 years old and has 5 children. Esperanza is dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables that she sells in the supplies market of the city of Ayacucho. She is also dedicated to the breeding of guinea pigs.

Esperanza needs a loan of 750 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of agricultural supplements, seeds and pesticides.

The dreams of Esperanza are to improve her business and to offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho. Ella es de la comunidad que tiene el mismo nombre, es un valle pequeño donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura de verduras.

Esperanza es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 5 hijos, Esperanza se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Ademas se dedica a la crianza de cuyes.

Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono, semilla y remedios.

Los sueños de Esperanza son mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds and pesticides for her vegatable crop.

loans.name: Saeful

texts.id:
Saeful, his wife and their child live in a rented room. He pays IDR 150 thousand per month (around USD 19/ month) for the rented room. Saeful sells fried chicken for living. He sells the fried chicken in his push cart at Abianbase street in Denpasar Bali. He goes to Abianbase market everyday to buy ingredients for his fried chicken. He got the loan from Dinari in the past and he had alrady paid the loan in full. He is now applying for another loan so he can expand his business.

The revenue that he gets is used to pay the rented room and also to meet his family's daily needs. He also saves some portion of his money for his child's education fund.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Saeful adalah sebagai penjual ayam goreng didekat tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Abianbase Denpasar. Bersama istri dan anaknya Wahyu Ramadhan, mereka tinggal disebuah kamar yang disewa per bulannya Rp.150.000. Setiap harinya Saeful belanja bahan baku di Pasar Abianbase menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya. Penghasilan yang didapat, selain untuk membayar sewa kamar dan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari, juga disisihkan sebagai tabungan untuk pendidikan anaknya kelak. Sebelumnya Saeful sudah pernah mendapatkan pinjaman. Setelah melunasinya, kali ini dia mengajukan lagi penjaman sebagai tambahan modal usaha. Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Saeful B..

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe started his business to help increase his income. In July and August there is a fair in Linares, and he wants to take the opportunity to install his taco stand at the entrance to the fair.

He started his business when his son was small and he was unemployed. He was desperate because he had to buy milk and diapers and his wife was also not working. They decided together to start to sell tacos, and for the last 1-1/2 years they have had a sales stand that they move to different locations.

He needs a loan of US$600, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy raw materials to sell every day during fair season, since now he only sells on weekends. He also needs to repair his meat cooker.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Felipe inició el negocio para ayudarse con un ingreso extra ademas que en estas fechas de julio y agosto se pone la feria en Linares y quiere aprovechar la ocasión para instalar su puesto de tacos a la entrada de la feria. Inicio su negocio cuando se quedo desempleado su hijo estaba pequeño y se desesperaba por que tenia que comprar leche y pañales ademas su esposa no trabajaba entre los 2 decidieron empezar a vender tacos y ahora ya tienen el carreton par las ventas y lo mueven a diferentes lugares desde hace aproximadamente 1 ½ años

El necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para la venta en la temporada de la feria todos los dias ya que actualmente solo vende en fines de semana ademas de la reparacion del comal donde se frie la carne.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Edith Amparo

texts.es:
Edith is a selfless mother of 2 children, whose wishes are to improve every day and this inspires her to continue working. Her husband works in a bakery, and 5 years ago they decided to work delivering the bread that they make. Their goal in the future is to have their own bakery, and to do this they continue working and saving their daily earnings from their baking. Edith is seeking a loan to invest in improving the infrastructure of their bread store, to put in a cement floor and buy more baskets for delivering bread.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Edith es una madre abnegada, tiene 2 hijos, sus deseos de mejorar cada día son los que la impulsan a continuar. Su esposo trabaja en un panadería, y hace 5 años juntos decidieron trabajar repartiendo el pan que ahí elaboran.Su meta a futuro es tener un taller panadero propio, para ello, siguen trabajando y ahorrando las ganancias que día a día les produce esta actividad.Edith solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la mejora de la infraestructura de su almacén de pan, mandarle a hacer un piso de cemento y comprar más canastas para la repartición de pan.

loans.use: improve the floor of her bread store and acquire more baskets to transport her product.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert N. is a 55 year old businessman who sells hardwares. He is married with six children, who are all currently in school. Robert is very hardworking and provides for his family's daily needs. He sells items like radio sets, batteries, touch lights, screwdrivers, machine oil, door locks, and lanterns in Dunkwa, where he lives with his family. He also supports his wife's business selling used clothing, which helps provide for the family.

With this loan, he wants to purchase more goods in order to increase sales. He hopes to rent a container shop that can accommodate all his products. This will ease his cost movements and risk of theft. He is a member of the community group called Anointed Trust Group. In this group, Members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of hardwares to sell.

loans.name: Nasima

texts.ru: Исмоилова Насима жительница Явана. Домохозяйка . Замужем , имеет четверых детей. Имеет одного теленка и давно планировала купить еще одного бычка. Для этог она решила обратиться к нам за получением кредита. Благодоря ему она сможет увеличить хозяйство . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев. Насима замужем и имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Nasima I. lives in the town of Yavan. She is a housewife. She is married and has four children. She has one calf and was planning to buy another one for a long time.
