She has decided to come to us and ask for a loan for this purpose. It will let her increase her business. She will be able to pay off the loan within 10 months. Nasima is also married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Manka Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married with four children and lives in Mankon, near Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in her "buyam sellam" store. More specifically, she will purchase maize, Irish potatoes, beans, yellow yams, calabah yams, and cocoyams. She plans to contribute 100,000 CFA ($200 USD) of her personal savings towards these purchases.

This is Emilia's fifth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004. She has been working in her "buyam sellam" business for a number of years now and has since found herself suppliers for the items she sells; this ensures she gets the best prices on these items. She also now has many customers who come to her for all of their vegetables. She allows some people to create a tab with her for their purchases and pay her at the end of the month.

With the profits from this loan, Emilia plans to send her children to school and support them after school. She will also consider adding other food stuffs to her stall. Her profits will also provide her the security of knowing she can afford hospital bills and health costs.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy maize, Irish potatoes, yellow yams, cocoyams, beans, and calabah yams for retail.

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo y alegría todas las mañanas en el municipio de Chichigalpa la señora Urania se levanta para abrir su negocio de abarroterías atendiendo a sus fieles clientes que le visitan en su establecimiento. 

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias económicas que ella a lo largo de la historia de su negocio ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante apoyándose de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha sabido invertir sabiamente en la compra de mercadería para suplir sus estantes. Hoy en día el crédito solicitado será utilizado para compra de granos básicos para su venta.
texts.en:
Urania gets up every morning with a lot of enthusiasm and joy in the town of Chichigalpa to open up her grocery store where she serves the loyal clients who visit her shop. Despite the difficult economic situations she has had to pass through during the years spent in her business, she has managed to make headway with the help of the Ceprodel loans. She wisely invested the loans into the purchase of goods to replenish her stock. The loan she requests now will be used to purchase grains for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains

loans.name: Landing

texts.fr: Landing est un jeune couturier qui résident à Boucotte Centre, un des grands quartiers de Ziguinchor. Il demande ce crédit pour accroître ses revenus en cette fin d'année 2008 uù la demande est forte en prêt à porter.
texts.en:
Landing is a young tailor who lives in Boucotte Centre, one of the large neighborhoods in Ziguinchor. He's seeking this loan to increase his profits, since ready-to-wear demand is high during this time of year.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his business

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel G. H. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen 5 años de vivir en su hogar, el señor Juan Manuel G. trabaja actualmente como en cargado de planta en el cual trabaja desde hace 6 meses.
El señor Juan Manuel está solicitando un préstamo para comprar vitropiso e instalarlo en su casa, (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Juan Manuel, sino aparecen su esposa y sus 2 hijos). Estas mejoras a su hogar permitirán que el señor Juan Manuel y su familia tengan un hogar óptimo para vivir.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel G. H. is married; he lives with his wife and two children. They have been living in this house for the past five years. Juan Manuel G. is currently working as a plant supervisor, a job he has held for six months. Juan Manuel is asking for a loan to buy and install floor tiles in his home. Juan Manuel was unavailable at the time the picture was taken, so his wife and two children were photographed instead. These home improvements will ensure that Juan Manuel and his family have an optimal home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy floor tiles.

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr: A. Laure est âgée de 29 ans et est propriétaire d’un magasin de produits de beauté à Lomé. Elle détient cette activité depuis 3 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en alimentant sa boutique de nouveaux produits pouvant lui permettre de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Laure is 29 years old and owns a beauty products store Lomé. She has been in this business for three years and would like to use this loan to expand her commerce by stocking her boutique with new products. This would enable her to satisfy the demands of her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her boutique

loans.name: Roman

texts.en: Roman is 22 years old. This single man has an orchard. Roman lives in the Khachmaz region, in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. Two years ago, he started this business. Now he requests a loan of $2500 (2000 AZN) to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides for improving his orchard.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides for the orchard

loans.name: Balywunya Mixed Group

texts.en:
Sarah makes necklaces and bracelets through a program called Beads-4-life. She has also has a lively bar in Mukono. Sarah has been running her bar for about 10 years, but it was only about seven months ago that she began making jewelry.

To make her jewelry, Sarah uses beads that are made from paper that is dipped in glue. This style of beads is very common in Uganda. It is a day-long process to prepare the beads. First, she must cut and roll the paper, then she shapes each individual bead, and dips it in the glue mixture. After the beads are formed, they are left in the sun to dry overnight. The following day, Sarah will be able to make 10 necklaces and 10 bracelets.

Sarah sells her completed jewelry to some sellers in Kampala. She can sell her bracelets for 3,000 or 5,000 USH. Her necklaces range from 1,5000 to 6,000 USH. Since she buys her equipment for about 4,000 USH, she is able to make a nice profit from this new business venture.

Sarah and her husband have separated. She has two children who are both adults, but she looks after her five grandchildren. She provides for their daily needs while their parents work.

Today, Sarah is requesting a loan of 300,000 USH. With this loan, Sarah will restock her bar, buy crates of soda and beer, and also buy a few kilos of paper for her bead work.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for bead-making and restock her bar.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa A. est une jeune femme de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle tient une baraque au bord de la route dans laquelle elle étale divers articles. Akossiwa souhaite avec ce crédit approvisionner sa baraque afin d’accroître la taille de son entreprise.
texts.en:
Akossiwa A. is a young woman, 37 years old, married, and the mother of two. She has a roadside stand in which she displays various items. She would like to use this loan to supply her stand in order to expand her enterprise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her stall

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San Y., 52, and her husband, Mr. Soeun Saing, 54, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their sons do construction work with their father, and the other two children assist their mother in her farming business.

San has been a farmer for twenty years. Her husband has been a wooden-house builder for three years. The couple is in the process of building a new house but they lack some money to finish it. So San is asking for a loan of $1,000 to add to her own money to purchase construction materials to finish her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to finish her house

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina P. is 46 years old and makes a living producing soy sauce in her peaceful village, Barangay Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Rogelio, who is 45 years old and works as a security guard at the San Miguel Corporation. They are blessed with 5 children: Alexander, 28 years old and a driver-mechanic in Dubai; Primo, 25 years old and a helper in the San Miguel Corporation; Arsenio, 19 years old and currently in his third year of college; Divina Grace,16 years old and a freshmen college student; and Angelica, 9 years old and in grade school. 

Rina works hard to make her soy sauce, and delivers it in boxes to general stores in their village and other ones nearby. She currently invests part of her profits in the business and uses the rest to meet her daily needs and pay her children’s tuition fees and school allowances. Rina has applied for this loan to expanded her business, generate a higher income and provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: To expand a small manufacturing business

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 3 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins  4 enfants.
Elles cultivent uniquement  de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Benkadi 3 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre   prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 3 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du  prêt de Soro Yiriwaso  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 3 is a group of married women of the Sirakélé neighborhood in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large extended traditional families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc. They average 35 years of age and have at least 4 children. Their businesses consist in growing peanuts. Eager to make their farming activities profitable, the members of the Benkadi 3 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago.

After four loans that were repaid without problems, they are now seeking their fifth farming loan, which will be used to buy, at the grand market in Koutiala, peanut seeds, small material, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to increase their market value, before being sold at the grand market in Koutiala and in the surrounding villages, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After the sale of their production, the members of the Benkadi 3 group count on turning a profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 140) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seed, small material, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Bernie Joy

texts.en:
Bernie Joy T. is from the town of Misom, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and married. To make a living, Bernie Joy raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Bernie Joy is just starting this business.

In 2007, Bernie Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernie Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Bernie Joy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Bernie Joy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: King Solomon Group

texts.en:
Kate is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She is a baker. Kate bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers. She also engage "hawk" selling in her community in the mornings. 

Kate is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘King Solomon’. She is first from left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell their goods on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Ndèye Marie

texts.fr: Ndèye Marie F. est une femme de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des mangues sur un étal qu’elle tient. Les revenus générés lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de leur assurer une bonne scolarité et une meilleure santé.
texts.en:
Ndèye Marie F. is a 52 year old woman who is married and is the mother of 4 children.She has a stand where she sells mangoes. The revenues generated allow her to improve the living conditions of her family and to assure them good schooling and better health.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of seasonal fruits such as mangoes

loans.name: Sekinatu

texts.en:
Sekinatu sells clothing materials and the fabrics that are used to make native clothing. She sells clothing in different styles based on customer demand. She goes to Lagos Island twice every month to purchase these goods. She has been in this trade for five years and, with patience, has groomed her business to this level. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase clothing materials to sell. 

Sekinatu is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. 

"Loans from LAPO have greatly improved my business and family life. I am grateful to all who make this loan accessible," says Sekinatu.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a small hand-made mill

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is divorced and has two adult children. She owns a small store and sells food and groceries. The income is about 3,500 UAH per month. This business is the only source of income for Natalya. Her goal is to make enough money to provide for herself and help her children. So, Natalya wants to develop this business further and increase the sales. Natalya would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase more inventories. She is very enthusiastic person and desires to move forward in her business as well as in her life.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’est lancée en 2006 dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier d’Adidoadin à Lomé ; elle exerce cette activité pour pouvoir apporter sa contribution financière dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants. Elle approvisionne presque tout son voisinage et est fière de son activité. Elle a besoin en ce moment de renouveler son stock en état d’épuisement ; c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 paniers de tomates naturelles, 02 paniers de gingembres, 25 litres d’huiles de palmes et bien d’autres ingrédients nécessaires.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Abondio

texts.en:
Abondio S. is currently in the business of selling beans, pulses and rice and is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour to sell. Abondio is 42 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up stores of her goods.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour to sell

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Cañaveral” esta representada por la señora Sonia  y conformada por 13 miembros en su mayoría mujeres bien trabajadoras y emprendedoras como lo demuestran en su puestos D. trabajo, cada una D. ellas se dedica a  diferentes actividades D. tipo comercial como la venta y confección D. prendas D. vestir, venta  D. comida, refrigerios,  servicio D. trasporte, servicio D. construcción  y gaseosas.  Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios el nivel competitivo es alto en especial para los socios que tienen poca mercadería  y no pueden competir con las grandes tiendas  que pueden abaratar sus costos y seguir en la competencia, pero las socias tienen mucha experiencia y ganas D. trabajar con el incentivo D. sacar adelante a sus familias que es su impulso para salir adelante. El destino del préstamo es para incrementar su mercadería así como la compra D. insumos y materiales que ayuden a obtener un mejor capital D. trabajo para hacer frente a la competencia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo por lo que no tienen mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero tienen muchos deseos D. crecer y este deseo les impulsa a seguir adelante para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia is the communal bank “Cañaveral’s” representative. The bank has 13 members who are mostly hard working entrepreneurial women whose jobs demonstrate this. Each woman works in a different type of commercial business like seamstress, food sales, refreshments, transportation services, construction, and the sale of soft drinks. In the field of goods and services, competition is high and in particular for those members who do not have much merchandise. They cannot compete with the bigger stores that can lower their costs and still remain competitive. However, the bank's members have a lot of experience and are motivated by a desire to help their families get ahead. The loan is to increase merchandise. For example, to purchase supplies and materials that can help them get better working capital so they can stand up to the competition. This is the bank members first loan cycle, so they do not have much experience in solidarity groups, but they do have a great desire to grow. This desire pushes them to get ahead to proviD. their families with a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, KI. Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya de l’association Bolodignogoma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le  commerce d’articles divers. Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et tous les trois prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de charbon de bois et  des savons. Elles s’approvisionnent  sur place et dans les villages environnants et sont revendus sur place à Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  Elles envisagent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group of the Bolodignogoma association are married women with an average age of 36 and 5 children . They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the city of Dioïla, located in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region in Mali.

They know each other through their ties of community and kinship. These women sell various items, and they have incorporated the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to sustain their lucrative business. They are in their fourth group loan and all three previous loans have been properly reimbursed.

With this loan they plan to buy a large quantity of charcoal and soaps. They supply themselves locally and from surrounding villages, reselling on site in Dioïla to a clientele of women and men. They plan to make a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA per person. The profits are partly reinvested in their business, with the rest going towards daily family expenses.


Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal and soaps

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca G. is from Bongbong, Ozamiz City. She is 59 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Francisca owns and operates a business making and selling foods, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for eighteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Francisca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Francisca is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom Y. is a villager in Yok Bat village in Kandal province and she owns a small restaurant selling Chinese noodles. In this business, she now has a small problem because she does not have money to buy tables and chairs for her business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy these. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are teachers while the others help her at the business.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El K. is married and blessed with five children. Three of her kids are employed in different occupations, while the other two are studying at the local public school. 

El K. weaves bamboo baskets at her home. She makes many sets of baskets before selling out. She provides her finished baskets to her husband to sell around the community. Recently, the raw material was exhausted. El K. hopes to acquire more, but she doesn’t have money yet to buy it. Thus, she is looking for a loan to purchase bamboo to make more baskets.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo.

loans.name: Teddie

texts.en:
Teddie T., 60 years old, has two children and her eldest child is only four years old.

Teddie told CEVI that farming is her only source of livelihood. Ever since she was a little girl, her parents were farmers and everything she learned about growing plants came from them.

Teddie would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda L. is from the village of Brgy Ibung, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Rosalinda is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. She plants and harvests fruit and vegetables to sell. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Lirio Elizabeth

texts.en:
Lirio Elizabeth C. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Lirio Elizabeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lirio Elizabeth owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lirio Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lirio Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lirio Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lirio Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lirio Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Floria

texts.es:
Floria tiene 50 años, es una persona sumamente pacifica, honrada y trabajadora, vive con Teófilo de 60 años, tiene 11 hijos pero sólo viven en su casa propia con los 5 menores de edad.

Atender a sus clientes y sugerirles las prendas más adecuadas es lo que más le gusta; por eso todos los días, desde hace 3 años, alista su mercadería (ropa y zapatillas) para ofrecer a sus vecinos puerta por puerta o en cualquier reunión que se le presente. Adicionalmente, aproximadamente desde las 4 de la tarde vende salchipollo (pollo frito acompañado con papas fritas y ensalada) en frente de su vivienda; mientras que su esposo lleva 30 años plantando café, maíz, plátano y palta en sus chacras propias.
Estos oficios les permiten vivir cómodamente y sin preocupaciones, pues ambos disfrutan de sus quehaceres. Como ella tiene un espacio disponible en su domicilio donde también vende bebidas, pretende comprar comestibles y otros enseres para instalar una pequeña tienda.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque le enseñaron a valorar sus actividades y su persona. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar uniformes escolares, ropa, zapatos y zapatillas, debido a la temporada de inicio de clases.
texts.en:
Floria is 50 years old and she is very peaceful, honest, and hard working. She lives with Teófilo, 60 years old. She has 11 children, but only the 5 youngest live with them. She enjoys attending to her customers and suggesting the best clothing for them. For the past three years she prepares her merchandise (clothing and slippers) to offer to her neighbors door to door or at whatever occasion that comes up. She also sells “salchipollo” (fried chicken sausage with potatoes and salad) in front of her house in the evenings. Her husband has spent the past 30 years raising coffee, corn, bananas, and silver on his own farms. These jobs allow them to live comfortably without worry, and they each enjoy their chores. She also has a space set aside in her home, where she sells drinks. She is buying food items and other items in order to set up a small store. This will be her second loan through MFP. She likes working with her communal bank because they have taught her how to value her activities and personality. She will use the money from this loan to buy school uniforms, clothing, and shoes and slippers, because classes are beginning.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene una mirada sincera y es un visionario neto, tiene 21 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en la comunidad de Puerto Naranjal, ubicada en la selva ayacuchana, donde reside en casa de su madre.

Desde muy niño le gustó estar en el campo, en aquellas épocas sus padres se dedicaban a la actividad agrícola y él siguió los mismos pasos, de lo que no se arrepiente. Con todo lo aprendido incursionó en el cultivo de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, poco a poco fue creciendo en su producción y ganancias, y aunque existen rezagos del terrorismo en su zona sabe que con mucho esfuerzo puede forjarse un futuro prometedor. Regularmente recibe la ayuda de sus padres, pero en también contrata peones para los trabajos en sus chacras. Sus productos, los vende en los centros de acopio de una localidad aledaña, y en un futuro cercano piensa adquirir más terrenos con la finalidad de producir en mayor cantidad y por consiguiente abastecer a más comerciantes.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy a gusto por el crédito rápido, por lo que se compromete  a cumplir con todas sus cuotas establecidas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará insumos y abono para darle mayor fertilidad a su tierra, por ende producirá con mayor calidad y sus productos tendrán un precio más competitivo.
texts.en:
Roger has a sincere look and a clear visionary. He is 21 years old, single, and does not have any children. He lives in the Puerto Naranjal community, located in the jungle of Ayacucho, where he lives in a house with his mother.

He liked being in the countryside since he was very young. At that time, his parents worked in agriculture and he followed the same footsteps, which he does not regret. With everything learned, he began in cacao, coffee, and citrus fruit production. Little by little he increased his production and earnings and although effects of terrorism in the area still remain, he knows that with hard work he can create a promising future. He usually has the help of his parents, but he also hires workers for the jobs on his farmlands. He sells his products in the wholesale centers of a neighboring town. In the near future, he plans to purchase more lands with the aim of producing more crops and obtaining more businessmen.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is happy for the quick funding, which he promises to repay according to the established schedule. With the loan requested, he will purchase consumables and fertilizer so that his lands will be more fertile, which will provide better quality products and they will have a more competitive price.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Yakka

texts.en:
Yakha D. is 38 years old and happily married to her husband, who is a businessman.  They have two girls in primary school.  She owns a shop selling bicycle parts and building materials. She has been in this business for over 15 years. 

Yakha has been a LAPOSL client for over a year and has taken three previous loans that helped her to expand her business. Yakha used the profit to take care of herself and family.  Now she is seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy bicycle parts and building materials.

loans.name: Jesús Víctor

texts.es:
Jesús Víctor C. D., tiene la edad de 51 años, está soltero, y vive solo. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar los insumos necesarios ( abono y el fertilizates )para el café. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jesús también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 
About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jesús Víctor C. D. is 51 years old, single, and lives alone. His loan will be used for attending to his farm, specifically for growing coffee. He plans to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can adequately maintain his coffee crop in order to obtain better quality and the best price when it is time to harvest. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided.

Don Jesús has been farming for many years. He hopes to provide a better quality of life and greater financial stability for his family. In addition, he wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Sawran's Group

texts.en:
Sawran, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of A. R.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it for the last 25 years.

A very skillful lady, Sawran operates a business making embroidered dresses. She receives orders for dresses from her relatives and from the neighbors as well. She charges PKR 500 for each embroidered dress. She has been doing this work for the last six years. Her business provides most of the support for her family. She uses her income to pay for the utilities.

Her husband is a loader by profession. He loads different items on his donkey cart and delivers them to the required places to earn income. He has been doing this work for the past five years. Sawran is applying for a loan from Asasah. She will invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase a new cart because the old cart has become rough and rotted, which makes it difficult for him to load items.

loans.use: Purchase a new donkey cart for transporting materials.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz A., 50 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in a fishing and fish-vending business. She lives in Barangay Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Lino, who is a 55-year-old fisherman, and their seven children. Of her children, four are adults and three are of school age. Ma. Luz has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000. Ma. Luz is now borrowing Php 21,000 so that she can buy materials to repair her fishing boat. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Luz aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Hagah

texts.en: Hagah E. smokes fish to sell at Abura.  Hagah has no educational background.  She is divorced and has three children. Hagah has been selling smoked fish for 10 years. She has been responsible for paying school fees and utility bills after her divorce. The loan she wishes to receive will be used to buy more fish to smoke (a way of processing fish to keep it longer before it goes bad) for sale. She is hoping to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a meaningful education for her children. At the time of visit, Hagah was dressing the fish to be smoked.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke

loans.name: Mrs. Kuoy Vay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who have been selected. Mrs. Kuoy V., who is 37 years old, is the village bank president located in Koun Chreae village, Kandal province.  Each member will use their portion of the loan in various ways that can improve their lives.

Mrs. Kuoy V. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare of land for cultivating rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sung Ty, is a construction worker.  Although they do work a lot, they earn little income, so to improve their family's standard of living, Mrs. Kuoy V. is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat to start a new business and with the rest of the loan she will hire a plowing machine to plow her field. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Priska

texts.en:
Priska is 60 years old. She is a widowed mother of 7 children. Two of her children are still attending school. She has been practicing mixed farming for over 20 years and has employed one farm-hand. Her main products are maize, beans, coffee, milk, millet and vegetables which she sells to the local market.

Priska has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.40,000 to expand her cereal business. This loan will enable her to provide enough food for her grandchildren and the extra income will help her educate her children. She faces the challenges of poor weather patterns, lack of proper market for her commodities and the high cost of farm materials.

She plans to stock more cereals for sale and acquire another dairy cow in the future. She is equally grateful to Juhudi for the support and appreciates the help it has given her so far.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alain de 38 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Maritza comienza con el cuidado de sus tierras, ya que sabe que la calidad que obtengan de la papa y manzanilla que cultiva, dependerán las ganancias que obtenga por su venta. Sus cultivos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es donde mejores precios obtiene. Lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, sin embargo lo más difícil es transportar sus productos. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar sus cultivos, motivo por el cual está en planes de comprar más chacras. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siente que el crédito le será muy beneficioso y así poco a poco podrá mejorar su vida. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de sus pagos. Con los trescientos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de manzanilla.
texts.en:
Maritza, 38, is a cheerful, hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Alain, 38, and her two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Maritza begins caring for her fields very early in the morning every day because she knows that the quality of her potato and chamomile crops determines the profits she’ll get from their sale. She sells her crops in the city of Tarma’s wholesale market because that’s where she gets the best prices. She has been in this line of work for 19 years. What she most enjoys about it is planting. However, the most difficult part of it is transporting her crops. In time, she’d like to expand her crops so she is planning on buying more fields. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she feels that the loan will be very useful in that she will be able to gradually improve her life. She is a very responsible member of her communal group and is always careful to make her payments on time. She will use the requested 300 soles to buy chamomile seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chamomile seeds.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Martha Alicia G. tiene tiempo dedicándose a la venta de productos naturales.
Solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra de productos, ya que tiene varios pedidos para entregar.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo el señor Mauricio Linan se encargara de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Martha Alicia G. has worked for a long time selling natural products. She is requesting the loan so that she can invest in her business, since she does not have the necessary capital to buy products, and she has several orders to deliver. She plans to pay off the loan with the income she obtains from her business, since her husband, Mauricio Linan, takes care of the family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in products for her business

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús G. E. de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su única hija de 13 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Manuel es padre soltero, quien trabaja en su propio negocio el cual es un fotoestudio en el que se encarga de tomar fotos para diferentes ocasiones y así también comercializa diferentes productos como portarretratos, rollos para cámara entre otros más. Desde hace 8 años que se dedica a este oficio, y es muy conocido en la zona de Colón por su excelente trabajo, Manuel cuenta con muchos beneficios entre los cuales están: la excelente ubicación, debido a que se encuentra sobre la calle principal de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual reside junto a su hija. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual se le facilite el modernizar su fotoestudio, comprando cámaras digitales, diferentes tamaños de flashes y otros accesorios más los cuales son básicos en este tipo de negocio. Todo esto lo hace con fin de mejorar sus servicios y de esta forma contar con más clientela.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús G. E. is 42 years old and lives with his only daughter who is thirteen years old and studies. Manuel is a single father and works in his own photography studio business where he takes photos for different occasions and also sells different products such as picture frames and rolls of film amongst others. He has worked in this business for eight years and is known in the area of Colón for his excellent work. Manuel's business has many positive aspects including a great location on the main street of Sonsonate, which is where he lives with his daughter. He is requesting a loan so that he can modernise his photography studio and purchase digital cameras, different flash sizes and other basic accessories. He plans to do this to improve his service and gain more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of accessories for a photography studio

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad says every day is wonderful because she spends it in the company of children. She has been running her in-home day care center since 2003, but her experience extends decades back. She is married and is the mother of three grown children.

Trinidad received a loan from ACCION USA to make improvements to her in-home day care. She is refinishing her floors, painting and purchasing some new toys and practical items for the children. As a licensed day care provider, she is required to make these improvements. 

This is the restructured version of Trinidad’s previous loan http://www.kiva.org/lend/114100 . With the aid of her daughter, Trinidad will continue working to strengthen her business and have a greater influence on her community.

loans.use: New flooring and paint for her home-based business as well as new toys and playpens

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati G. is married and has five dependents. She is married to a driver and has no educational background. Fati is into the sale of cassava, onions, plantain and cocoyams at Abura. She has been in this business for eighteen years now. She will use the loan to purchase more of her foodstuffs for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her business to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: purchase more of her foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth A.  is currently in the business of operating a small business selling food stalls like yams, cassava, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more cassava to sell. Beth is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou N. is a married woman who lives in Bgry. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a canteen and a peanut-butter business. Her husband, Rolando N., who is 34 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living. They have two children who are 6 and 9 years old and are currently going to school. 

Marilou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired after something better for her family. With the help of her past eleven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilou has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her twelfth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her peanut-butter business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Marilou N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Quennie

texts.en:
Quennie M. is from the town of Leon B. Postigo. She is 32 years old. Quennie is married. To make a living, Quennie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. Quennie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Quennie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Quennie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 150,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Quennie is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Quennie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and labor

loans.name: Ann Wanjiru

texts.en:
Ann has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. She is 38 years old and married to Benson Ng’ero. They are blessed with three children, all of which go to school.

She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer from KADET's Ndunyu Njeru office, and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan of 35,000 kshs in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to pay for fertilizer, seedlings, and labour.

In the future she hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, seedlings and labour

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 25 años de edad, convive con Víctor  de 30 años y tienen dos hijas, Mayra de 05 años y Abel de 02 años de edad. Juntos viven en su propia casa en el distrito de Quimbiri. Dina, es  una mujer muy luchadora con ganas de sobre salir  y triunfar en la vida,  su actividad  rutinaria es apoyar a su pareja en la elaboración de  ladrillos de construcción. En el mundo de la ladrillerilla viene trabajando como 06 años; su almacén se encuentra en el populoso distrito de Quimbiri, también cuenta  con el apoyo de sus trabajadores quienes se encargan del proceso y reparto a domicilios. Existe mucha demanda en su negocio, atiende pedidos y abastece a diferentes distritos de la zona del Valle Río Apurimac como son: Pichari, San Francisco. Tiene proyectado comprar un carro de carga  para poder trasladar  su mercadería  y así reducir gastos en el alquiler del transporte. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual, además se siente satisfecho con su banco comunal, por los beneficios que permite. Con el monto solicitado le servirá para el pago de sus jornaleros e invertir en adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Dina is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner, 30 year-old Víctor, and they have two daughters: 5 year-old Mayra and 2 year-old Abel.  They live in their own home in Quimbiri district.

Dina is a very hard-working woman who has the desire to get ahead and be successful in life.  Her business activity is supporting her partner in making bricks.  She has been working in the brick-making industry for 6 years.  Her store is located in the densely-populated district of Quimbiri.  Dina also has the support of her workers who take care of making the bricks and delivering them to people's homes.  There is a lot of demand in Dina's business.  She fills orders and supplies different districts of Valle Río Apurimac such as Pichari and San Francisco.

Dina is planning to buy a new hand truck to help her move her merchandise and thereby reduce costs in hiring transportation.  This is her fifth loan with MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments on time.  She feels happy with her community bank because of the benefits it gives her.  She will use the loan money to pay her day laborers and to invest in acquiring raw material for making bricks.

loans.use: To buy material for making bricks and to hire workers to help her in her work

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. is single and has no children, but she does take care of her sister. She lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in Kampala in a home that she rents. She has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding her and her sister.

Hadjah sells charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years and works seven days a week. Hadjah sells her charcoal from home. She also gets some additional income from hiring out her motorcycle. Her main problems include seasonality and defaulters.

Hadjah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goal is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Gaburira Bakyara Twetungure-, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
Winnie T. is the leader of Gaburira Bakyara Twetungure group, Ntungamo.  She is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children. 

Winnie has a business selling bananas from Ndoragi, from which she is able to make 50,000 UGX in weekly profits. She sells by the side of the road to various customers and has been in this business for 20 years. She is also involved in agriculture and her former business was selling used clothes. 

Winnie is social and hardworking and she is grateful that a friend introduced her to this prospering business. Winnie needs a loan to be able to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda P. is from the village of La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old. Brenda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns & operates a small retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Brenda is just starting this business.

In 2011, Brenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Brenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Bolortulga

texts.en: Mr. Bolortulga is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His elder son attends school, while the younger one attends a nursery school. Bolortulga’s wife rents a stall and sells spare parts for mobile phones. Mr. Bolortulga works as a truck driver for a private company. Bolortuga’s family lives in a one-bedroom rented apartment. In his spare time, he operates a taxi business to earn extra money. He uses his family's old car for this. Bolortulga is applying for a loan to replace this old car with a newer one.

loans.use: To replace an older car

loans.name: Pimwa

texts.en: Pimwa is a thirty-seven year-old married man, with four children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in his retail shop for seven years.  He started with capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. His hardship is high transportation costs, and his vision is to become a wholesaler.  Pimwa needs the loan to buy iron sheets, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gelinda

texts.en:
Ma. Gelinda is engaged in a fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman and Ma. Gelinda sells all his catch to the market. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other supplies. She believes this will help her husband catch more fish. Ma. Gelinda works hard to improve their business and earnings.

Ma. Gelinda is 35 years old and has children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other supplies

loans.name: Raquel Castro Group

texts.en:
Raquel C. is 37 years old and is from the village of Esperanza West. She is the group leader of the Raquel C. Group, an eight-member group loan with ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Raquel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. Raquel's main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Raquel joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase items to expand her store inventory. This is the first loan taken out by Raquel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase items to expand store inventory

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.ar: سوسن امرأة متزوجة وام لأربعة اولاد تعمل في بيع الزهور والشتل الأصطناعية والطبيعية عملها مستمر من اربع سنوات تتميز به كثيرا في محيطها حيث انها تشتهر في منطقتها بجمال الزهور ونظافة المحل وتنوع البضاعة ولكنها تمر الان ببعض المصاعب المادية في تطوير عملها حيث انها تعاني من المنافسة لها حب كبير لعملها وتميز تريد من خلال طلبها قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة لتقوية وضع محلها وتنوع البضاعة فيه تحب اولادها وهي تساعد على اكمال تعليمهم وتريد لهم دائما العيش الرغيد من خلال تأمين كل ما يلزم لعائلتها هي نشيطة محبة للعمل وتعطي ازهارها الحنان
texts.en: Sawsan is a married woman and a mother of four. She works selling real and artificial flowers and plants. Her business has been going for four years now, and it stands out in the area due to its reputation for beautiful flowers, diverse goods, and cleanliness. On the other hand, Sawsan is having some material difficulties right now as a result of the competition in her field, preventing her from developing her business. She has a great love for her work. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods for her store in order to diversify her inventory. She loves her children and is helping to put them through school, and she wants to provide a comfortable life for them by ensuring her family has everything it needs. She is active and likes to work, and she tends to her flowers with care.

loans.use: buy new flowers and plants for her flower store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old, married and has five children. She runs a green grocery to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2000.

She hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and expand her business using her previous loans. She has requested 50,000 Kes to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Boresha Group

texts.en:
Ghati, who is in her late 20's, is a married mother of two children who are attending school. She has been a fish monger for one year now and is able to make a small monthly profit as she works from 4.00 am to 8.30 pm daily.

This will be Ghati's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans, since repaid, to buy a sack of cement, make some bricks and buy more fish to sell. She will use this loan to increase her fish stock and buy a few iron sheets. Her dream is to one day finish building her house.

Ghati will share this loan with her loan group "Boresha" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
La señora Lila es socia del banco comunal Mujeres triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, ya inicio su negocio con el poco dinero que tenia.
Lleva dos años integrando la gran familia de Manuela Ramos. .
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 10 cajas de cerveza, 5 cajas de gaseosas y 2 paquetes de agua mineral.
Su esposo trabaja manejando motocar (servicio de transporte) y no es mucho el dinero que trae a la casa pero sirve para solventar los gastos del día, sus hijos todavía son pequeños y necesitan atención de parte de sus padres. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada por Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Lila is a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 32 years old, married, and has two children.

Lila's business is selling soda and beer.  She started her business with a little money that she had.  She has been a member of the large Manuela Ramos family for two years.

Lila will use her new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy 10 crates of beer, 5 crates of soda and 2 packets of mineral water.  Her husband works driving a car (offering a transport service) and he doesn't bring home much money but it is enough to cover their daily expenses.  Lila's children are still young and need their parents' attention.

Lila is very grateful for the opportunity Manuela Ramos has given her.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and mineral water

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
Javier Antonio es un emprendedor que desde hace algunos años se radicó en Ciudad Bolívar, municipio de Antioquia en donde conoció a su esposa y desde entonces empezaron a trabajar como independientes vendiendo la tradicional oblea y las solteritas, productos típicos de la región, los cuales aprendieron a preparar gracias a una amiga que les enseñó la receta. Sus productos los venden en las calles del municipio todas las tardes, pues en las mañanas se dedican a la preparación. 
 
Javier necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, anilina, leche y azúcar para la elaboración del producto y así continuar mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Javier Antonio is an entrepreneur who has been living for several years in Ciudad Bolívar, in the town of Antioquia where he met his wife.  They began working together selling the traditional "oblea" (wafer) and "solterita" pastry products, which are typical in the region.  They learned the recipe and how to make them from a friend of theirs.  They sell their products in town in the afternoon since they make them in the morning.

Javier needs the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, aniline, milk and sugar to make his products and continue increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en:
Mwahanje is a married man with seven children. Four attend school while three are under age. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting goods from urban areas to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the KES 10,000, he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells vegetables like squash and string beans. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell. Elvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Khadiatu A

texts.en:
Khadiatu is 27 years old and married with one child, age seven. She runs a boutique in Grassfield, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also has three relatives she takes care of as well as her immediate one. 

Khadiatu has owned this business for five years and sells ladieswear, bags, menswear and bamako material at her boutique. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenges to her business are inflation in the dollar rate and customs difficulties.

She has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more boutique items, such as ladieswear, bags and menswear. Khadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her savings. In the future, she would like to expand her business to the provinces.

loans.use: to purchase more boutique items such as ladieswear, bags and menswear.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
40-year-old Anita is a married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old.  Like most people in her town, Anita is engaged in farming. She plants rice and vegetables on her land. She sells her harvest at the market and earns enough for her family's food and other basic needs. She is also able to send her children to school through her earnings.

Anita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to earn more and be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en:
Tsendsuren is a 29-year-old, young Mongolian lady who lives with her fiancé, younger brother and mother on her sister’s plot of land which is located in an outer ger district (district without basic infrastructure) of the capital Ulaanbaatar city. 

Tsendsuren got a specialized bachelor degree in Accounting in 2007 and has worked at local companies for two years. Regardless of her profession, since 2009, she has been operating a clothing business at a small stall in an indoor market. Tsendsuren usually imports her products from Ereen, a border city of China. Her younger brother works in the local province.  

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan from Kiva lenders to import more fall-designed clothes in order to increase her working capital and raise income. She is a repeat client of our NBFI and she wishes to have her own clothing store in the future.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the upcoming season

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda raises and sells pigs as her primary source of income. 

At the age of 26, she needs to work hard to meet the needs of her two children and family. She dreams of lifting her family from poverty, so she works patiently as an owner of a piggery business. She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

She hopes this will make them provide higher prices when they are sold.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Evelyn; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hamburguesas, ella prepara hamburguesas de carne, pollo y salchicha y lo vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 5:00 p.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de hamburguesas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar las hamburguesas como carne, pollo, salchichas y panes al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Wimpillay Chocco Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Evelyn.  She is 27 years old and lives with her partner and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling hamburgers.  She prepares hamburgers with beef, chicken, and sausage, and sells them on foot from 5 p.m. until 11 p.m.

Evelyn gets her children ahead with this business.  She wants to expand and improve her hamburger service.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to make the hamburgers: beef, chicken, sausage, and bread wholesale.

Evelyn is happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make the hamburgers: beef, chicken, sausage, and bread wholesale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years.

Elsa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of goods to sell in her variety store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of goods to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Yer

texts.en: Yer, aged 48 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. She is a single mother with two children; one is studying, and one is working in the garment factory also earning $3 per day. Every month, Yer has to spend $60 on food and $11 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy dirt as fill for her house to prevent it from flooding. The loan will help her family to avoid flooding.

loans.use: To buy dirt as fill for her house to prevent it from flooding

loans.name: Nirvana Group

texts.en:
Bariyah is 31 years old and married with two children.   Her children are 13 and 10 years old.   Her husband is a laborer working on construction projects.  She has been selling items such as coffee, instant noodles, cooked eggs, and pop-ice from her stall for the past two years. She will use this loan to replenish the stock of food and coffee to sell and also to buy gas for her stove to cook noodles and eggs for her customers.  Her business is going well and she can use the income to give money to her children to ride the public van to school.  She also enjoys her business because the supplemental income added to her husband's helps cover the daily expenses of the family. As Bariyah only completed elementary school, she wants to be able to send her children to have better and more education than she had.  

The other group members will use their loans for businesses such as selling used hand phones and selling clothing to customers on credit.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, instant noodles, eggs, and pop-ice to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona es de ciudad del Este,  está casada con el Sr. Humberto y  tienen 3 hijos menores que aún están en la  primaria. 
Ramona tiene una despensa bien surtida y es la única del barrio. Ella se inicio hace varios años con muy pocos productos, pero poco a poco con el pasar de los años logró tener una despensa bien surtida y con buenísima clientela ya que es la única despensa que se encuentra en su comunidad. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus hijos. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, verduras y demás, con lo que podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Está agradecida con kiva y a la fundación por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Ramona is from the city of Este. Her husband’s name is Humberto and they have three young children still in elementary school.

Ramona has a well-supplied grocery store and it is the only one in the neighborhood. She began some years ago with very few products, but little by little with the passing of the years she has managed to have a well stocked store and very good customers because it is the only store in the community. She is a hardworking woman dedicated to her children.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy drinks, foodstuff, dairy, vegetables, and other items so she can stock up and meet the requests of her clients. She is grateful to Kiva and to the community bank for the opportunity that they give her.

loans.use: to buy drinks, foodstuff, dairy, vegetables, and other items

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn (pictured with her loom), age 38, is a widow without children. She lives with her mother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yorn has been a weaver for 20 years. She hopes to continue her weaving business because it’s a traditional business profession. So, she is asking for another loan in the amount of $600 to buy weaving materials.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Enhjargal is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Govi-Altay, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Her elder child is a college student, and the younger one is a student. 

Enhjargal started her grocery retailing business in 1998 by renting a counter. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy supplies. She needs more supplies because she recently bought another counter. She wants to purchase supplies to save for the long winter before prices get too high. Enhjargal is a sharp and hardworking woman who says,"I need to do everything I can to pay my daughter's college fees."
