loans.use: to buy more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is 29 years old.  He is a single man and lives at a rental house that has running water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

With the loan of 20,000 KES he plans to open a vegetable stall and begin a produce selling business by purchasing sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables.  The two main challenges he faces in this business are the high cost of transportation and seasonality. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Teresita has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Teresita has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2005. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 48-years-old who is a single man supporting two people in his family. He has been in the transportation business offering transport services to his clients for the last 5 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 25,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 50,000. He will use the loan to combine with his savings to buy another transport vehicle. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits he will repay the loan.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more vehicles to offer transport services to his customers.

loans.use: to buy another transport vehicle for use.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is happily married with two sons (22 and 25 years old).  She has a secondary school education and has been farming for the past 20 years.  Marine considers herself a hardworking and honest person.  In addition to supporting her family, she also helps her relatives living in Gyumri.  Her son is studying theater and hopes to be a famous actor.  Marine wants her children to live happy lives.  She would like a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.  This investment should increase the family income by fifteen percent.  Marine has a positive opinion of microfinance services and the favorable conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Jesudegbe Group

texts.fr: JESUDEGBE est un groupement composé de vingt trois personnes qui sont des amies de même quartier. Joseline, la représentante du groupement (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Joseline est mariée à un jardinier nommé Rock. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et quatre encore à leur charge. Joseline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par Joseline et sont mari. Pour cette raison, Joseline vend des boissons en canettes et des céréales (maïs, haricot, riz etc) depuis cinq ans environ. De façon secondaire, Joseline vend aussi des fruits de saison ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer au bien n'être et à l'éducation de ses enfants. Joseline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Joseline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESUDEGBE un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons en canettes et des céréales

loans.name: Job Jonathan

texts.es:
Job, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero, pero tiene una hija a quien aprecia mucho, pero por problemas familiares no pudo estar junto a su esposa, él vive con sus padres y trabaja día a día para llevar el ingreso a su hogar.

Job, se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace mucho tiempo, este trabajo lo realiza junto a su padre quien le ha enseñado mucho acerca de este trabajo, decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, porque tiene la oportunidad de vender los productos y subproductos de la ganadería. 

Job, necesita el préstamo para comprar medicamentos para el ganado y para mejorar el corral, porque no dispone del efectivo suficiente para solventar el gasto necesario, además debe comprar concentrado para dar buena alimentación a sus animales.

Job, sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y quiere invertir más en la ganadería.

loans.use: para comprar medicamentos para el ganado y para mejorar el corral.

loans.name: Mahabbat

texts.en: Mahabbat lives with her 3 children in Salyan region Yenikand village. She is a very kind and hard-working person. She has been engaged in this business or 17 years. This 56-year-old woman applies for the loan amount $800 to buy 2 milch cow

loans.use: to buy 2 milch cow

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Tarkem is a 35 years old mother with 2 children. She has been selling household goods before being a member of MBK.  Her husband Tunggon  is a motorcycle taxi driver.  His income is only enough for paying electricity and daily needs. She usually earn $4/day  and she expects to get $50 loan to buy more goods such as rice, kerosene and instant noodles. Hopefully she will not have to ask for her husband’s money to run the business anymore after receiving working capital loan from MBK.  She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Making Fish Crackers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 57 and the mother of eight children. She had difficulty paying her children’s school fees before she started her business. Lydia has been deeply affected by the death of her mother, father, and sister, and by the sickness of her son.

Lydia's business has benefited from one GHAPE loan already, and she paid back that loan on time. With this new loan, she will finish her house and rent it to tenants, from whom she can collect fees. She also serves the community through her food shop; she supplies doughnuts or fries that she cooks every day. She says, with this new profit, she will increase her business.

loans.use: Trading and a preparing a house to rent

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old has a small shop in the Kirkuk market. He has applied to get $1000 to paint the shop and purchase more goods. He live with his family, and he wants to enhance his income and develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: paint the shop and purchase more goods for the shop

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en: Jeneba is thirty three years old and a widow.  She sells palm oil in the open market in Makeni, Sierra Leone.  With her income, Jeneba provides food and education to her three children.  Her previous loan enabled her to purchase thirty five gallons of palm oil in bulk.  As the business is her sole source of income, Jeneba would like to expand the business to earn more profits.  She would like to join the group that sells palm oil to neighboring countries and for these reasons; she is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase sixty gallons of oil for export purposes.

loans.use: Purchase additional palm oil in bulk to begin exporting.

loans.name: Gentcho

texts.en: Gentcho A. lives with his wife in the village of Medkovetz. They are both retired and now have a farming business. More specifically, they breed sheep. Gentcho is applying for a $750 loan, which he will use to buy 10 more sheep for his farm. Any remaining money will be spent on fodder.

loans.use: Purchasing 10 more sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goods for her retail shop and salon.

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en:
Melahet K. owns and operates a store at the market in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Melahet.

She has successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently applying for a loan of $1,200 so she can further expand and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Kenia Rafaela

texts.es:
Eight years ago, Kenia began her small business selling sweets, such as cookies, caramels, and ice cream, from the sidewalk in front of her house. This was due to the difficult economic situation in which she found herself at that time. Her husband was without a job, and it was through her business that she was able to feed and educate her 2 children. She now has a small store selling basic goods, which is the fruit of all those years of work. She offers a variety of basic products, such as basic grains, dairy products, breads and pastries, and non-perishable foods. She spends her whole day working in her business, and she is satisfied with what she has achieved. She has plans to expand the space of the business and also to offer new products, with the goal that her customers can have a better variety of products, brands, and prices. Currently, she wishes to increase the inventory of products that she has, because getting them on credit from the wholesaler is a limiting factor for her. She wants to buy in cash in order to offer her clients better service by having everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Kenia hace 8 años inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo en la acera de su humilde vivienda golosinas como galletas, caramelos y helados, esto surge debido a la difícil situación económica en la que se encontraba en ese momento, ya que su esposo había quedado sin empleo y fue de esta manera como logró alimentar y educar a sus 2 hijos. Hoy en día tiene una pulpería fruto del trabajo de todos estos años, en la cual ofrece una variedad de productos alimenticios de consumo básicos como granos básicos, lácteos, potería, perecederos, entre otros. Esta actividad le dedica todo el día, ella se encuentra satisfecha con lo que ha logrado. Ella tiene planes de expandir el espacio de su negocio y así también poder ofrecer nuevos productos, con el objetivo que sus clientas tengan una mayor variedad de productos, marcas y precios. En estos momentos la señora desea aumentar el inventario de productos que tiene, ya que adquirirlos al crédito de la casa comercial es una limitante, quiere comprar al contado para ofrecerles a sus clientas un mejor servicio en el cual puedan encontrar todo lo que necesitan.

loans.use: To buy milk, cheese, beef, chicken, vegetables, sugar, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is single woman. She owns a small salon and shop, a business she started in 2000. Every day she works from 7 A.M. to 10 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $280.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Maria belongs to the comunal bank called Carmen Cabrejos located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 63 years old and a mother of 4 children. Her husband is a retired teacher. With the first loan Maria received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to have her own business by selling cosmetics.

She continues to sell cosmetics. Her day begans about 7:00 in the mornig to prepare breakfast for her family and she then solely concentrates in selling her cosmetics until about 6:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase lipsticks, nail polishes, etc. Maria is very happy and proud of herself for been able to take care of herself and her family. She's very thankful for all the support she receives for her business from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Cahuide No 568, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es jubilado de educación. Maria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de cosméticos. En la actualidad ella cuenta sigue con su mismo negocio de venta de cosméticos, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de sus cosméticos hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: labiales, rubores, esmaltes para uñas, etc. Maria esta muy contenta y orgullosa, por que ha hecho realidad su sueño de poder trabajar y depender de ella misma, ahora puede apoyar en los gastos de su familia y esto le enorgullece y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
Biviana is 37 years old and she is a manager of a Karaoke Bar. Her family is made up of her husband and their two children.

Biviana has been managing her business for many years and she has earned the support of a great deal of experience in the field and with an ample clientele that she can count on. Many of her clientele are very well to do.

Her loan request is to equip and furnish her business, purchase tables and chairs and other furnishings. Biviana has had a good credit history and she has always met her scheduled payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Biviana de 37 años de edad se dedica a la atención de un Bar cantina y karaoke. Su familia está compuesta por ella su esposo y sus dos hjios. Biviana atiende este local desde hace muchos años atrás, por lo que cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro y también cuenta con amplia clientela. Debido a que es el único local por el lugar es que cuenta con bastante afluencia de gente. La presente solicitud es para el equipamiento de su negocio es decir para la compra de mesas, sillas y otros, cuyos precio varian dependiendo el artículo. Biviana tien bueno antecedentes crediticios y un buen comportamiento en los pagos de sus cuotas.

loans.use: To furnish and equip her business.

loans.name: Kimie

texts.en:
Kimie, 46, wakes up every morning before dawn in order to bake the traditional Tajik bread known as lepyoshka. Kimie was trained as an economist, but, following the collapse of the Soviet Union, she began to bake bread in order to make ends meet. She is divorced and has one daughter who is 25 years old.

Kimie makes 300 pieces of bread per day that she sells at her stall in the nearby bazaar in the city of Isfara. For her small leypyoshka, Kimie charges one somoni (around 30 cents). For the larger lepyoshka that she makes for weddings and other special occasions, she charges 2 somoni. On a normal day, Kimie goes through one 50kg sack of flour that she purchases from a wholesaler at the bazaar for which she pays 140 somoni (slightly over $40).

Kimie says that she would like one day to open a store selling fabric for traditional dresses. She hopes that her Kiva loan will enable her to expand her current bread businesses so that one day she will have the money to be able to realize this dream.

loans.use: To increase volume of goods

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mr. Roeun H., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhen Chhoeun, 22, who live along National Road Number Five about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2007 and have one daughter.

Mr. Roeun has been a Moto-Remorque taxi driver for over one year. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh, while his wife stays at home to take of their small baby who is two months old. The couple is living with their parents and now they are in the process of building their own house but they lack some money. So Roeun is requesting a loan of $200 to add to his own money to build their new house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to build a new house

loans.name: Ni Komang Ita Mahara

texts.id:
Komang Ita Maharani is a rather appropriate name for this mother of two (“Maharani “means queen). The skill involved in creating “Canang” and “Banten” (arrangements out of leaves and flowers used as offerings by Hindu worshippers) was instilled in her when she was a young teenager. The skill was passed on by her parents, who used to sell these items in the market.

Komang takes orders for large religious ceremonies such as “Galungan” and “Kuningan” (which celebrate the arrival of gods and ancestral spirits on earth to dwell in the homes of descendants). Similarly she caters for other events and festivals such as “Odalan”, “Otonan”, and “Ngaben”. Fulfilling these types of orders requires substantial investment.

To ensure that the process of making these prayer offerings is a smooth one, Komang recruits several of her neighbors to get involved, especially if the orders are large and she is running short of time. Komang pays a daily stipend to the people who help her.

Komang has big hopes for the upcoming loan from DINARI foundation (channeled via her village’s central institution). It will support her efforts by ensuring she has necessary and adequate materials needed to make these prayer offerings.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Komang Ita Maharani itulah nama lengkap ibu dari dua orang anak ini. Ketrampilan membuat Canang dan Banten ( sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu ) sudah ditekuninya sejak masih remaja. Ketrampilan ini didapatkan dari orang tuanya yang juga penjual canang sari dan banten dipasar.

Komang juga melayani pesanan untuk sarana persembahyangan besar seperti hari raya Galungan dan Kuningan ataupun acara ritual lainnya yaitu Odalan, Otonan dan Ngaben. Untuk memenuhi pesanan ini dibutuhkan biaya yang cukup banyak

Untuk memperlancar proses pembuatan canangsari dan banten, Komang mengajak beberapa orang tetangganya untuk ikut terlibat dalam proses pembuatannya terutama jika ada pesanan yang jumlahnya sangat banyak dan kejar waktu. Komang juga harus membayar orang yang ikut bekerja ditempatnya dengan hitungan harian.

Dengan adanya pinjaman modal dari yayasan Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga di desanya, besar harapan Komang untuk mendapat pinjaman modal tersebut karena modal ini sangat dibutuhkannya untuk menunjang sarana dalam mencukupi kebutuhan bahan-baku yang diperlukan untuk membuat banten dan canang sari.

loans.use: Increase her working capital so that she can purchase raw materials

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris K. is a 38-year-old woman who is divorced and has two children in school. Doris works very hard to provide food for herself and her children. 

Doris has four years of experience selling goods, such as ladies' bags, shoes, materials and other footwear, in a market center at Obuasi, Ghana. She believes that, with her good human relations skills, and her proximity to the market area, the loan would help her to purchase the right quantity of goods demanded by her loyal customers. She says this would help her make more profit to expand her business and also finance her children's education. 

Doris K. is a member of the Prince trust group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. Her picture was taking when she was visited at her shop.

loans.use: To buy more women shoes, bags, slippers, cloths and materials.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саломова Саида проживает в городе Нурек. Занимается торговлей. Снимает в аренду магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается данным видом деятельности уже 4 года. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет так же увеличить ассортимент товара и получить дополнительную прибыль. Саида еще не замужем , но она полностью содержит родителей и себя. Поэтому ей просто необходимо развивать бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saida S. lives in a town of Nurek. She is engaged in retail sales and leases a store where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Saida wants to obtain a loan and increase her turnover. This will also help her broaden the goods assortment and bring additional profits. Saida is still single; however, she is the sole provider for herself and her family. This is why it is necessary for her business to grow. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: El señor Mario Enrique K. W. desea poner levantar una barda en su casa de block y luego ponerle protecciones. Pero por el momento con el préstamo otorgado quiere empezar la construcción. El vive en una colonia la cual no es muy segura y han surgido robo por lo cual el nos pide la cantidad de 7000 pesos.nnMario Enrique vive solamente con su esposa ella se trabaja en maquiladora y por un accidente de trabajo el Señor K. perdió movilidad en su mano derecha y fue pensionado por la empresa y con estos ingresos pagara el préstamo dado.n
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Enrique K. W. would like to build a wall around his house and eventually, reinforce it. With this loan of 7000 pesos, he will begin construction on this project. He lives in an area that is not very safe and robberies are on the rise. Mario Enrique lives with his wife, who works in a factory. Mr. K. himself was injured at work and lost mobility in his right hand. He will use the pension he receives from his previous employer to make payments on this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora Crecencia, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de chupetes, gelatinas y golosinas. Aprovecha el tipo de clima de la zona para ofertar sus productos. Cuenta con una congeladora que le permite almacenar buena cantidad de chupetes y tiene un personal que vende en las  escuelas de su distrito.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes como azúcar en saco, bolsitas y vasitos para chupetes, colorantes y frutas para la elaboración de sus chupetes, golosinas como caramelos, chocolates, chicles en bolsas, galletas de diferentes marcas y sabores para surtir más su negocio.

Crecencia tiene 59 años de edad y 07 hijos, todos independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo y 02 de sus nietas a quienes cría como sus hijas. Su meta es arreglar su casa para poner una bodega.
texts.en:
Crecencia is a member of the Doradinas in Action Community Bank and lives in the San Martín region of Peru. She makes a living selling popsicles, ice creams and snacks, taking advantage of her area's climate with the products she offers. She has a freezer that allows her to store a good amount of treats and she has an employee who sells items at the local schools. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase ingredients to make and serve her treats, such as sugar, little bags and glasses, food dyes and fruits. She plans to make popsicles and snacks like carmels, chocolates, gums and various types of cookies to better supply her business. Crecencia is 59 years old and has seven children, all of whom are grown up and independent. She now lives with her husband and two granddaughters, whom she cares for as if they were her own children. Her goal is to fix up her home so she can put in a convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make and serve her treats, such as sugar, little bags and glasses, food dyes and fruits.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Paa

texts.en:
Paa K. is 42 years old.  He is single and the father of one child who is in school.  He had an unexpected divorce, so he had to take his child and look after him on his own.  

Paa is very hard working and resourceful to his family.  He trades in charcoal in Abeka of Accra in his neighborhood.  Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes.  Paa obtains his supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Accra.  Such places include the Afram plains and others.  He retails the charcoal to his customers in the market place of Abeka. 

He wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase his inventory.  He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings and pay his child's educational fees.  

He belongs to the community group called Vibrant Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to repay the loan.  Paa wants help for his business.  He says he wants to help his child before leaving earth.

loans.use: Paa wants the loan to buy more bags of charcoal before the raining season.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis acaba de cumplir 38 años, viene conviviendo con su pareja cerca de 11 años, justo la edad que ahora tiene su hijo mayor, y hace 5 meses que nació su segundo hijo de nombre Samuel, cuando se unieron vivían en la casa de su suegra, pero hace como 2 años ya vive en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al labrado de la tierra, heredó la perseverancia en el trabajo de sus padres, y en esta oportunidad va a sembrar arvejas, y maíz que en esta época su precio está bien cotizado, Luis vende por fanegas que son sacos que llevan más de 60 kilos, donde llegan acumular exactamente 200 mazorcas, y cada saco se vende un precio aproximado de 80 soles, la dificultad es que el mismo precio no se mantiene en el mercado. En lo que respecta a la papa, nunca ha dejado de sembrar, en esta temporada va a sembrar de la semilla única que se desarrolla solamente en tres meses, a diferencia de las otras semillas, ésta es muy resistente a la temporada de lluvia y aun más a las plagas, por lo que no invierten mucho en los remedios. Luis tiene compradores en las ciudades de la costa por lo que su cosecha ya tiene venta segura. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y acaba de juramentar como presidente de su banco comunal, en el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cargo, y hacer que todos los socios paguen con la misma responsabilidad. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de insecticidas para fumigar su chacra de maíz y para atacar al gusano que llaman “shiuri” que es un insecto es de color blanco, de 2 centímetros de largo y ataca directo al fruto. El resto del dinero es para la compra de arvejas de la semilla llamada Utrillo.
texts.en:
Luis just turned 38 years old and has lived with his partner for nearly 11 years, which is also the age of his oldest son. Five months ago his second son, named Samuel, was born. When he and his partner married they lived in his mother-in-law’s house, however two years ago they moved to their own home. From a young age, he has dedicated himself to working the land, having inherited a perserverance for this type of work from his parents. Currently, he plants peas and corn which bring good prices during this season. Luis sells by the bushel, in other words, sacks weighing more than 60 kilos in which he can fit exactly 200 ears of corn. Each sack sells for approximately 80.00 Peruvian soles. Market prices fluctuate, however, which can be difficult. He has also never ceased planting potatoes and, this season, will be sowing from a seed that develops in only three months. Unlike other seeds, it is very resistant to the rainy season and to plagues, which is why he doesn’t need to invest much into remedies for these types of problems. Luis has buyers in the coastal cities, which means his crops have an assured sale. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He was recently sworn in as the president of his cooperative bank, and he promises to fulfill the job well and work to ensure that all members pay their loan installments responsibly. The funds he requests are for the purchase of insecticides to fumigate his corn crop against a worm they call “shiuri”, which is white and 2 cm. long. The remaining funds will be used to buy peas from seeds called “Utrillo”.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells provisions like beverages, juice, candles, and tomato paste. She has been in this business for a long time. Fumilayo is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a businesswoman in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $105. She works 11 hours every day at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that with this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Ester is 47 years old, married, and has seven children: She also cares for seven additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Jesline

texts.en:
Jesline A. is 40 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school.

Jesline is currently in the business of selling beans, tomatoes, and charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet O. sells provisions and drinks. She is 38-years-old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist. She hopes for a loan of 60000 Nairas to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy C. (pictured with her niece), 31, and her husband, Mr. Ream Ros, 32, were married in 2002. They live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh and have no children yet. 

Channy has been a silk weaver for ten years. She sells her finished products to the middle-man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Ream Ros has been a wooden house builder for three years; he does his work in Kampong Cham province, which is far away from his house. He hopes to expand his business but he doesn’t have enough materials for his work. This is why Channy is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to help her husband to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s building business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 55 and married to a farmer, Marcelino D. who is 54 years old. They reside in Barangay San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. The couple is blessed with three children who were all now married. Her children were not able to finish their studies because of early marriage and difficulties in life.

Rebecca's main business is hog-raising. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used to purchase feed for her pigs. The money will enable her to improve her business and increase her income as the pigs grow larger. Rebecca is a woman full of hopes. She believes that dreaming should be accompanied by hard work and patience to attain success.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Clinton

texts.en: Clinton S., 28, is single and has one child who is in school. He is a very resourceful young man and father who works hard to support his family. Clinton supports his child and and meets his other family responsibilities by selling used clothing. He has a store in the market where he hangs and arranges the used clothing. Selling used clothing is very popular in Ghana because new cloths are very expensive. Clinton wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase his inventory. He believes this loan will help him save for his child's future education and also to rent a permanent store for his business. He is member of the group called “Aba Ba” meaning "Good Seeds." He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Señora Ana María A. Martínez tiene 57 años de edad. Actualmente es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de costura. La ubicación de su negocio es su vivienda, Ana tuvo dificultades ya que su casa de habitación es muy largo por lo que perdió muchos clientes. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Y con lo difícil que ha sido mantener este negocio ha hecho muchos sacrificios para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus vestidos, trajes y pantalones. El sueño de Ana es que sus confecciones sean exportadas al extranjero para que sus prendas sean reconocidas.
texts.en:
Ana María A. Martínez is 57, married, and raising three children. She is a seamstress. Her business is located in her house. Ana had difficulties. Because her house is very far, she lost many customers. She has been in this business for over eight years. It has been difficult to keep her business going, and she has made many sacrifices to feed her children every day. The loan will be used to buy raw materials to make her dresses, suits, and pants. Ana’s dream is that her clothing will be exported to foreign countries so that they will become known.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jesus Gustavo

texts.es:
el sr. Jesus Gustavo E. A. tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a la carpinteria la cual opera bajo el nombre de Carpinteria E..
en su taller se elabora una gran variadad de muebles como ser puertas de tablero, ventanas, mesas, comodas, camas y por lo que mas resalta su taller es por la elaboracion de pailas de madera para vehiculos.
el viven en union libre y es padre de 3 hijos los cuales dependen al 100% de el, todos sus hijos estan estudiando. con las ganancias que le da el taller, el cubre todos sus gastos familiares, en estos momentos el necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio, ademas tiene un proyecto de fabricar varios muebles y necesita capital para poder empezar a realizar dicho proyecto.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesus Gustavo E. A. has been running his own carpentry business for over 4 years. His business operates under the name of Carpinteria E.. In his workshop he produces a large variety of furniture such as panel doors, windows, tables, dressers and beds. His workshop stands out because it also produces wood panels for vehicles. He lives with his common law wife and is a father of 3 children, who depend on him 100%. All of his children are in school. With the profits that the business generates, he is able to cover his financial needs at the moment. He needs a loan to move his business forward. He also has a project to manufacture several types of furniture and he needs the capital to start this project.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of laurel wood, sealant, varnish, thiner, glue, sandpaper, screws, and a polishing machine.

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
L. señora Sabina M. emprendedora e ingeniosa tiene 45 años D. edad, conviviente y con  6 hijos.
Viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  desD. hace unos días, asume el cargo D. presidenta D. L. alcancía comunal” Caminado Juntos” L. cual esta conformado por  11 socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades como: venta D. pasteles, venta D. mazamorras, venta D. maní confitado, venta D. desayunos (maca y quinua) en forma ambulante.
Sabina  se dedica a L. venta D. comida ambulatoria  en las afueras D. una fábrica textil desD. hace  6años, el trayecto  para llegar a su punto D. venta dura entre  50 a 60 minutos y lleva aprox. D. 40 a 50 menús diarios, para L. cual algunas veces cuenta con el apoyo D. su hija pero otras veces elL. carga con todo el peso.
Con el préstamo D. S/. 400.00 Nuevos Soles lo invertirá en L. compra D. nuevas ollas  para L.  venta D. su comida, ya que las ollas que utilizan son pequeñas y no abastecen para todos sus clientes.
El anhelo D. Sabina es poder llegar a poner una bodega en su casa ya que esta cansada D. salir a vender todos los días lejos D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Sabina M. is an enterprising and resourceful 45-year-old woman who lives with her 6 children. She has been working with Kiva partner EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for several years, and holds the office of president of the “Caminando Juntos” communal bank. This group is maD. up of 11 members who make a living as street vendors selling different foods such as cakes, mazamorras [a corn pudding dish], candied peanuts, and breakfasts (consisting of maca [an Andean root vegetable] and quinoa). For 6 years now Sabina has maD. a living selling food from a stand outsiD. a textile factory. The journey from her home to her stand takes between 50 and 60 minutes, and she brings approximately 40 to 50 prepared meals with her. She sometimes has help from her daughter, but at other times she carries all of the weight herself. Sabina and the other members of her group will use this loan of 400.00 soles to invest in the purchase of new pots for selling their foods; the pots that they currently use are small and do not hold enough for all of their customers. Sabina’s wish is to set up a grocery store in her home, since she is tired of going out to sell meals every day so far from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing new pots for selling their foods

loans.name: Amig Chaco Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Collpani, se reúne la asociación “Amig Chaco”, está conformado por trece mujeres , demostrando responsabilidad en sus dos años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer. Actualmente su presidenta es  Petrona M.,  ella prepara almuerzos y los vende en una pensión familiar.
Diversos son los negocios de este grupo, tales como: venta de cosméticos, costura y venta de polleras, centros y mantas, chompas y ponchos tejidos a mano, venta de fruta, verduras, material de escritorio . Ellas afirman que necesitan comprar mercadería y/o materia prima (compra de lana, tela, arroz por quintal y otros dependiendo el caso).
texts.en:
The association "Amig Chaco" meets in the focal centre Collpani and is made up of thirteen women who have demonstrated their responsible natures during the two years that they have been working with Pro-Mujer. Their current president is Petrona M., and she prepares lunches and sells them at a family hostel.

This group's activities are diverse, such as; the sale of cosmetics, sewing, the sale of hand-woven skirts, blankets, sweaters and ponchos, the sale of fruit, vegetables and writing materials. They need to buy merchandise and /or basic materials (such as wool, fabric, rice by the kilo and other things depending on the case).


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and/or basic materials/COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y/O MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Isabel es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Isabel tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Isabel necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Isabel son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Inti Community Bank. Isabel is 52, married, and she has five children. Isabel has a stall in the Magdalena market where she sells general groceries. She does this every day. Isabel needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Isabel’s dreams are that her children become professionals; she also wants to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Sout

texts.en: Sout C., 39, lives in Kandal province in Cambodia. Since 2007 she has been making and selling mats to earn a living, making approximately US$1.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and makes approximately US$4 every day. The couple has three children, one who is also a construction worker, and two who are students. Sout is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work on. This will reduce the transportation cost that he incurs each day.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Amistad 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Inocencia is the group coordinator of her group Amistad (Friendship). Her story is representative of both the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) clients. Her group is based in the Samana peninsula in an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure made out of wooden walls and a tin roof with her husband and three children.

Inocencia is a long time associate of Esperanza and this will be her 9th loan with us. She has repaid the other eight successfully and grown her business of making sheets, curtains and bed coverings in her home to sell in the street. With this loan she plans to invest in a new sewing machine and more fabric for her business. Her business, which is her family's main source of income, has grown greatly over the past and the profits have allowed her family to purchase a moto (small motorbike) to get around. With the profits she expects to realize from her business in this next loan cycle she intends to purchase notebooks and shoes for her children, food for the whole family and to become more financially stable. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: A sewing machine and fabric to sew

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina A., 27, lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is married with a child. She sells frozen foods and foodstuffs for a living. She has been in the business for 4 years. Tina is applying for a loan of N 150,000 to purchase more frozen foods and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 44 years old and is married to her husband Efrain.  Together, Felicia and Efrain have four children, two of whom are very young.  For the past 15 years, Felicia and her family have lived in Mallco Chapi, a community in Vinto province, just outsiD. of the city of Cochabamba.

Felicia is a dairy cow farmer and her husband works as a bricklayer sporadically on different projects throughout the Cochabamba suburb of Quillacollo.  Felicia works hard on the farm while her husband is away to work for a better life for her children.

Felicia has suffered ever since she was a little girl because her father was an alcoholic.  She, as the older child of the family, witnessed the extensive abuse her mother was experiencing.  For this reason, she and her husband are dedicated to educating their children so that they can have a stable and better future, as well as a safe childhood.

With this loan from CIDRE, Felicia plans to finish purchasing a plot of land where she can plant more crops so that she can improve her earnings and sell more, which will help her guarantee that she can pay the school fees for her children.  The oldest child is 15 years old and he wants to finish high school and become a computer technician so that he can help educate his siblings.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for farming

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Madame   Minata  C.  est âgée de 47 ans, veuve et mère  de 4 enfants.  Elle  vit avec sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie au 2ème quartier de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, car à cette époque (pendant son enfance) l’enseignement des filles n’était pas une priorité pour les parents. Elle  s’initie très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de poissons, appris auprès d’une de ses amies d’enfance. Après une année d’apprentissage (comment frire et enlever les parties non consommables), elle évolue seule depuis maintenant 29 ans et  jouit d’une grande  notoriété et connue de tout Ségou. Elle a comme clients les agents des administrations publiques (Douanes, Tribunal, Mairie etc.) 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 75Kg de poissons frais. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et effectue sa    vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de satisfaire ses propres besoins (nourriture, habillement, médicaments) et de payer les charges scolaires de ses enfants. 
Son ambition est de construire son terrain nu en  maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Minata C., 47, is a widow and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her co-spouse and their children in a big extended traditional family in the second district of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She did not attend school for socio-economic reasons, since at that time (during her childhood) educating daughters was not a priority for parents. She began earning money at an early age, especially selling fish, learning the business from one of her childhood friends. After a year's apprenticeship (learning how to fry fish and remove the parts that can't be eaten) she began working by herself. She has been at it now for 29 years and has a good reputation and is known in all of Ségou. Among her customers are civil servants (from Customs, the Court, the Town Hall, etc.)

Wishing to grow her working capital so as to make more profit, she came to Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan which she intends to use to buy 75 kg of fresh fish. She buys it right where she works and sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed of women and men.

With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA. This profit will allow her to support herself (food, clothing, medicines) and pay the school fees for her children. Her ambition is to use her vacant lot to build a family home.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pour acheter des poissons.

loans.name: Riad

texts.en:
Riad is a 51 year-old married man with one child. He has been working in construction for the past 19 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his family's needs.

Today, Riad is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy wood and scaffolding to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy wood and scaffolding

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren D. is 51 years old and lives with her four children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All three of her daughters currently attend college and her youngest son is in high school.

Dulamsuren operates a meal service business in her town. She makes a variety of traditional Mongolian meals and sells them throughout her town. Her primary customers are local office workers who enjoy her convenient service for lunch. Dulamsuren started her business in 2004 after working as a cook at a secondary school. Her business is very important to her and her family as she must pay all of her children's tuition fees. Dulamsuren is a very passionate woman and invests all of her energy into accomplishing her goals. She says, "all I want is for my children to be educated and have a better life." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to help her pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To help her pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Abdull Zafar

texts.en:
Abdull Zafar is an educated man with full experience. He has a retail shop where he works and has been operating this business for a long time. He has a small business but has a good number of customers. When he started his business he had fewer materials in his shop.

Now Abdull Zafar has requested a loan of 30,000 Afghani for personal use. He wants to take English and math courses.

Abdull Zafar is very happy about this process of providing small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To pay for English and math courses

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Duk D., 37, is a district policeman who started his job more than nine years ago. He has a partner in his wife, who works sewing clothes for MV garment industry. The couple has been married many years, and they have three young school-aged children. Duk D. has a piece of land in a good location for rent, on which he hopes to build a few rental rooms, but he doesn’t have the money yet to start the construction process. Therefore, he is pursuing a loan to buy housing materials, and he then will hire a worker to build new rooms for his service.

loans.use: To build new rooms for his service

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: La señora Gloria Elena, vive en la zona de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por 2 hijos menores y su esposo, su desde muy pequeña su principal actividad ha sido la ganaderia y cultivos agricolas sirviendole como una fuente de subsistencia en el nucleo familiar, la mayor necesidad que se le presenta es el sector economico pues no cuenta con los recursos que le permitan poder cubrir necesidades en su pequeña finca, necesita este financiamiento para retencion de 7 terneros puesto que no existe una buena comercializacion en el momento para este tipo de animal, espera que en el transcurso de 15 meses pueda haber un mejor precio en los semoviente y asegurar que su venta sea mas rentable, su compañero de vida  le apolla en las diferentes actividades para el bien comun del la familia, desde ya agradece el apollo que le brinden.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena lives in the Nueva Guinea area with her family, which is composed of her husband and two minor children. From a very early age, she has raised cattle and farmed. These activities have produced income for family support. Her greatest need in the economic sector is that she does not have sufficient funds to cover costs of her small farm. She needs this funding in order to be able to keep 7 calves because right now isn't a good time to sell them. She hopes that in another 15 months livestock prices will improve so that a sale will be more profitable. Her husband supports her in the activities that aim for the common good of the family. She gives thanks in advance for any help she may receive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To afford to keep 7 calves.

loans.name: Kyadondo East Group, Mukono

texts.en: N. Nuluyat is a hardworking, friendly, and devoted woman. She is 41 years old and married with five children between the ages of 7 and 20. All of her children are still in school. Nuluyat has a retail shop that she has been running from Kirinya in Mukono for 10 years. She is able to make 50,000 UGX in weekly profits, and this helps her to expand her shop and to increase her capital base. She has a dream of expanding her shop further to ensure that she makes more profit to use for her children's education and general upkeep. Nuluyat needs a loan to be able to stock her retail shop with more goods in order to bring in more profit.

loans.use: To stock her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Señor De San Miguel Group

texts.es: El grupo “Señor D. San Miguel” esta representado por la señora Lizloth Bolivia y conformada por 10 miembros D. las  cuales 7 son mujeres y el resto son varones son muy unidas y trabajadoras. Lizloth Bolivia tiene 2 hijos y actualmente vive en alquiler tiene su negocio D. venta D. comida  en el mercado la pampa en el cual le va muy bien tiene clientes los cuales les agrada su comida y es muy conocida por su comida en la zona, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio. Las demás socias tienen diferentes actividades entre ellas venta D. cotillones, venta D. ropa, venta D. juguetes, helados, cerrajería, atención en salón D. belleza y pintura. La competencia es alta pero los socios cuentan con mucha experiencia y tienen clientes fijos en sus negocios y saben como salir adelante en sus negocios. El crédito actual es para capital D. operaciones e inversión en sus negocios ya sea para compra D. mercadería  y herramientas para mejorar sus ventas y por enD. sus ingresos para el sustento D. sus familias. El banco tiene experiencia, ya que no es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito bajo esta modalidad en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Lizloth Boliva represents the Señor D. San Miguel group. The group is comprised of ten members; seven are women and the rest are men. They are very united and hard-working. Lizloth Bolivia has two children. She currently rents where she lives. She has her business of selling food in the La Pampa Market. It is going very well for her. She has customers who like her food, and she is very well known in the area for her food . Her husband helps her with the business. The rest of the members have different activities such as selling decorative ornaments, selling clothes, selling toys, ice cream, locksmith shop, and providing beauty and nail services. There is a lot of competition, but the members have a lot of experience and regular customers. They know how to get ahead in their businesses. The current loan is for operating capital to invest in their businesses by purchasing merchandise and tools to improve their sales. This is to improve their earnings in order to support their families. This communal bank has experience. This is not the first time they have gotten a loan of this type from institutions that are similar to the Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ena Del Carmen

texts.es: La  Sra. Ena del Carmen Velásquez N.   ella es trabajadora del Hospital Central Managua tiene cuatros años trabajar para esta empresa, es madre de dos  hijos en edad escolar, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  Onces  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una ampliación en su vivienda y así tener una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Ena del Carmen Velásquez N. works at Hospital Central Managua. She has worked their for four years. She is a married mother of two school-age children. She has had 11 loans with CEPRODEL. With each loan, she has made home improvements. She wants this loan to make an extension on her home and therefore be able to have dignified housing.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials like rock sand and cement

loans.name: Tushubure Hamwe, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
In a certain small Ibanda town is a determined lady, B. Beatrice, a go-getter businesswoman who is a market vendor dealing in general merchandise. This stickler for hard work and also the mother of four, has basked in the checkered career graces of her business for the last five years. With this experience behind her, she has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her business.

In a month Beatrice’s business generates her a profit of 250,000 Ugandan shillings. This, to all intents and purposes, is a low figure. What has played into her hands as she operates her business has been her exceptional customer relationship skills.

As it is now, Beatrice is taking a long view with the aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will come in significantly handy in helping her buy more stock.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Cuando era adolescente tenía una pequeña parcela que le habían otorgado sus padres con el propósito de que siga sus pasos. Ahora se dedica específicamente al cultivo de cacao, pero no todo lo fue “color de rosa”, ya que en anteriores oportunidades existían compradores que no querían pagar lo justo, pero tenía que vender para cubrir sus gastos familiares.
En ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su esposo, pero por lo general tiene a cargo peones que le faciliten la siembra y cosecha. Con su esposo enfrentaron la peor época cuando su producto no podían competir con los precios menores al suyo, pero no se amilanó, siguió adelante, sabía que se acercaba una oportunidad de salir de sus problemas y es así que encontró otros compradores que aceptaron pagar mejores precios. Para un futuro próximo quiere comprar más terrenos de cultivo con la finalidad de producir más y cumplir con sus compromisos.

Con éste, lleva cuatro créditos con MFP, por lo que asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además felicita su banco comunal por la buena organización que tienen. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Marisol is 34 years, married and has three children. She lives in the town of Pichari, which is located in the beautiful Cusco jungle and is where she owns her own home. When she was an teenager, she owned a small plot of land that her parents had given her with the condition that she follow in their footsteps. Now, she makes her living cultivating cacao specifically. But life isn't always a bed of roses. In early dealings, there were buyers who didn't want to give her a fair price, but she had to sell to them anyway to have money to meet her family's expenses. Sometimes her husbands helps her, but generally speaking she hires laborers who help with the planting and harvesting. She and her husband faced their worst period when they couldn't compete with prices lower than theirs. Even so they were undaunted, and they moved forward, knowing that an opportunity would present itself to free them from their problems. And indeed they did find other buyers who agreed to pay better prices. In the near future, she wants to purchase more farmland for the purpose of producing more crops and fulfilling her obligations. With this one, she will have four loans with MFP. She promises to loyally comply with all payments, and in addition she congratulates her communal bank for their excellent organization. She plans to invest the requested funds in maintaining her farmland with the intention of improving the quality of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her farmland.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. Carlos Humberto F. G. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la colonia Altos del Loarque en la ciudad de Nacaome departamento de Valle.
Carlos se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que tiene varios años de realizar, todos los dias carga su carro de verduras y frutas y sale a repartirlas en diferentes mercaditos, pulperias, caserios, barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Carlos dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su producto se vende muy bien y tiene buenas ganancias, pero el quiere expanderse mas y buscar otros lugares en el cual repartir su prodcuto, tiene la facilidad de que posee un vehiulo pickup para cargar los vegetales.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
Carlos says that he is happy that his products sell well and he has a good income, but he wants to expand and look for other places in which to distribute his products. He uses his pickup to transport his vegetables. He will use the money from this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. dica a la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que tiene varios años de realizar, todos los dias carga su carro de verduras y frutas y sale a repartirlas en diferentes mercaditos, pulperias, caserios, barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Nacaome. Carlos dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su producto se vende muy bien y tiene buenas ganancias, pero el quiere expanderse mas y buscar otros lugares en el cual repartir su prodcuto, tiene la facilidad de que posee un vehiulo pickup para cargar los vegetales. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas verduras y frutas.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Isai

texts.es: Isai, de 29 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Eliana de 28 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, Araceli de 8 y Scott de 4 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo Isai ha logrado sacar adelante sus cafetales, ya que con la ayuda de su esposa a trabajado muy duro y ha logrado que sus productos tenga una muy buena calidad, por este motivo cuando lleva a vender su café a la ciudad de Pichanaki los compradores no dudan en ofrecerle muy buenos precios. Lleva 29 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantaciones, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hacia los puntos de venta. Con el tiempo, desea comprarse un auto, para transportar él mismo su propia producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará unas cuantas hectáreas, para plantar plátano.
texts.en:
29 year old Isai is a loving husband and father who lives with his wife, 28 year old Eliana, and his two lovely children, eight year old Araceli, and four year old Scott. They are the prime motivation for all of his efforts. With his wife’s help, Isai has managed to succeed with his coffee plantations. They have both worked very hard to produce high quality products. Whenever he travels to Pichanaki to sell his coffee, buyers have no problem offering him good prices. He’s been doing this for 29 years and what he enjoys most is taking care of his plantations. What he finds most difficult is transporting his product to the points of sale. In time he wants to buy a car in order to be able to move his product himself. This will be his third loan through MFP and he tells us that this will be very helpful toward his progress. He will use the money from this loan to buy three hectares of land where he will plant bananas.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Land for farming

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa S. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 64 years old. Elisa is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Elisa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elisa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nicolette

texts.en:
Nicolette is a single entrepreneur from Beregovo. Nicolette is an experienced beauty therapist. She owns a beauty salon and offers different face packs and body care service packages. She started her own venture 3 years ago. Nicolette has a loyal clientele who trust her advice and visit her salon on a regular basis. Currently, her gross income is about 5,000 Grivnyas. Net profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas a month.   

Nicolette is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to purchase various cosmetic sets and supplies for her beauty salon. Additional cosmetic items will help her provide wide-ranging services related to skin health, facial aesthetic, foot care, massages and other services. Nicolette is very serious about her work. She tries to find an individual approach to every customer. Nicolette has repaid all her previous loans without delinquencies.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic sets

loans.name: Ouleye

texts.fr:
Madame Ouleye S. habite  à Ngor, un des villages environnants de la localité de Ouakam. Elle est âgée  de 51 ans. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 4 enfants. 
Madame S.  a voulu trouver une solution aux difficultés  qu’elle traversait et c’est la raison  qui l’a pousse a choisir   l’activité  de commerce  comme occupation dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Ainsi elle pratique la vente de produits locaux et de beignets depuis 10 ans. 
Madame S. est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC  à Ouakam  depuis  3 ans. Elle y a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 frs qui sera destine à augmenter son fond de roulement  afin de renforcer son stock de produits. 
Ce crédit  selon elle pourra contribuer à développer  et faire avancer son activité. Aussi  ceci pourrait accroitre ses revenus  ce qui lui donnera la possibilité  de participer  a la gestion des charges  de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Ouleye S. lives in Ngor, a village near Ouakam. She is 51 years old, married with 4 children. Mrs. S. started her business to earn income because she wanted to find a way out of the difficulties she was facing. This is how she came to be in the business of selling local produce and fritters for more than ten years. Mrs. S. has been a member of the UIMCEC bank in Ouakam for the past 3 years. She has already had one loan, and she is now asking for a new loan of 300,000 francs that will increase her working capital so that she can increase her inventory. She expects that this loan will allow her to grow her business and increase her income, which in turn will allow her to contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Jehova Proveera Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Jehová Proveerá lleva 4 ciclos de préstamos con  ADIM y está conformado por Blanca Bertha M. J., Sandra María M. y Patricia del Socorro A.; su coordinadora Blanca M. tiene 53 años y cuatro hijos que le ayudan en su negocio, el cual inició hace 10 años como un pequeño puesto y ahora además de ser pulpería vende nacatamales y cosméticos. Ella se siente bien por ser una mujer que trabaja por si sola y su deseo es ser un ejemplo para su familia.

Las demás integrantes, Sandra y Patricia son menores que ella y se dedican a la venta de ropa y zapatos. El crédito otorgado será utilizado para invertir en la compra de productos para sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The “Jehová Proveerá” (Jehovah will Provide) communal bank is in its fourth loan cycle with ADIM. Its members are: Blanca Bertha M. J., Sandra María M. and Patricia del Socorro A.. Blanca M., 53, is group coordinator. She has four children that help her in the store she opened 10 years ago starting out as a small stand. Now, besides being a grocery store she also sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular on as weekend food) and cosmetics. She feels good that she’s an independent working woman. Her wish is to set a good example for her family. The other group members, Sandra and Patricia, are younger then her and sell clothing and shoes. The granted loan will be used to buy merchandise for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lotoi

texts.en:
Lotoi F. is 72 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Lotoi has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lotoi needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Lotoi joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lotoi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Justino

texts.en:
Justino D. Jr. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old. Justino is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, he runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Justino has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Justino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estefania; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de verduras y cereales, ella vende tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,pepinos y toda variedad de cereales, ella vende en la ciudad del Cusco en los diferentes mercados desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, su esposo es maestro de construcción y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un local para vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Estefania, 46, is married and has three children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily tasks with vegetable and cereals sales. She sells tomatoes, carrots, onions, cucumbers and all kinds of cereals in various markets in Cusco from 7am until 5pm. Her husband is a master builder and together they support their children. She would like to have a market stall to sell her vegetables. She is asking for funds to buy vegetables at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Jagir

texts.en:
Jagir D. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd Province, Mongolia. Jagar operates a clothing stand at the market with the help of his wife and children. He started his business in 2000 repairing shoes, and after years of successful operation and experience broadened his business activities and started another clothing booth at the Ih Buyan market in 2009.

He says, "My wife and I have worked hard to pay tuition fees for our three children, and now they have all graduated from their universities. Now we need to help them have their own lives separate from us.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing for help expand his retail trade business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Phebean

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Phebean. She is married and has three children aged 8, 14 and 18 years old. In the year 2000, Phebean established rice, beans, groundnuts and textiles business. She started her business because she never went to school and she needed to generate income to help her husband support their family. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about 716,000SLL every month from this business. 
She needs a loan of 3,000,000SLL to buy more food stuff for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 136,040SLL. In the future, Phebean plans to educate her children through secondary and university level as well as expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more  clothings and foodstuffs

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar L. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in his parents' yard. Two of his sons attend a local secondary school. Ganbaatar owns his own iron/metal work business where he produces such items as stoves, stove pipes, doors, truck trailers, carriage chairs for motorcycles, smokestacks and mesh wire etc,.according to his customers' orders. He began his business in 1996 and has built a stable operation with many customers. After years of successful operation, he has gained a wide customer base. His business earnings have enabled him to provide for  his family and to buy new electronic equipment such as a music player and a TV set. Currently his parents live in a different province therefore he plans to buy the house and fence where his family lives  from his parents. For the future, he also plans to build a new work place for his steel production. Ganbaatar is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to purchase the following material and equipment such as a power saw at 150,000 MNT, 3 metal plates at 300,000 MNT, 10 iron sheets  at 200,000 MNT and supplies like glue, paint, nails and sandpaper etc, for his metal goods making business.

loans.use: To purchase material and equipment for his metal goods business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas N., 49, is married with two children living in Takeo province. She makes and sells palm sugar, typically earning US$1 profit a day, while her husband, pictured here, sells coconuts and palm fruit. On average, he earns US$2 per day. Meas N. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport coconuts and palm fruit to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a thirty-two-year-old single mother of two children.  She lives in a rented house in Fort Portal Uganda.  She has aspirations of building a permanent house for her residence and educating her children. She sells fire wood and has been in this business for three years, reaping commendable profits amidst challenges in transport costs.  Annet intends to use the loan to buy firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy firewood for sale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 36 años, vive al lado de su esposo Climancio de 34 años y de sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo de los tres menores, pues el mayor trabaja; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Esta trabajadora madre de familia se dedica a la fabricación de todo tipo de polos, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, en el taller que esta ubicado en una pieza de su vivienda. En este lugar trabaja al lado de su esposo, su hijo mayor y un ayudante; entre ellos producen gran cantidad de polos que venden al por mayor a los grandes emporios de la ciudad. Esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias del negocio familiar, aunque para lograr el éxito deba trabajar todos los días de la semana durante todo el día; pero le gusta mucho su labor pues es tranquila y no descuida los quehaceres del hogar y sobretodo la educación de sus hijos. Como es una dama muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado, junto a su esposo, ampliar el negocio de producción de prendas; y quiere empezar a confeccionar mayor variedad de prendas, pues tiene cantidad de clientes que le hacen grandes pedidos. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Sonia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios rollos de tela que necesita para continuar produciendo las prendas de vestir que comercializa, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en: Sonia, age 36, lives with her husband Climancio, age 34, and their four children, of whom they only care for the three youngest, as the oldest works.
