They work together every day to get ahead. This hard-working mother makes all types of polos, for men and women, in a workshop in her home. She works with her husband, her oldest child and a helper. Together they produce a large quantity of polos which they sell wholesale to the large department stores of the city. She is very satisfied, as she makes a regular income from the family business, even though she has to work all day, every day to have success. However, she really enjoys her work as it is very peaceful and she does not have to forget about her housework, and above all the education of her children. As she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she and her husband plan to expand their clothing production business. She wants to start making a larger variety of articles, and she has customers who are making large orders. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her quotas punctually as she does not want to disappoint those who have made this loan possible. It will allow her to continue working in search of success. Sonia plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of various rolls of fabric that she needs in order to continue producing the clothing articles that she sells. This way, she hopes to progress.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of fabric

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.en:
Rahmonkul is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Rahmonkul hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacine N. est sociétaire de la caisse de Fissel situé à quelques 50 km de Mbour; elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfant dont les 2 figurent sur la photo. Son activité principale est l'élevage de moutons et chèvres destinés à la revente. Elle a une ancienneté dans ce domaine et constitue pour elle une source de revenu
texts.en:
Mrs. Yacine N. is a member of the UIMCEC Fissel branch located about 50 km from Mbour. She is married with three children, two of which are shown on the photo. 

Her main activity is fattening sheep and goats for resale. She is experienced, and this activity is for her a source of income.

loans.use: Animal fattening

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie T. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba. She is 45 years old. Lenie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lenie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, running a grocery store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety products in the local community. Lenie has been operating her business for 8 years and generates a monthly net income of 4500 PHP.

In 2004, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lenie is requesting her 14th loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business for the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Ye

texts.en:
Mrs. Ye was born in 1946. She and her husband, Mr. Meang, do not have a child. 

They are farmers who own a plot of land where they can grow rice. They sell some piece of the rice yield and the other piece they keep for supporting their family in the whole year. 

In the rice field, they have some problems because their field is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve production of rice, Mrs. Ye is asking for a loan to buy gasoline. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticide and fertilizer.  

Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel, es un señor de 64 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, vive con su familia: esposa e hijos, se dedica a la venta de medicina hace 15 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana y su esposa es un gran apoyo para realizar las ventas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en medicina para mejorar el negocio, esta inversión le ayudara a tener más mercadería y variedad de producto medicinales, generando más ventas y ganancias.
El objetivo de don Manuel con respecto al préstamo es cancelar oportunamente, tener un buen historial crediticio y fortalecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 64 year-old gentleman who lives in Concepción Batres, in Usulután department.  He lives with his family: wife and children.  He has been selling medicines for 15 years.  He works every day of the week and his wife is a great support in helping him make his sales.

Manuel is currently requesting a loan to invest in buying medicines to improve his business.  This investment will help him to have more merchandise and a greater variety of medicinal products.  This will enable him to make more sales and profits.

Manuel's goal with respect to his loan is to repay it on time, create a good credit history and strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Assiatta Mawulé

texts.fr: Madame Assiata Mawulé est âgée de  58 ans. Elle réside à Avépozo et a en sa charge 02 enfants. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente des jus et l’eau mise en sachet.  Elle  a démarré son activité en 2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite elle revend à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt  pour  l’achat  de  5 paquets de sachets, 3 boîtes d’arome, 2 sacs de sucre et l’entretien des frigos  afin de maximiser son profit pour pouvoir prendre en charge la famille.
texts.en: Assiata Mawuli is 58 years old. She resides in Avépozo and she takes care of her two children. Her business is to sell take-away juices and water. She has been in this business since 2005 and she purchases her supplies at the main market in Lomé. She operates her business in front of her house. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of five packs of take-away bags, three boxes of syrup, two bags of sugar and for the maintenance of her refrigerators. Her intention is to maximize her profit in order to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase packages, sugar, syrups and to provide refrigerators maintenance

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 41 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Aurea has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from piggery and rice retailing.

Aurea aspires to build and expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en: From Trento, Agusan Del Sur, Norberto is a 57-year-old married father of two children aged 18 and 20. To earn an income, he has been planting bananas and making baskets for four years now, earning a monthly income of Php 2,000. Norberto will use his loan to purchase fertilizers for his farm. He is hoping for business stability to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Maruxa

texts.es:
Maruxa forma parte del banco comunal “Aurora Boreal” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica a lavar y coser ropa de algunos integrantes del círculo de la Armada y Carabineros de Chile, desde hace dos años. Además transporta niños y en la temporada de verano vende verduras. Pero principalmente se dedica al lavado de ropa, específicamente cuando se realizan eventos en el círculo de la Armada y Carabineros de Chile y ropa del policlínico de estos. 
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en la ciudad de Santiago, todo lo que son artículos de aseo. 
Con el préstamo comprará artículos de aseo que le servirán para su negocio, específicamente detergente, cloro, jabón y lava lozas. También lo utilizará para gastos personales, ya que tiene problemas a la vista y necesita comprarse lentes, además se encuentra a la espera de unos exámenes y diagnóstico debido a una complicación al hígado, por lo que también ha debido desembolsar dinero en exámenes y consultas médicas. 
Sus metas a corto plazo son comprarse una máquina de lavado automático industrial, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con su lavadora automática de su casa. Sus metas a largo plazo son establecer su negocio e instalarse con una lavandería. 
Maruxa es jefa de hogar y vive junto a sus 4 hijas de 24, 18, 10 y 7 años de edad.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son conseguir el subsidio habitacional, para brindarles a sus hijas una vida más confortable.
Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo y crédito brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha podido emprender en su negocio.
Respecto a las reuniones, Maruxa se siente muy cómoda y a gusto, ya que existe una muy buena comunicación entre los demás integrantes del Banco comunal, además son muy solidarios como grupo.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Maruxa is a member of the communal bank named "Aurora Boreal", located in the city of Vina del Mar. For the past 2 years she has been washing and sewing clothes for some of the members of the army and police groups of Chile. She also provides transportation for children and during the summer she sells vegetables. Her primary business, however, is washing clothes, especially for events held by the groups, Armada and Carabineros of Chile.

She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, being all types of cleaning products.

With the loan she will purchase cleaning products that will help her with her business, especially detergents, bleach, soap, and floor cleaner. She will also use it to cover personal expenses. She has failing vision and she needs to purchase prescription glasses. She also needs to undergo some medical exams and diagnostics for a liver complication. She has been forced to spend some money on exams and medical consults.

Her short term goals are to purchase an automatic industrial washing machine. Currently she only has her own automatic washer at home. Her long term goals are to establish her business and to set up a laundry shop.

Maruxa is the head of the family and she lives together with her 4 daughters, aged, 24, 18, 10 and 7.

Her personal dreams are to acquire a subsidized living space to provide her daughters with more comfortable living conditions.

She is very thankful for the support and for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) because she has been able to support her business.

With respect to their meetings, Maruxa feels very comfortable and at ease. There exists a very open level of communication among the members of her communal bank and they are all very supportive as a group.

Vina del Mar is a city and community located in the heart of Chile's population. It is known as the City of Gardens for the gardens and patios of some of the old houses in the city. It is also considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products, especially detergents, bleach, soaps, and floor cleaners.

loans.name: Gangamala Group

texts.en:
Shabani, in his mid 20's, is single with a 2-year-old child. He has been a tailor for six years, working from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily. He is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shabani's 4th loan from Tujujenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans for household expenses and material for his business. He has repaid his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy material for his tailoring business. His dream is to one day own a food shop and a big place for tailoring.

Shabani will share this loan with his group "Gangamala" which totals 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To buy more materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is 62 years of age and married with seven children. Nive owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Nive needs a loan of WST $2050 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 230 talas or US $96 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Nive joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Nive's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Brisa Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BRISA DEL AMANECER” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Silvia ocupa el cargo de secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de CD’s venta de tostado, venta de hamburguesa, tienda, venta de material de aseo, punto VIVA.
 
La señora Silvia,  indica que es el sexto mes que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una señora de la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace veinte años atrás y que aprendió de su hermano.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fideo, arroz, aceite, etc.), este material lo comprara de las mayoristas de la C. Raúl Salmón (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y los venderá en su casa que esta ubicada en la zona 3 de mayo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención medica
texts.en:
The community association “BRISA DEL AMANECER”  ("Dawn breeze") will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Santiago II.  It is made up of nine members and is led by a board headed by Señora Silvia.  The businesses that community association members lead are varied, among them are: selling food, selling CDs, selling toasted sandwiches, selling hamburgers, shop-keeping, selling toiletries, and running a VIVA internet point.

Señora Silvia says that this is the sixth month that they have been with Pro Mujer and their entry was at the invitation of a lady in the area.  Currently she has a business that is a neighborhood store, where she has been working for the last twenty years.  She learned the business from her brother.

The loan that she will now be drawing on is to raise capital (for the purchase of noodles, rice, oil, etc.)  These products are bought from wholesalers in Raúl Salmón street (a commercial area in the city of El Alto) and she sells them in her home, which is located in the May 3rd area. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the medical attention.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Tiburce

texts.fr:
Client de 33, marie et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 et 6 ans. A la fin de ses etudes universitaires, il ouvre une petite alimentation devant sa parcelle, ou il vend des boites de conserves, des sucreries, des savons, des biscuits, ses recettes régulières sont de 10.000 a 20.000 fr par jour.

Avec le pret recu il va renforcer son stock en  achetant 10 cartons de savons de toilette et savons a linge,5 cartons  des boites de conserves comme la sardine, corne bœuf, macédoine, 10 cartons de spaghetti,2 cartons de macaronis,il s'approvisionne dans les grands magasins de la ville et parfois il fait des commandes a Kinshasa.

Il a pour ambition d'ouvrir une grande boutique,vendre plus pour qu'avec le temps et epargner pour qu'a la longue qu'il soit grossiste.
texts.en:
This 33 year old client  is married with two children between the ages of 1 and 6.At the end of his university studies, he opened a small grocery in front of his plot of land, where he sells tins of aliments, sweets, soap and biscuits, his  regular takings  are of 10.000 to  20.000 Frs. per day.

With this loan he intends to stock up on goods by purchasing 10 boxes of body soap and laundry soap, 5 boxes of tins such as sardines, corned beef, mixed vegetables, 10 boxes of spaghetti and 2 boxes of macaroni. He buys his stock in the big shops in town and sometimes he places orders in Kinshasa.

He aims to open a big shop and sell more so that in time he can save up and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: purchase boxes of biscuits, sweets, soap, tinned food.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.

Concordia has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas, and coconuts. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.  Concordia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Concordia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, es soltera, vive con su madre y hermanas, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene experiencia en la preparación de las tortillas así como para comercializarlas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, esta compra le ayudara para incrementar los materiales y poder tener disponibilidad para la ejecución de la venta.
Para ella su propósito es aumentar las ventas, con mayor número de clientes que le permitan estabilizar el negocio y generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is single and lives with her mother and sisters. She sells tortillas. She has experience both preparing and selling tortillas.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood. This purchase will help her to increase her materials and to be able to have them available to make sales.

Esmeralda's goal is to increase her sales with a greater number of customers, so that she can stabilize her business and generate better profits.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for preparing tortillas to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 61 years old and lives in the municipality of Lopez Jaena. She is married and has three children.

Elizabeth works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a container of fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to save for her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase a container of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ararati Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mulisa, leader du groupe d’affaire «Ararati », est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 40  ans, mère de 7 jeunes enfants, qui étudient. Elle est  vendeuse de souliers dames, sacs à mains, etc.  Son mari est chômeur. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un magasin au centre commercial Birere. Il y a 2 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  40 paires de souliers, 20 sacs à mains  à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Mulisa is the head of the business group “Ararati". She is a young entrepreneur, age 40, and the mother of seven young children who attend school. She sells ladies’ footwear, handbags, etc. Her husband is unemployed. She displays her merchandise in a store at the Birere shopping mall. She has been practicing such income-generating activities for two years. 

She has completed 10 loan cycles with the Hekima microfinance institution. This new loan will allow her to stock up on merchandise by buying 40 pairs of shoes and 20 handbags for resale. She wants her children to grow up comfortably, and she would also like to expand her business. 

Mulisa wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping poor women who do not have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy 40 pairs of shoes and 20 handbags for resale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 27 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house, which has water and electricity. It is located in the province of Isabela. This region is characterized by its agriculture, cattle-raising, and tourist activities. For some years Rosalinda has sold basic groceries (cabbage, tomato and some fruit, etc.) from her home. She tries to cover all family expenses and necessities with her earnings.

Rosalinda is a responsible and hard-working person who is concerned that her family get ahead, and she wants to offer her children better educational options in the future.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, and leafy vegetables for sale

loans.name: Giovanna Elvira

texts.es:
La cliente tiene 29 años vive en el departamento de La Paz en la Zona de Pampahasi , comenzó a trabajar con esta actividad a la edad  de 20 años en el servicio de transporte de pasajeros urbano, pero también comercializa productos de venta por catálogo Esika para poder obtener  más  ingresos.

Giovanna se independizo a  los 20 años, vive actualmente  en una casa en anticretico pero ella genera ingresos para pagar sus gastos junto con su esposo, de esta manera pudo ahorrar para comprar la movilidad que en este momento tiene con sacrificio y perseverancia llego a sus objetivos.

El crédito que solicita es para la reparación del vehículo y para compra de mercadería (Cosméticos) , para así poder salir adelante y lograr muchos más sueños que ella tiene.
texts.en: This client is 29 years old and lives in La Paz department, in Pampahasi. She started working at the age of 20, providing an urban passenger transport service, but she also sells Esika-brand cosmetics from a catalog in order to make more income. Giovanna became independent at the age of 20. She currently lives in a house 'en anticrético' (a special kind of rental system in Bolivia) but she is making income to cover her expenses together with her husband. In this way, she was able to save up to buy the vehicle that she now has. She achieved her goal with sacrifice and perseverance. The loan that Giovanna is requesting will be used to repair the vehicle and to buy merchandise (cosmetics) so that she can get ahead and fulfil many more of the dreams that she has.

loans.use: to have working capital for her cosmetics business, and to pay to have a public transport vehicle repaired

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: From Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia, Mrs. Tep is a 21-year-old woman who has been engaged in agricultural work for many years. She is married to a man who has the same kind of job. Now they are blessed with two lovely children. Neither attends school. Mrs. Tep is busy with her work because, besides farming for six months, she spends her time making baskets and other objects, weaving together thin, bendable strips of wood to sell to local tradesmen. With the coming rainfall, Mrs. Tep has some concerns about her rice crop because it is not growing well, due to the lack of fertilizers to spread on her farmland. To solve the problem, Mrs. Tep is requesting some funds from Kiva to purchase mineral fertilizers for her crop. With the remaining money, she wishes to buy some pigs for breeding behind her house. As for her prospects, Mrs. Tep hopes that she will be able to provide her children the opportunity to join the university.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and to buy some pigs for breeding

loans.name: Benita Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Benita tiene 34 años de edad, está casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Carlos y viven en su propia casa que está situada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Benita es modista, tiene su propio taller en su domicilio y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, tiene varios clientes de la zona para quienes realiza trabajos de costura de todo tipo. Su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería por lo tanto también aporta al hogar. Gracias a que ambos son personas trabajadoras ellos pueden mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos y cubrir todos los gastos que requiere la casa.
La señora ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de insumos para su taller como ser telas, hilos, agujas y demás, los cuales son insumos necesarios para el taller de costura.
texts.en:
Benita, 34, has been married to Carlos for a long time; they live in their own house located in the city of Encarnación.

Benita is a dressmaker; she has her own home-based sewing shop and has been in this occupation for many years.  She has various customers in the area that she does all kinds of sewing jobs for.  Her husband works as a bricklayer so he also contributes to household expenses.  Thanks to their both being working people they are able to support their home, educate their children and cover necessary household expenses.

She has requested the loan to buy supplies for her shop like fabric, thread, needles and others which are the necessary supplies in a sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 54 года. Женат. У него шестеро детей. Трое его детей находятся в России. Сам Шерали при доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 40 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Sherali lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 54 years old, married and has six children.  Three of his children are in Russia.  Sherali has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables.  He has been involved in this type of business for 40 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Emelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy (pictured here), age 28, is a fruit seller. Her husband, Veasna, age 28, is an electrical teacher. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, across the Mekong River. They have been married since 2004 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One is in school and the others are still young. 

Sophy is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to teach driving. She will also use a part of the loan to buy additional fruits for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to teach driving and buy additional fruits for sale.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en:
Silverio is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.

Silverio provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and to pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Silverio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Silverio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy tools and to pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna a 52 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses quatre enfants à Wayerma II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des légumes et de tubercules tels les ignames, il y a maintenant quinze  ans. Elle mène son activité de façon ambulante et à son domicile conjugal à une  clientèle composée d’hommes et des femmes. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de continuer à collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à  son premier prêt individuel, après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, 20 sacs d’igname. Elle achète en gros sur place aux agriculteurs venant à la foire  avant de les revendre en détail aux étrangers et aux forains de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Maïmouna is 52 years old and lives in an extended family with her husband and her four children in Wayerma II, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Fifteen years ago, not having had the chance to progress far in school, she started this business buying and selling vegetables and root vegetables like yams.  She sells her vegetables on foot as well as from her home to a customer base that includes both men and women.  She has decided to continue her collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in the hopes of better satisfying her customers.  She is on her first individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso, after four group loans with a women’s association from her neighborhood, all of which were fully paid back.
With this new loan she plans on buying 20 bags of yams.  She buys wholesale on-site with farmers attending the market, and then sells retail to foreigners and stallkeepers in the city.  
She plans on using this loan to generate monthly profits of 100,000 CFA francs, which will go largely towards contributing to the family’s expenses and paying interest on her loan, with any remaining funds being re-invested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase yams

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene una comercializadora de prendas de vestir y trabaja en compañía de su señora madre dese hace 14 meses;  él quiere comprar una máquina plana, para fabricar otro tipo de prendas que pueda vender en su punto de ventas y la fabricación de ropa es ahora su máximo desafio. En la actualidad se dedica a la comercialización de ropa interior ,para damas caballeros ye infantil, así como otras prendas sencillas. La necesidad de aprovechar su punto estratégico comercial lo lleva a pensar en comprar maquinarias que le permitan vender ropa jeans y en tejido de punto. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Sato Domingo y esto es con el ánimo de continuar la expansión de su negocio, pues con este financiamiento cuenta  para ello. Su negocio ha sido importante como joven emprendedor pues tiene su fuente de empleo y desarrolla su creatividad y muchos de sus sueños como el de terminar de estudiar Ingeniería de sistemas, profesión en la que va por el segundo semestre del año.
texts.en:
David has a clothing store and has been working there alongside his mother for 14 months.  He wants to buy a sewing machine to start manufacturing other types of clothes that he can sell at his store; manufacturing clothes is his current main challenge.

He currently sells women’s, men’s and children’s underwear as well as other simple articles of clothing.  He wants to take advantage of the strategic commercial location he has and this has led him to think about buying machinery that will make it possible for him to sell jeans and knitwear.

This is the reason behind his request for a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in hopes of continuing expanding his business; the loan will make this possible.  

His business has been important to him as a young entrepreneur because he has a source of employment and it develops his creativity and many of his dreams, like finishing studying computer sciences, a profession he’s in the second semester of.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Composé de femmes mariées, les membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 de Donfana, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  avec en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Donfana qui est un village du cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles mènent toutes une activité hivernale à savoir la culture céréalière. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs productions, les membres du groupe  ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 8 ème prêt.
Massibiri, qui est la seule assise,  compte  utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de fonio, des engrais, des herbicides et payer le labour et sarclage pour son champ ayant une superficie de 1,5 hectare. Elle espère réaliser 230.000FCFA de bénéfice avec sa production destinée à la vente, à une clientèle composée généralement de revendeurs. Le bénéfice ainsi obtenu permettra de rembourser le prêt, constituer les trousseaux des jeunes filles pour leur mariage  et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer. 
NB /Ténin EST ABSENTE
texts.en:
The group "BENKADI 2 de Donfana" is composed of married women living in traditional families and averaging 35  years of age and three children each. The women all live in Donfana, which is a village in the Cercle de Kolondièba. They know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They all have rainy season work, namely the growing of grains. With the goal of increasing their production, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth loan.

Massibiri, who is the only one seated in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy fonio (millet) seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding for her field, which has an area of 1.5 hectares. 

She hopes making 230,000 francs CFA in profit from this produce, which is destined for sale to a customer base composed generally of retailers.

The profits thus obtained will enable her to repay the loan, establish hope chests for the girls' weddings, and to meet certain household needs. 

Note: Ténin is absent.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Kyere Wo Do Group

texts.en:
Patience is 30 years old. She is a hardworking woman, married with two children. 

She is a fishmonger and lives at Aboadze a suburb in Takoradi. Out of this business, she takes care of her family. 

She wants to use the loan opportunity to buy more fish to increase her stock of goods for sale.  She hopes to raise good income to help her husband pay the children’s school fees. 

She is a member of the trust group called “Kyere wo do,” which means "show your love" group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and apply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Diana did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Diana sells fish in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about six years. She is married to a fisherman, and together they have three children. Diana uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Diana will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Diana wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PARA TRATAMIENTO OFTALMICO

loans.name: Hetem

texts.en:
Hetem has been selling the sand for 2 years. He is 36, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region He and his family temporary live in in Khirdalan settlement Kushchulug massiv.
Having borrowed the loan amount of $400 he bought 1 car sand and started his business.
Now he needs the loan of $1000 to increase the variety of the  building materials.
He wants to begin selling of the cement.

loans.use: To increase the variety of selling building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane Njoki intends to buy a water tank

loans.name: Ngum Linda

texts.en:
Born in 1982, Linda is already a widow with two children to look after. Realizing the many needs of her children and herself, she is looking to expand her business. Motivated by other GHAPE members in her community, she became a member this year, in 2007. 

Given a loan of $75, she plans to buy rice, groundnuts, beans and onions to sell in her community. There is a ready market in her community for the food she will prepare. The money she generates from the business will be used to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase raw food products to sell in her community

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine T. L. is a single 23-year-old lady. She lives in Yogougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. Sandrine sells various vegetables in the Yopougon open-air market. Very dynamic and ambitious, she wants to expand her business and improve her profit margin. She joined AE&I microcredit program in 2005 and has been a good performer. Sandrine wants to develop her business and then hopes to be able to open a grocery store.

loans.use: Sandrine Tre Lou will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela is married and her husband is a carpenter. They have a son who is 5 years old. Maricela had the opportunity to start her business because it was her father's business, but he became sick and could no longer manage it. He sold it so that she could take charge and help her husband with the costs of the family. Her husband's salary is variable and sometimes he doesn't have the means to pay his basic costs. Maricela took charge of her business five years ago and added to the products she sold little by little.

She is requesting a loan of $650 to grow her business and have more space to offer a greater quantity of products. She is offering to repay the loan in 6 months. Maricela and her family very much appreciate your support so she can continue to build her business.

Maricela esta casada y su esposo es carpintero, ellos tienen un niño de cinco años de edad, ella tuvo la oportunidad de hacerse de su negocio debido a que este era el negocio de su papá, pero el enfermo y ya no podía atender el negocio y se lo vendió para que ella se hiciera cargo del mismo, con esto ella pudo ayudar en el gasto familiar a su esposo ya que su sueldo es variable y a veces no tenían los medios para solventar sus gastos básicos, ella se hizo cargo de su negocio hace 5 años atrás incrementando los productos que vendían poco a poco.

Maricela esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 650 para poder ampliar su negocio y tener mayor espacio para poder ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally T. (age 55) and his family live in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Phally and his wife, Heng Vung (see photo), were married in 1978 in a large group wedding arranged by the Khmer Rouge, who then held power. Phally went to school through the fourth grade, and Heng never attended school. They have seven children, all of whom still live at home with their parents. One daughter has a business as a hairdresser. Three still study in school.

Phally and his wife are requesting this, their third loan from MAXIMA, for $700 to buy a cart and a second horse. Phally will use the horses and cart to haul dirt used for fill on construction projects. In addition to the hauling business, they grow produce (squash) and are currently raising three cows. Heng also sells fish in the market in their village.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart

loans.name: Kabowa 3 (A) Group

texts.en: Rose is 34-year-old widow with four children. She owns and works in a  beauty salon, and she and her co-applicants have applied for a loan to buy additional supplies and equipment for this business. Rose intends to use the income made possible by the loan to pay school fees for her children and start a new business raising poultry.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Sonia D. was the founder of the committee of women. She gathered both her neighbors and her friends who had their own businesses and who wanted to increase their success. Together they meet and ask for loans, discuss business plans and support each other. These women are encouraging entrepreneurship and financial stability.

They all have different businesses and therefore the loan will be used in many different ways to buy clothing to sell, merchandise for the home, and also for food to be sold in their grocery stores.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, flour, bread items, dairy, drinks, fruits, vegetables, baking goods, cleaning products, clothing and other household goods.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. has been in the provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks business for 10 years. She is married with 2 children and is 41 years old. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount  of $450 to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions for sale

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria O. has been selling bread out of her own bakery for 20 years in Condega, a town in the city of Estelí. She started her business with little money but as time passed she was able to move forward. Today she has a better store for business and has hired two young men who help her make all types of bread. They also help her buy products when it is necessary to go out and buy something new.

Ceprodel has been an important pillar of support in the development of Mrs. O.'s business. For more than two years Ceprodel has provided Maria with credits that have enabled her to purchase more raw materials for making bread. Today she needs these raw materials so that she can make her delicious bread and distribute it in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria O. desde hace 20 años se dedica al negocio de venta de pan teniendo su propia panadería en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Con poco capital inició su negocio pero a través del tiempo ha logrado salir adelante y hoy en día posee un mejor local para el negocio y además ha contratado a dos jóvenes que le trabajan en la elaboración del pan de diferente tipo y en la compra de los productos cuando es necesario salir a buscarlos.

Ceprodel ha sido una columna importante en el mejoramiento de su negocio por el hecho que desde hace dos años atrás le ha venido apoyando otorgándole créditos que le han permitido adquirir su materia prima para la elaboración de los diferentes tipos de pan. Hoy en día su necesidad radica en la urgencia de la compra de esta materia prima para lograr elaborar el delicioso pan y comercializarlo en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her business

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
The lady lives in the home of her parents on Mururata street in the Villa La Merced zone of the city of La Paz. She is a teacher of natural science, but the salary that she receives (like most teachers) is very little, so she is obligated to earn her living with an additional activity; in this case selling natural beauty products, specifically those of the Natural Avon brand. This is what allows her to improve her income and cover all her expenses.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but she is qualified to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Mururata de la zona villa La Merced de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es profesora de Ciencias naturales, pero el sueldo que percibe (al igual que muchos docentes) es muy bajo, por lo cual esta obligada a subsistir con una actividad adicional, en este caso vendiendo productos naturales de belleza, específicamente de la marca Natura Avon. Lo que le permite mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir todas sus necesidades.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO, pero esta calificada para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase natural beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a widow who supports herself and her family with a hair salon business. Her husband passed away in 2005. Since that time she has been raising their three children, the oldest of whom is about 17. Her business has been a very important source of income for her. She has extensive experience in this area, having been in business for over 15 years. She currently has a good location for her business in a prominent part of the city.

Svetlana has requested a loan so that she can have some remodeling done to her salon. She hopes to be able to attract new clients and increase her profits. Svetlana has been a client with Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine since 2004. She has a great credit history and a very good support group. We are excited to have another opportunity to assist her in operating a successful business.

loans.use: Remodel her hair salon

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of H. A. and they live in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children: five sons and two daughters. Her first two sons have a power loom business, and the other three are enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Her two daughters make decorative embroidery clothes, and her husband has a wood business. She successfully completed her loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a loan for her husband’s wood business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Irshad baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Shakeela baji wants a loan for her meat business. Suraiya baji also wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Khalida baji wants a loan for her fruit business.

This is a group loan, and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Stojanka

texts.en:
Stojanka is a young woman from the community of Drijen, outside Derventa. She is not married and is the sole caretaker for her 2-year-old child. She works as a clerk in a shop and gets about 500 KM (US$ 400) a month through this job.

Stojanka has started a small part-time business working as a typist, and she types up papers for students or other individuals who do not have computers or who do not have time to do this themselves. It is her intent to use this, her first loan from Zene za Zene towards buying a printer. Stojanka needs to make this purchase to cut down on her costs and keep her business going.

loans.use: To buy a printer to use for her typing business

loans.name: Maria Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora María Genoveva, tiene 61 años, está casada, estudió secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres no tenían recursos económicos para poder ayudarla, después la socia se casó, al poco tiempo estudió corte y confección, bordados a máquina, repostería, ahora tiene 05 hijos, se encuentran trabajando, vive en el Distrito D. Trujillo en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.
La empresaria tiene 20 años en el negocio D. repostería y costura. En repostería prepara tortas, arroz con leche, panqueques, mazamorra, los distribuye  a sus vecinas y en costura, elabora faldas y pijamas, los ofrece en Chiclin, Chimbote. Tiene 3 años en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, una señora la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO” ella decidió participar en este Banco por la facilidad D. tener capital, ser independiente y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró tazones, arroz, leche, maíz, azúcar, pasas, guindones, etc.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1700.00, que cancelará en un plazo D. 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. maíz, telas para hacer cortinas, hilos.
La socia sueña con tener un negocio D. repostería en su casa
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Genoveva is 61 years old, married, finished secondary school, but could not continue her studies because her parents did not have the resources to support her. After marrying her husband, she studied design and tailoring, machine embroidery, and pastry-making. She has 5 children and lives in the Trujillo District and Province in the Libertad Department (like states). The businesswoman has worked in pastry-making and tailoring for 20 years. In her bakery she makes cakes, rice with milk (a regional favorite), pancakes, and mazamorra (a pudding-like dessert maD. of corn), which she distributed to her neighbors. In tailoring, she makes dressed, skirts, pajamas, that she sells in Chiclin, Chimbote.

She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos Movement bank for 3 years. A woman recommended the community bank "Successful Women" and she decided to become a partner in order to obtain capital and be independent. With her first loan of $100 she purchased soup bowls, rice, milk, corn, sugar, raisins, cherries, and the like. With this loan of $575, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will invest in corn, materials to make curtains, and string. The businesswoman dream of having a bakery business in her home.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies.  Purhcase of material in bulk.

loans.name: Ayaz

texts.en:
Ayaz H. is 34 years old. He and his wife, a housekeeper, are raising four children. Ayaz's children are small now, but he is already working hard to ensure the best possible future for them. He makes a living by selling foodstuff like pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, caned meat, mayonnaise and other items in a store that he rents. Ayaz has been in this business for ten years. He is very polite and his store is very popular with local residents, whose patronage allows him to earn a good income for his family. 

Ayaz has applied for a loan of $1000 USD and will use the loan to buy more items to sell. This will allow him to earn more and meet the needs of his family. Ayaz thanks you for your support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Charly Jannisse

texts.es: La señora Charly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Piura Nº 151, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 1 hija menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad cuenta con una motokar como herramienta de trabajo, la cual hace trabajar todos los días para tener ingresos económicos que le permita pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. nnCon este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 llantas, 2 frenos, tapizará los asientos, arreglará el motor, etc.nnCharly manifiesta que todas las mujeres pueden salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y voluntad.n
texts.en:
Charly belongs to the comunal bank “Vecinas Unidas” (“United Neighbors”), located in the Calleria district of the Colonel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 30 years old, and is the mother of one young daughter who is still dependent on her. She is married, and her husband dedicates himself to driving a motokar. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in clothing sales. She has been working with the communal bank for two years. Currently, she relies on a motokar as her tool, and she works it every day to earn income that will allow her to make her loan payments on time. With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 2 tires, 2 brakes, reupholster the seats, fix the engine, etc. Charly states that all women can get ahead with effort and will.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires, brakes, seating upholstery, etc.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La señora Lita, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, artículos de plásticos, bebidas gasificadas. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  algunos productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, artículos de higiene personal, además comprará una congeladora para vender carnes y bebidas heladas con la finalidad de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Lita tiene 40 años de edad, vive con sus 03 hijos y su esposo quien también es negociante de granos. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Lita is a member of the communal bank "Doradinas en Accion", and she lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of Dorado, in the district of San Jose de Sisa. She sells groceries, plastic articles, and sodas. Her store is located in her home, where her clients come daily. With this S./1000 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy some first necessity items such as rice, sugar, personal hygiene items. She will also buy a freezer so that she can sell frozen meat and drinks in order to satisfy her customer's needs. Lita is 40 years old, and she lives with her husband (who also sells grains) and their 3 children. She is very thankful for all the support that she has received. Her goal is to grow her business and buy her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, personal hygiene items and a freezer.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Kishwar M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
I am Kishwar and I belong to a city named Vehari, Pakistan.  I have been living in this city for the past 40 years.  I am an uneducated lady, but I know how to embroider dresses and how to sew clothes.  It’s a high demand profession in Pakistan.  

I am a married woman and my husband's name is M. A..  He has a grocery shop.  He has been running this shop for the past 40 years.  I have three kids: two sons and one daughter.  All of my children are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education. 

I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now I am applying for my second loan to diversify my husband’s grocery shop. 

I am a group leader of a few more members in my locality.  Razia Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Shazia Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  Irfana Baji and Sumera Baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.  Zareena Mai Baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her cold drink corner. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Rours

texts.en: Mrs. Rours Y. is a villager in Pour village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a duck breeder. Since her duck breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks and duck food for her breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Uch Ey, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Rours Y. is a 54-year-old mother of a child who is a tailor in the house.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and duck food for her breeding business.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells drinks, provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of  70, 000NGN to purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She is a Lapo client. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn S., 40, is a rice farmer who lives in the Prey Veng province. She grows rice two times a year and is able to make about US$1 every day. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. He typically earns US$2 per day. This family is also supported by one child who works as a construction worker. Horn S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has owned a small food vendor store for four years. She also sells bites in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa.

She belongs to Semtema "A" West group loan (Group code: 2022). Martha currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for 13 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Martha is 29 years old, married, and has three children, ages 9, 5 and 1. She also cares for five additional dependants.

loans.use: Buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A. is a 27-year-old mother of three children, ages 9, 5 and 3. The older two are in school. She buys used clothes from the Kibuye market here in Kisumu and transports the clothes to Nyamasaria slum, where she lives. She says that her husband cannot find work right now and she is supporting her family herself. She is asking for 10,000 Kenyan Shillings.

Ruth recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells stationery and drinks in her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 140,000 nairas to purchase more stationery and drinks to sell. Grace is 44-years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery and drinks

loans.name: Norboy

texts.ru: Хасанов Норбой житель города Яван. Живет очень далеко от города. Жители той местности занимаются сельским хозяйством , а так же животноводством. Основными источниками дохода той местности и являются эти два вида бизнеса. Норбой как и все . Сейчас посевной сезон и ему необходим кредит для закупки семян и удобрений. Это поможет ему своевременно произвезти посев и получить качественный урожай.
texts.en:
Norboy H. lives in a very remote area of Yavan. Yavan residents make their living by animal breeding and agriculture. Norboy is no exception. At the moment he needs to purchase seeds and fertilizers. A loan that he is applying for would help to complete everything on time and to get a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Married with three children, Comfort is a forty-year-old trader. She has a girl and two boys who are currently in school. She trades in maize cereals. She has been trading for the past fifteen years and has been a good resource for her family. She treks to the farming communities, such as Afram Plains in the eastern region of Ghana, to buy her foodstuffs and then retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. This she believes would enable her save more to support her children in school. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Yonko Do’.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of cereals like maize.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma C. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 33 years old. Wilma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Wilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario del Carmen S. D. M. resiD. en el municipio D. Sacacoyo  en el departamento La Libertad.  Rosario vive con su esposo y su pequeño niño Saúl D. 12 meses, el esposo D. Rosario es comerciante el posee un negocio en Santa Tecla y Rosario ha montado un ciber café en la casa donD. viven, tiene al servicio D. sus clientes una mínima cantidad D. maquinas trabajando, el crédito que Rosario solicita es para invertir en sus negocio ofreciendo otros servicios y productos como materiales D. papelería, cd´s y consolas D. videojuegos para alquilar por hora.
texts.en:
Rosario del Carmen S. D. M. lives in the municipality of Sacacoyo in the department of La Libertad. Rosario lives with her husband and her small child, Saúl, who is 12 months old. Rosario’s husband is a shopkeeper and has a business in Santa Tecla, and Rosario has set up an internet café in their house. She has a minimal number of functioning machines for her customers. Rosario is asking for a loan to invest in her business, offering other services and products such as stationery, CDs, and video game consoles to rent by the hour.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business and offer other services

loans.name: Albaida

texts.en:
Albaida is 25 years old and is single with no children. Albaida raises and sells chickens, a business that produces good profits, in the city of Pucallpa.  Albaida's business runs in a 45-day cycle.  She purchases her chicks, feeds them well, and is ready to sell them after 1.5 months when they are fully grown. Albaida raises 120 chickens at a time and reports that her earnings are improving.    

Albaida has been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for one year and belongs to the "Las Doncellas" communal bank. She plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to purchase more chicks and the food that they will need.

Albaida's goal is to construct a larger chicken coop where she will be able to keep 500 chickens instead of just 120.

loans.use: Chicks and food for them

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y no tiene hijos, ella pudo estudiar la secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Yaurima.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder comprar papa para la elaboración de tunta (chuño), también comprar ganado menor en las mismas ferias regionales.  Su actividad la realiza solo los días de ferias..

Su deseo es comprarse un carro y seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la forma de trabajar con las socias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of "21 de Febrero" community bank, in the Ilave district of El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 32 years old, is married and doesn't have children. She has completed secondary education and lives in the Yaurima neighborhood. Rosa has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to purchase small livestock. Currently, she needs a loan of 800 PEN. This loan will allow her to buy potatoes to make tunta (chuño, freeze-dried potato traditionally made in Quechua and Aymara communities). She will also buy small livestock in the regional markets. Rosa works on market days only. She hopes to buy a cart and continue working. Rosa likes to save money and the way the members of her community bank work together.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep and potatoes.

loans.name: Adjoa Bella

texts.fr: Cette dame a décidé, en 2004, de se lancer dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale pour couvrir les besoins financiers de son foyer. Elle est mariée et depuis que son mari a eu sa retraite, elle a vite compris qu’elle doit exercer une activité génératrice de revenus pour faire vivre son foyer. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 12 bidons d’huile, 20 cartons de pâte alimentaire spaghetti, 05 cartons d’huile et divers produits comme 15 cartons de savons de toute sorte. Elle exerce son activité dans le quartier Agoè Assiyéyé à Lomé.
texts.en:
In 2004 Madame A. decided to start selling general food products to cover her household expenses. She is married, and after her husband retired, she quickly understood that she would have to generate some income to keep the household going. In order to purchase new stock, Madame A. would like a loan from Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 12 cans of oil, 20 boxes of spaghetti, five cases of oil and various other products such as 15 cases of different soaps. She conducts her business activities in the Agoè Assiyéyé neighborhood in Lomé.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general food products.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita patiently manages a village store for ten years.  Her family is also engaged in livestock and farming as their alternative source of income.  She wanted to avail a loan amounting to PHP14, 000 for the maintenance of her businesses so that she could generate higher income. Having the amount will enable her to buy stock of merchandise to retail in her store and feeds supply for her livestock business. However, her farming is being maintained through her generated income from her store. She believes that hard works is the key to success.  

Emerita is already a widow and she was left with her son named Norman.  She solely manages their family and she is quite sad because she was not able to provide a good education for her son.  At the moment, her son makes an earning out from his tricycle transport business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
la sra. Reina Isabel L. D. tiene 42 años de edad, es casada con elsr. Alfredo Aguilera Ramirez, tienen 3 hijos los cuales estudian en el colegio, Reina se dedica a la venta de ropa americana desde hace 5 años, Reina necesita el credito para comprar mas fardos de ropa ya que este tipo de ropa se vende bastante, porque es barata y de buena calidad, los fines de semana siempre vende mucho y se queda sin producto, desea comprar 2 o 3 fardos y asi poder tener varia mercaderia, siempre en los fardos viene ropa que no se vende o que viene dañada y eso hace que exista un margen de perdida, pero siempre se le saca el total del costo del fardo y ganancias.
su meta es poder tener un local o en su casa de habitacion remodelar para hacer una tienda en la cual tenga mucha ropa.
tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, dice que sus hijos son sus ojos, algo que es muy preciado por los seres humanos y que va a trabajar hasta verlos graduados de la universidad, para que sean hombres de bien y buenos profesionales.

loans.use: compra de fardo de ropa

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma C. is a resident of Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. With the support of her parents, she graduated with the Degree of Bachelor of Science in Accountancy. After this, she married to Francisco C. and they are blessed with five children.  Being responsible parents is their great obligation to support their children for their financial needs and moral support. 
Her husband is the one who manages their farm lots by planting variety of vegetables while Wilma engaged in selling herbal bath soaps and smoked fish in their village to help her husband in gaining income. With a small capital, she used to acquire her products from Solano Public Market and sell them to their village. Since her income is not sufficient to the family, she needs to earn more income to meet their daily needs especially for the schooling of their children. Due to lack of capital, she applied for loans from KIVA lenders, she is requesting an amount of P 5,000 to be added in her capital to acquire additional items to her products. She believes that through hard work and sacrifices, she could able to improve her small business and finance the schooling of their children.

loans.use: for purchasing additional items to sell

loans.name: Mayaqui Sartasiñani Group

texts.es: Mayaqui Sartasiñani es un grupo numeroso de 16 integrantes, todas alegres y carismáticas, este grupo se reúne cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal German Busch. Su presidenta es Beatriz E. indica que están juntas hace 4 años aproximadamente y en esta oportunidad también necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan ya que todas tienen diversas actividades, pero  la mayoría teje mantas para mujeres, especialmente para que se luzcan en diferentes fiestas, otra buena parte vende ropa de mujer, hombre y niño, las demás integrantes tienen negocios como venta de papa frita, cereales y fruta.
texts.en:
Mayaqui Sartasiñani is a group of 16 entrepreneurs, all of them happy and charismatic. They meet every two weeks in the German Busch regional office of Pro Mujer. Their president, Beatriz E., states that they have been together about 4 years and at this time need a loan to buy merchandise and raw materials for the various diverse businesses in the group.

The majority of group members sew traditional women’s shawls, especially those that are worn in holiday celebrations. Another large part of the group is in sales of women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing. The others have businesses such as the sale of fried potatoes, grains, or fruit.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Asef

texts.en: Asef is a 29-year-old single man living alone. He has owned an aluminum manufacturing and assembly shop for the past two years and had 7 years of previous experience in the field. Today, Asef is requesting a $1,200 loan in order to purchase new inventory for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma T. is from the village of Rizal. She is 57 years old. Norma is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business making and selling cooked food for daily meals, and, at the same time, selling food supplements, such as ALIVE products.  Norma earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of flour and coal

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group No. 11

texts.en:
Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70 kilometers from Dakar. The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood. The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities. Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with Kiva partner, UIMCEC. Groups of five are financed through ten-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount. On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments. Currently, there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC. Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. CoumB. F., the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.
Fatou F. is the young head of group No. 11. She is among the many women who sell vegetables in the market of Grand Thies, a neighborhood in the middle of the city. She sells cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes and other vegetables, depending on the season. She explains that she started out on her own in the market, and likes the daily interactions with the other vendors.
