Group No. 11's other members are: Fatou Diarra G. and Aissatou L., who both sell lettuce and tomatoes; Sagar B., who sells fresh fish; and Awa F., who sells used clothing. Each of the group's members receives 100,000 XOF to bolster their activities.

loans.use: To bolster her small business

loans.name: Mam

texts.en: Almost all of the people who live in Kampong Chhnang province earn a living as a basket weaver. One of these people, Mrs. Mam S., operates her own small handicraft business, mainly weaving bamboo baskets. She has a partner in her husband, who assists her with weaving and selling items. The couple is blessed with five children; one is married and the others are single and working. Mam S. owns a small house that is overcrowded for her family. So, she has requested a loan to add to her personal savings in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
el señor Modesto Q. tiene 65 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos todos grandes.
Modesto se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, tiene varios años de realizar este tipo de actividad, los pescados los vende en su comunidad y en la ciudad de Nacaome.
Modesto esta solicitando el credito para compra de pescado seco ya que se acerca la epoca de semana santa en donde este tipo de producto se vende bastante para hacer la tradicional sopa de torta de pescado.
texts.en:
Modesto Q. is 65 years old, and has 4 children, all grown up. Modesto works buying and selling fish. He has worked for years doing this activity, and sells thr fish in his community and in the city of Nacaome. Modesto is seeking a credit to buy dried fish as Easter is coming and this type of product is sold quite a lot, to make the traditional fish cake soup.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna B., 32, operates a fish retailing business. Her husband is a fisherman and they own a small boat. The couple also farm seaweed which helps supplement their income.

"My business is going so well now and it really helps my family buy food, clothing and other basic needs", she said. 

She is the mother of two children. Her eldest child is only 11 years old and is at high school.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures to buy fishing materials

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos L. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito, fue de mucha ayuda para su negocio ya que pudo entregar los pedidos que tenia pendiente a tiempo, también fue muy favorable para su familia.
Esta nuevamente solicitando su cooperación en este crédito, para comprar una maquina para soldar ya que pudo ocupar otra persona para que le ayude con el trabajo. 
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la comprar de la maquina y mas materia prima. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte de las ganancias, ya que el negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos Llanos is grateful for your support of his previous loan. It was very helpful to his business as he was able to deliver the orders that were outstanding on time. It was also very beneficial for his family. Once again he is asking for your help for a loan to buy a soldering machine, since he is now able to hire another person to help with the work but does not have enough money to buy the machine or the raw materials. He plans to repay the loan with part of his earnings, as this business is the source of his family income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials (steel) and a soldering machine..

loans.name: Wilfredo De Los Angeles

texts.es: El  Sr. Wilfredo de los Ángeles M. C.   él es trabajadora del Hotel de playa Barceló Monte limar el tiene de elaborar para esta empresa seis años, es padre de tres hijos dos  en edad escolar, el es acompañado actualmente. El ha tenido  seis   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito él lo quiere para hacer una ampliación y mejora en su casa de habitación y así tener una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo de los Angeles works at the Barceló Monte Limar beach hotel. He has been employed at this enterprise for 6 years and is the father of 3 children, 2 of whom are school age. He is living with someone at present. Wilfredo has had 6 loans with CEPRODEL and he took out each one to make improvements on his home. He will use the present loan to expand and improve his house and thus, make it a worthy home.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS SUCH AS SAND AND CEMENT FOR IMPROVING HIS HOME

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en:
Elkana B. is a married father of four. His wife is Tecla B.. He lives and farms in Kapkoros where he sells his farm produce to others for income. He had been in this business for the last 20 years. He normally targets wholesalers in Eldoret town. 

Elkana was introduced to KADET by other existing customers. Before joining Kadet, Elkana used to plant on a one-acre piece of land, but after getting some loans from Kadet, he has grown and he now plants maize on four acres. He has also been able to buy three dairy cows and he sells milk and gets an income from this, as well.

Elikana has applied for another loan which he will use to prepare his land, buy seeds and fertilizers, and buy more feed for his dairy cows. He believes he is a hard-worker and that he will soon be financially stable.

loans.use: To prepare his four acres of land, buy seeds and fertilizers and to improve his dairy farming

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en casa de su suegra. Hace mas de 3 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público, en donde su esposo es el encargado de conducir el vehiculo, recorriendo las rutas locales de su  ciudad, mientras que María se encarga de administrar las ganancias. Asimismo deriva parte de sus ingresos en un negocio que acaba de iniciar el negocio de venta de dulces en un cafetín escolar y que mas adelante tiene el propósito de arrendar todo el cafetín. Por toro lado, el servicio de transporte que ofrece es rentable, es así que estos dos negocios le dará las ganancias necesarias para cubrir la necesidades de su hogar, además desea darle mantenimiento a su vehiculo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto promete en ser muy responsable con sus pagos. El crédito que solicita, invertirá para pagar el servicio del mecánico, en donde llevará a darle mantenimiento a su carro, asimismo comprará algunos repuestos.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in her mother-in-laws’ home. For more than 3 years she has been in the public transportation business, and her husband is in charge of driving the car by traveling the local routes of his city, while María is in charge of managing their income. She also gets part of her revenue from selling candy in a school cafeteria and in the future she plans to lease the entire cafeteria. The transportation service is profitable and with both businesses she will have enough earnings to meet the needs of her home and she also wants to service her vehicle. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) which is why she promises to be very responsible with her payments. The loan will be used to pay the mechanic for his work where she will take her car to be serviced and to buy some spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To service a car and to buy some spare parts.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio B., 27 years old, is single and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. 

From a very young age, he began to weave with his mother and to sell their products in surrounding cities. Today he is self-employed and has a large, formal base of clients. Thanks to his work he was able to buy his own vehicle and can also help his mother with her bills. 

He is requesting a loan to buy hammocks, blankets, and bed sheets as he has many orders for these types of products.

loans.use: to purchase quilts, blankets, tablecloths, and bed sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build an additional room to be used as a kitchen

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam D. (pictured above), age 50, and her husband, Mr. Kem Sam, age 53, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have nine children: seven sons and two daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home, one is a construction worker, three are in school and one assists his parents in the business. 

Seam and her husband have been raising pigs and producing rice wine since 1981. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase additional piglets to raise. She will use part of her loan to buy a motorbike to carry rice wine to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Marther

texts.en:
Marther D. is currently in the business of selling both dried and fresh fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell.  Marther is 46 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has five children and they go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by purchaing bags of pulses and beans, and also, build a shop from which these food items can be sold.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Budondo Development Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
Sixteen years down the road is not easy mileage, especially when you are talking about operating a business in a rural area such as Budondo-Jinja. 

The poultry business that 56-year-old B. Feibe runs could be bringing her more profits if she were operating in an urban setting. Chicken is a highly favored delicacy in urban areas in Uganda. Despite this fact she has to find a way to make ends meet. While $22 may be minimal for this married mother of 13, she knows she has her responsibilities cut out for her, bearing in mind the many children she has. 

She began this business after she got apprentice training from the national agricultural advisory service people in her rural area. She initially began with farming. She still runs her farm. With this loan, Feibe says she wants to buy more layer chickens for her business. In the course of time she says she will resell so that she can increase her profit margins.

loans.use: To buy more layer chickens that she will eventually resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REAL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Ruth; ella tiene 39 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista; La socia  compra al por mayor y vende electrodomésticos desde hace 6 años, y repuestos también, La socia es una mujer muy emprendedora y viaja hasta Bolivia para poder obtener precios más cómodos y así tener mayor ganancia, La socia viaja cada 15 días, ella tiene sus proveedores y muchas veces le envían a ella los productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de este un capital para poder amortizar un primer pago.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ruth Q. belongs to the communal bank "REAL." She lives in the Santiago district of the province and department of Cusco. Ruth is 39 years old and is the single mother of a son. She alternates her activities in the house with her retail trade business. She has had a business buying household appliances at wholesale and then selling them for 6 years. She also sells spare parts for the appliances. She is a very enterprising woman who travels to Bolivia to get the best prices; this way her profits are better. She travels every 15 days. She has her suppliers, and many times they send her the products. Ruth is requesting a loan to use as capital to pay off a previous loan. Ruth values and appreciates the loan granted, since it will allow her to grow the business and have a better quality of life. She also pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will use this loan to pay off a previous loan

loans.name: Juventino

texts.es: Juventino C. Hernández  y su esposa desean hacerle mejoras a su casita ya que es ahí donde vieron crecer a sus hijos. La casa necesita enjarre por dentro y por fuera pues las paredes ya están muy deterioradas por el tiempo, para poder realizar su proyecto ellos necesitan comprar material. Juventino todavía es apoyado por sus hijos que tienen trabajos muy buenos y el también trabaja para un maestro dando mantenimiento a su casa.
texts.en:
Juventino C. Hernández and his wife want to make improvements on their little house since it is there that they watched their children grow. The home needs plaster inside and outside. The walls have deteriorated over time. In order to do this project they need to buy material. Juventino is still supported by his children who have very good jobs and he also works for a builder maintaining his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster the interior and exterior of the house

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a resident of a small city in Pakistan called Pakpattan, known for its old history. She owns a small house of two rooms there and has been living in it with her family for over ten years. She is 45 years old and is married with no children.

Shamim is a very hardworking lady. She spends her time in doing household chores and operating her bread-making business. Her nature of work is totally different.

She makes bread in an oven made of mud. She has the oven in her house and serves a large clientele base every day. She sells each loaf for 5 PKRs. She does this work for two reasons: first to earn money so that her family finances run smoothly and secondly she loves this work and in this way her time goes fast in the house.

Her husband’s name is M. A. who is a private entrepreneur and deals in wheat. He buys wheat wholesale and sells it to different shops and to his customers as well. He has been doing this work for past ten years.

Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan he will buy more wheat to increase his sales. She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable investment for her husband.

In the photo, the person with raised hand is Shamim and the one who is making bread is her group member named Zainab who also has the same business as Shamim.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more wheat to sell

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: El Sr. Alcides  casado con la señora Ibelia hace  31 años, tienen 4 hijos  dos están con ellos uno de 2 0 y 1 7 años sus otros dos hijos están casados. Los señores viven en el  barrio los Tusequis. Don Alcides de dedica al Rubro del transporte hace  25 años,  su señora es costurera, ella le ayuda  con los gastos del hogar. El crédito que se le otorgo al sr. es para el mantenimiento de su vehículo (reparación caja automática, equipo de gas, dirección hidráulica compra de llanta y cambio de aceite u otros) El cliente agradecido infinitamente con la  institución  por la agilidad y la eficiencia que se le atendió deseándolos mucha prosperidad.
texts.en:
Alcides has been married to Ibelia for 31 years. They have four children. Two of them, ages 20 and 17, live with them. The other two are married. They live in the Tusequis district. Alcides has been working in transportation for 25 years. His wife is a seamstress and helps him with the household expenses. The loan granted to Alcides will be used for maintaining his vehicle (repairing the transmission, gas equipment, power steering, purchase of tires, oil change and others). He is forever thankful to the bank for the promptness and efficiency in helping him and wishes them great prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sandra del Carmen P., tienen la edad de 41 años, vive en el Barrio El Edén es casada, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan por cuenta propia y sobreviven bajo sus propios medios, ellos son agricultores desde hace 20 años y durante este largo periodo se han enfrentado a las plagas y sequias, y es para sus cultivos que solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos, que permitan una mejor cosecha que favorezca a un incremento en las ventas, y a futuro contar con los recursos económicos para remodelar su hogar y dejársela de herencia a sus hijos para el bienestar y provecho de sus futuras familias.
texts.en: Sandra del Carmen Perez, 41, lives in the El Eden neighborhood.  She is married and they have 3 adult children who work on their own and support themselves.  Sandra and her husband have been farmers for 20 years, and over this long period of time they have confronted diseases and droughts.  They request a loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and farming supplies for their crops.  This will allow them to have a better harvest and increase their sales and, in the future, have the resources to renovate their home and leave an inheritance to their children for the benefit and well-being of their future families.

loans.use: supplies to maintain the health of their crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, pepper, onions, salt, seasonings etc.

loans.name: Evans Makas

texts.en:
Evans Makas is 33 years old and married to Betty Cherono, a pre-school teacher who also supports him in his business and with basic needs for their family. They have been blessed with two children: Kieth, 7 years old, and Staisy, 4 years old. Evans runs a hotel business at Kampi ya Moto trading centre in the town of Koibatek; he started this business three years ago. Evans has borrowed 20,000 KES for his second loan, having successfully repaid his first one.
  
Evans plans to use the loan to purchase stock for his hotel, such as cooking fat, sugar, salt, beans, rice, wheat flour, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other items. Evans anticipates using the profits from the business to expand it. In the future, he would like to buy a plot of land to build residential houses. He dreams of owning a residential estate in the future and also giving the best education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the hotel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials to make "deel" (traditional Mongolian coats)

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: K. Cissy  lives in Kawala in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother and sister).  Cissy has a business selling religious articles. She has been in this business for nine years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Cissy sells her products door-to-door at retail. Cissy has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of candles, bibles, rosaries and other religious booklets. She also generates additional income through beads. The main business challenge(s) for Cissy include the rainy season and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and to go directly to the producers. Cissy lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.Her major monthly expenses include rent school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of candles, bibles, rosaries and other religious booklets

loans.name: Khaticha's Group

texts.en:
Microfinancing is very useful in improving social living in Kyrgyzstan.  People who are in need of financial assistance are tired of high interest payments to local banks. Kiva has become a blessing for thousands of families throughout the country, and is making confident steps for further development into the future.

Khaticha A., 42, is a leader of this group. She is a farmer in a small southern village called Aravan.  This has become a lifetime occupation for her, since she has been farming and staying close to nature from early childhood.  At this moment, Khaticha is working on preparing land for cultivation. Her husband works in construction and electrical maintenance. Her children are all dependent on this  family income, including the youngest one, who is 10 years old. Khaticha also has to take care of arranging a wedding ceremony for her oldest daughter. 

Khaticha’s group looks forward to having this loan and maintaining each one’s own business.  With this loan, Khaticha plans to purchase fertilizers and pay transportation bills. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers & pay transporation bills

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario Vive en el municipio de el torno,  es nacido en el departamento de Potosí, capital minera de Bolivia, es de ocupación comerciante de papa, también en distintas épocas se dedica a la venta de animales como ser cerdos, vaca, gallinas, otros, lo cual le genera el ingreso para mantener a su familia, es separado tiene dos hijos los cuales están a su cargo, el destino del crédito es para la compra de papa, el cual es su actividad principal, tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado central el torno, es cliente antiguo, se siente agradecido por el apoyo y confianza que la institución le brindo.
texts.en:
Mario lives in the municipality of El Torno.  He was born in Potosí department, Bolivia’s mining capital.  He is a potato merchant and during certain seasons he sells farm animals like pigs, cows, chickens and others which generate income to support his family. He’s separated and has two children in his care.

He will use the loan to buy potatoes which is his main activity.  He has his sales stand in El Torno’s Central Market.  He is a longstanding client.  He feels grateful for the support and trust the institution has placed in him.

loans.use: To buy quintals of potatoes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He operates Seta Plumbers Enterprise where he is a plumber. In addition, Peter sells water for extra income. He has three years of experience in the plumbing business and was previously employed by a plumbing company where he gained his skills. Peter employs one person in his business and he is looking forward to hiring more in the future. Through Faulu Kenya, Peter has managed to open a kiosk and he has also expanded his business to charge mobile phone batteries for a fee. 

Peter is requesting 70,000 KES to buy pipes and fittings.

loans.use: to buy fittings and pipes

loans.name: Daniel Kiptoo

texts.en:
Daniel Kiptoo K. is fifty five years old, married and a father of four children.  They all live in Cheplaskei in the outskirts of Eldoret town, where Daniel operates a food cafe in the same area. Daniel has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be Daniel's first loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to buy new utensils for the cafe like buy new spoons, plates, serving dishes etc, and with the income he is going to get he plans to save up and open another cafe. 

In the future Daniel wants to educate his children to the highest level and also expand his business and ensure a better living standard for the family

loans.use: To buy utensils for the cafe

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya that produces milk, vegetables, eggs and bananas. She has been in the farming business for eight years now and sells his products to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested for a loan of KES 81,600 through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to improve the livelihood of his family. He plans to acquire at least 5 more dairy cows and a posho mill in the next 5 years. He faces the challenge of diseases and the high cost of artificial insemination services.

Andrew is 40 years old and married. He has 6 children whose ages rage between 18 months and 18 years. Four of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Pok is a widow with two children who are both too young to work or study. She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn some money to support her family. She is also a farmer, and owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she plants rice.  She sells part of her rice yield and uses the other part to feed her family. She is having some problems with her land at this time because her soil is infertile. So to improve rice production, Pok is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline, and to hire farm laborers to plow her fields. She is also going to buy more groceries.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with eleven children, ten of whom attend school, while one is married. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Fatuma joined Yehu microfinance to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Tawadzana Group

texts.en:
Ellen M. is the leader of Tawadzana Group. She is 63 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom are now married. She takes care of a grandchild, age 15, and her late sister's child, also age 15. She has been running a tailoring business since 1997 and makes chair backs and seat covers. These products are sold to the local market in Zimbabwe and also to ladies who resell mainly in South Africa. In addition, she owns a grinding mill in Banket (Zimbabwe) where she grinds maize for mealie meal used to cook the country’s staple food. Her other income comes from a room she is letting at her house. The challenges to her business are low capital base and business fluctuations with very low sales in some months. 

Ellen requested this loan through MicroKing for the purpose of purchasing materials to make seat covers and chair backs.  She says the extra income would significantly help her reduce the burden on her children as she normally asks for capital injection from them. In future she would like to generate more income in order to buy a cash-generating asset as the current job is now heavy for her.

loans.use: to purchase sewing material for seat covers and chair backs

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia is 57 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Deogracia has an RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) business in the Philippines. Deogracia requested a 13,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell. 

Deogracia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Deogracia would like to make some house improvements.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice currently sells paste. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom go to school. Alice borrowed a loan to stock more paste to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more paste to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es  soltera de 41 años de edad, vive en su casa propia sola, la cual cuenta con el servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el caserío Sialupe Baca a una hora aproximadamente del departamento de Lambayeque.   Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana.

Isabel se dedica a la comercialización de chicha de jora (bebida realizada a base de maíz molido que lo dejan fermentar y luego le colocan otros insumos y está lista para consumirla), lo  prepara en su mismo domicilio y los deja fermentar en unas vasijas de cerámica, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, ya que por costumbre esta receta pasa de generación en generación en esa zona, luego lo ofrece a sus clientes que la conocen, de esta manera ella se ayuda a tener más ingresos económicos para poder solventar sus gastos diarios.  Otra actividad que realiza es la crianza y venta de aves de corral.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para seguir elaborando la chicha de jora que vende, los pedidos  que le hacen le permite tener mayores ganancias, ya que su clientela se ha incrementado considerablemente,  para poder pagar su  crédito y de paso mejorar la calidad de vida de ella.  Isabel desea que más adelante su negocio crezca y así pueda tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Isabel, 41, is single and lives alone in her own house which only has electricity.  It is located in the Sialupe Baca rural area, approximately one hour from the department of Lambayeque.  The main activities in this area are agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

Isabel sells "chicha de jora" (a drink made with fermented ground maize and other ingredients).  She makes it at home and lets it ferment in ceramic pots.  She has been in business for 10 years and uses a recipe passed down through generations in the area.  She sells to customers who know her and earns an income to cover her daily household expenses.  She also raises and sells chickens.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy ingredients to make the chica de jora that she sells.  Demand has increased considerably and the orders will give her greater earnings to pay back the loan and improve her lifestyle.  Isabel wants her business to grow into something much bigger.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "chicha de jora" drink.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is 32 years old, married and a mother of two.  She sells household goods such as carpets, buckets, basins, jugs, water tanks and brooms.  She has been in the business for six years.  She previously operated a general shop.  She has experienced a drastic improvement in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya and she has hope that her business will continue to grow.  She has requested 65, 000 Kes., to buy iron sheets to renovate her business premise.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets to renovate her business premise.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mila has borrowed and paid off 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es: Cadith de 48 años, es una mujer muy amble y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El día de Cadith comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando abre su puesto y empieza con la venta de pollos. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Bellavista (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre logra sacar una sonrisa a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, quienes con sus bromas hacen más alegres las largas jornadas de venta, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Espera tener en el futuro un emporio donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad carne de pollo. Este será su décimo séptimo crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más pollos para cubrir mejor la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cadith is 48 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her five beloved children, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Cadith's day starts very early in the morning when she opens her stall and starts selling chicken.  Her business is located in Bellavista market (an important market in the city of Pucallpa).  She is a very persuasive saleswoman and always manages to raise a smile from her customers.  What she most enjoys about her business is chatting with her neighboring stall holders who, with their jokes, make the long days more cheerful.  Cadith has been in this business for six years and the most difficult part of her work is having to stay on her stall all day.  She hopes, in the future, to own a store where she can sell her chicken more peacefully.

This will be Cadith's seventeenth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the support of every one of you.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more chicken so that she can better meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more chicken

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado La Unión, es de la ciudad de Asunción, está integrado por 18 mujeres. Todas ellas son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Ellas se juntaron al escuchar hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y quedaron encantadas con la idea.
Ellas trabajan en un ambiente de cooperación y respeto. Luchan por un fin en común, que es el de proveer a sus hijos un mejor futuro, y mayores ingresos, para poder tener una vida digna y decorosa.
La Sra. Isidora se dedica a la venta de hortalizas. Ella por medio de este trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a toda su familia, también ha logrado mantenerse a ella misma y a su familia. Ella tiene el sueño de poder abrir, algún día, un pequeño local donde ofrecer sus hortalizas.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas hortalizas que podrá vender. Tiene las esperanzas puestas en el credito ya que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
This committee is called 'La Unión' and it is located in the city of Asunción.  It has 18 members (all of whom are women).  They are all neighbors and friends who live in this city.  They came together to listen to somebody explain about the 'Entrepreneurial Women's Program' and were very taken with the idea.

The women work in an environment of cooperation and respect.  They work together towards a common goal which is providing their children with a better future and making more income so that they can lead a decent life.

Isidora's business is selling vegetables.  Through this work, she has been able to get her whole family ahead in life.  She has managed to support herself and her family.  Her dream is to some day open small business premises from which she can sell her vegetables.

Isidora is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to sell.  She has her hopes placed in this loan as it will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell such as tomatoes, lettuce, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one-day-old chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Adolfo Enrique

texts.es: Adolfo  de 42 años de edad  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su cónyuge y su hijo de 4 años de edad con quien tiene muchos sueños futuros y por el cual se esmera diariamente para aumentar su bienestar.  Adolfo inició su negocio hace 14 años cuando una parálisis  de su cuerpo le impidió continuar sus estudios, así fue como decidió emprender su aventura de negocios, con el propósito de incrementar sus ingresos  y no convertirse en una carga para su familia. Él poco a poco con el apoyo de su familia se ha ido recuperando y con su actitud ante la vida ha demostrado que “Cuando se quiere se puede”.  Adolfo vende lubricantes y neumáticos diariamente, su meta más adelante es adicionarle toda la línea de repuestos de vehículos, pues cuenta con una clientela potencial que forma parte de su mercado doméstico actual. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia y esta es la razón por la cual está impulsando su crecimiento, con un nuevo capital de trabajo, para  reforzar el actual, pues lo invertirá en nuevas marcas  de lubricantes, para ofrecer una gran variedad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 42 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with his wife and son aged 4. He has many future dreams for his son for whom he strives daily to increase his wellbeing.

Adolfo began his business some 14 years ago when a paralysis of his body impeded him from continuing his studies. That's why he decided to take on his business venture, proposing to increase his income and not convert himself into a charge for his family. Little by little, with his family's help, he has been recuperating and with his positive attitude toward life, he has demonstrated that  “When you want to you can.”

Adolfo sells lubricants and vehicle tires every day. His goal further along is to add an entire line of replacement parts for vehicles. He has the potential client base which already forms part of his domestic customers. His business is his only source of income for his family and this is the reason he is driving its growth. 

With this new working capital, added to what he already has, Adolfo will invest in new brands of lubricants, offering a greater variety to his clientèle.

loans.use: to purchase new brands of auto lubricants to sell.

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Sreyoun (pictured with her young son) sells meatballs and roasted chicken wings in her village. Her husband, Sopheak, is a security guard. They have been married since 2006 and just have one young son. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreyoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives because part of it is in poor condition.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom, 23 year old, is feeding pigs to sell. Her income is $4 per day. Her husband is a worker in a furniture shop and makes $6 per day. She has not yet had any children. Every month, she has to spend $76 on food, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 for repairing her house. Sreymom has very good experience in feeding pigs because she has been doing this career for a long time. She wants to feed more pigs and chickens when she has enough money to buy them.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Adina

texts.en:
Adina is a 47-year-old mother of three. She lives in the northern community of Har Halutz. For several years, after training and certification, Adina worked in reflexology on the side. She works during the day as the school secretary and in the afternoons and evenings had been giving reflexology sessions. She has created a strong network of contacts, providing private therapy, and holding seminars at community centers and schools on reflexology. Many from her community and those surrounding ones turn to her for her services. Adina's clients include regular ones from the area and tourists staying at the B&Bs during the year. As her client base and the demands for her therapy have grown, Adina needs a studio for her ever-growing business activity. She is transforming an area of her home into a private, separate studio for clients. 

Adina has invested her own funds and needs this loan to assist with costs for the furnishings and supplies and for the costs of developing her website and PR.

Adina hopes in the future to earn the majority of her income through her business and not be dependent on other work.

loans.use: To pay for furnishings, supplies, a website and PR.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa y tiene 38 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 17, 11, 7 años de edad; la socia trabaja atendiendo comidas en uno de los centros comerciales y ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su comidas, la socia comprara arroz, azúcar, aceite, y comprara al por mayor para poder ganar más. La socia  solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes como arroz, azúcar, leche.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y asi mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the “Tres de Mayo” communal bank located in the Huanchac District within the Province and Department of Cusco.

Teresa is 38 years old with 3 children aged 17, 11, and 7. She works serving food in one of the commercial centers. She wants to invest the credit in the purchase of inputs for the preparation of her dishes. She will buy rice, sugar, and oil at wholesale prices to earn more money. 

Teresa has requested this loan to purchase ingredients like rice, sugar, and milk. She is thankful for the support given to her and has pledged to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 9 children.  Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 34-year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a cigarette factory. 

Thuy supports her family by running a food stall in front of her house. She started this business a year ago and sells pork noodles to her clients. She would like to get a loan to repair her stall and buy some new furniture, bowls and chopsticks and better quality meat to make noodle soup.

She hopes that will increase her income and help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her food stall, and buy new furniture and better quality meat

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Манзура занимается торговлей сухофруктов. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки кураги.
texts.en: Manzura lives in the town of Isfara.  She is 33 years old, married and has two children.  Manzura is involved in sales of dried fruits and has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of dried apricots.

loans.use: to purchase dried apricots

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida works hard to support her family. Adelaida is married and has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. Adelaida has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boats.

Adelaida has been in this business for 14 years now. In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boats.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Ligaya helps her husband in cultivating their 1.5 hectares of farm lots by planting corn. They have been in this business for almost 16 years and usually earn a profit of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in every harvest season. They have four adult children, two of whom are still in college level. Due to high cost of school fees and commodities, they need to earn more income to support their children's education and satisfy their daily needs. 

They planned to expand their corn plantation to ensure high yields and income,b ut due to financial difficulty, Ligaya is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in planting corn. They believe that through this loan, they will be able to work out their plan and make an improvement in their business to have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in planting corn.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines with his wife and five children. For the last five years, he has earned a living by running a shop where he sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to his customers.  He joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 28 years old. He is single, but he supports his family. He has been selling fruit for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after having been introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. James will use the loan to buy more fruit for resale. With the anticipated profit from his business, he will educate his siblings. His hope is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for resale.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is married and has four children ranging from 8 months to 12 years. He describes himself as an ambitious and God-fearing man. 

He has been providing photography services to frequent and new customers. His challenge is the high cost of traveling during the course of his business. 

He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a digital camera. In the next five years, William hopes and plans to run several photo studios and be a well known photographer.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Leofe

texts.en:
Leofe is 30 years old and lives in Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Leofe is a married and has two children. 

Leofe plants, harvests and sells coconuts to earn a living and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2012, Leofe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Leofe wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Roqayah

texts.en:
Roqayah is conservative person she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband.
Roqayah is  a 52-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. She has a home-based business in which she bakes pastries and sells them to neighbors and nearby areas. Roqayah is requesting a loan of 800 Jordanian dinars to to expand her business and purchase materials needed for baking. She is looking to establish her own shop so that she can increase her sales volume and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business and purchase materials needed for baking

loans.name: Layali

texts.en:
Layali is a 29-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of four children.

Layali sells clothes. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes.

Layali is looking to improve her family's life conditions and expand her business.

Because Layali is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe NIETA, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habits, de fruits et légumes, du bois de chauffe et des articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habits, des fruits et légumes, du bois de chauffe et des articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                                                                                                  
La cliente OUMOU, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 2 sacs de savon (‘’gabakourouni’’ savon de fabrication locale) avec les fabricants de Fana pour ensuite vendre sur place à la maison à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de savon.
texts.en:
The women of the group NIETA are all married and average 27 years of age and three children each all living in traditional extended families in Fana City, in Region de Koulikoro. The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in clothing, fruit & vegetables, firewood, and various shop goods. The members of the group NIETA are on their eleventh solidarity loan, which will be used to buy clothing, fruit & vegetables, firewood, and a variety of shop goods. 

This client, OUMOU, the second person from the left in the photo, intends to buy 2 sacks of "gabakourouni’’ (a locally made soap) from the producers in Fana. She will then sell the goods locally at her house to a customer base composed of men and women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be put toward family needs. Part of the profits is reinvested in the soap-selling business.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Kinzeghere Julius

texts.en:
Julius is  a 28-year-old single man with no child living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Julius sells spare parts, and he also has a video show room and bar as additional income. He began the business to have an improved life style. 

Julius is hard working; however, he is faced with a challenge of defaulters and limited capital. He wants the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Kenande

texts.fr: Kenande a 44 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle vit seule avec son fils. Comme activité, elle revend des jouets et des sous-vêtements. A l’occasion des fêtes de fin d’année, elle aimerait augmenter ses chiffres de vente. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter un stock de jouets pour enfants.

loans.use: acheter un stock de jouets pour enfants

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.en:
Five years ago Miss Maria started to sell shoes by catalogue, when she faced a lack of resources for the expensive education of her children, that are 16, 12, and 6 years of age, for her husband\'s salary was not enough to cover all of the house hold expenses. An engaging spirit and responsibility are the characteristics that define Miss Maria, and thanks to these she has been able to come out on top and fight for the well-being and future of her family, essentially, her children.

She now requires a loan of $250 to be able to cover her costs and pay off some outstanding accounts, planning to repay the full amount of the loan in a period of 3-6 months. Help Miss Maria build her ultimate dream, see the completion of her children\'s studies. You can help them, don\'t doubt it. With your hlep and your generosity you will be able to help secure a better quality of life for this family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 5 años Doña María comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, ante la falta de recursos para costera la educación de sus hijos, quienes tiene 16, 12 y 6 años de edad, pues con el salario de su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. Espíritu emprendedor y responsabilidad son características que definen a Doña María y que gracias a ellas ha podido salir adelante y luchar por el bienestar y futuro de su familia, esencialmente de sus hijos.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene y así incrementar sus ingresos y pagar algunas facturas pendientes, planeando cubrir el monto total del crédito en un periodo de 3-6 meses. Ayuda a Doña María a construir su máximo sueño, ver culminados los estudios de sus hijos. Tú puedes ayudarlos, no lo dudes más. Con tu apoyo y generosidad podrás ayudar a asegurar una mejor calidad de vida para esta familia.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zarefa

texts.en: Zarefa, daughter of Sakhi Dad, is 38 and married to Sayed Sarwar. Their family contains 5 members. Zarefa is an uneducated lady because her family didn't give her permission to study and after her marriage her financial condition got worse because their sales were low, causing them to have less income. Then she and her husband heard about micro loans and she decided to take loans to improve her business. She is now in her first loan cycle and her business has changed since she took the loan. Now they have more groceries in their shop and her husband buys vegetables from the market, Zarefa cleans them at home, and then they sell them at her husband's shop and earn their income. She is happy with the loan and says she wants to continue taking loans when her first cycle gets accomplished.

loans.use: Buying vegetables ,flour, ghee, etc. for shop

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Moa H. is a 31 year old widow that supports her 2 children.  She sells sugar cane juice and a limited number of grocery products at her road-side stand.  She earns about $5/day from this business.  This loan will be used for purchasing sugar cane, seeds, and beverages so she can expand her shop.  In the future, she would like to move up to Siem Reap to sell clothes in the market.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane, seeds for her field, and drinks for her small shop

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Business Description

Emma sells food items and sundries from a small shop located on a main street. She also sells sweets at a local school.

Loan Use

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices, which will allow Emma to offer lower prices and increase her profits.

Personal Information

Emma is 55 years old; she lives in a house made of reeds. Her goals are to build a better home and to secure a more stable life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Doña Emma se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y víveres en general. Además su tienda esta muy bien ubicada en calle principal. Además ella vende confitería en una escuela del sector.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor y asi tener mayores ganancias y además poder ofrecer los productos con precios mas económicos.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 55 años y su casa es de caña sus metas son de construir su vivienda y además de asegurarse una vida estable

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is originally from Creel, in Chihuahua. He is single, and due to the lack of employment in his area, he started his own business selling tortillas to help his family. Sadly, his mother died recently and it's been very difficult for him to get through this huge loss. He wants to grow his business and be able to offer care for his future family. This is why he is working so hard to improve the quality of the service he offers.

Fernando is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a new machine, which he hopes will increase his production and increase his area of business. He has committed to pay back this loan in 6 months, and he sincerely appreciates the support and confidence that you offer him. Be a part of his achievements with your support.

Fernando es originario de Creel en Chihuahua, él es soltero y ante la falta de empleo en la localidad inició su propio negocio con la venta de tortillas, para poder ayudar a su familia, lamentablemente su madre falleció hace poco y ha sido muy difícil para él superar esta gran pérdida. Fernando desea hace crecer su negocio y tener un patrimonio para ofrecerle a su futura familia, por lo que se esfuerza mucho para mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece.

Fernando está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de una máquina nueva con lo que espera incrementar su producción y ampliar su área de servicio, él se compromete e regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Fernando agradece sinceramente el apoyo y la confianza que le brindas, forma parte de sus logros, decídete a apoyarlo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seafood and adapt his store

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en: Hosiyat successfully repaid her first loan from the KIVA program. She also told all of her friends about KIVA and because of her, many of them became clients of our organization as well. You may know that Hosiyat was married and has four children. She has been engaged in trade for over 8 years and her business is selling clothing and shoes (sport). Presently she is selling her autumn assortment. She wishes to take part in a KIVA loan again and she is requesting a loan for the urgent purchase of winter goods to sell, before the New Year holiday.

loans.use: Hosiyat would like to increase the volume of winter goods for her clothing and shoe store before the New Year.

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru:
Ashur H. is 50 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 10 children. Ashur would like to purchase fertilizer, seeds and fuel in order to fertilize his land and to plant wheat. He has 20 years of experience in agriculture. Ashur will use a portion of his harvest for personal uses – making flour and baking bread. He will sell the rest of his harvest to local residents as many cannot afford to purchase flour and instead purchase wheat for further processing as it is much cheaper. Ashur will pay back the loan over 11 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Худойбердиев Ашур – 50 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 10 детей. На полученный кредит Ашур хочет приобрести удобрения, семена пшеницы, а также горюче-смазочные материалы для обработки земли и посева пшеницы. Его опыт в обработке земли составляет 20 лет. Часть полученного урожая будет использована им в личных целях, то есть для переработки в муку и дальнейшей выпечки хлеба для употребления, другую часть урожая он планирует продать местным жителям, так как многие жители не имеют возможность приобретать муку, а приобретают зерно для дальнейшей переработки и выпечки хлеба – это намного дешевле, чем приобретать готовую муку не отечественного производства. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 11 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is a very shy woman, but also very hardworking as a farmer and as the mother of 5 young children. She and her husband cultivate potatoes and corn. What they urgently need right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. She needs your help to buy the fertilizers, which are the most expensive and most necessary inputs for the cultivation of her crops. The goal is to achieve better profits and benefits in the market. Maribel doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel es una mujer muy tímida pero muy trabajadora y luchadora en su labor como agricultora y como madre de 5 niños los cuales requieren aún de cuidados por ser pequeños.Ella y su pareja se dedican al cultivo de papa, maíz y lo que ahora les urge es comprar fertilizantes, abonos y medicinas para el cuidado de sus productos para que sus terrenos puedan otorgarles productos mejorados y acorde a la exigencia del mercado.Necesita la ayuda de todos vosotros para la compra de sus fertilizantes los cuales son los más caros y necesarios para sus productos con el propósito de obtener mayores ganancias y beneficios en el mercado.Maribel no sólo necesita de la buena tierra, requiere también de una mano amiga que la ayude.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Winni

texts.en:
Winni is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 10-25. Winni owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6:30 AM to 6 PM at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Martik

texts.id:
By renting a piece of land, mother Martik lives with her husband who work as a building laborer in the self built house. All children are married and have their own family. The house is quite clean. In front of the house Mother Martik built a small Food stall, which sells local mixed ice drink, mixed rice and gado gado (indonesian peanut salad). Every morning, mother Martik made fried bananas that is offered around the house. She was a group Dinari client before, and now Mother Martik is requesting an individual loan. In the previous loan period, Mother Martik always paid her payments timely. She hopes that this current loan could add capital to her foodstall, so that she could offer more variation.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan mengontrak sebidang tA., Ibu Martik tinggal berdua beserta suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai buruh bangunan disebuah rumah yang dibangunnya sendiri. Semua anaknya sudah menikah dan mempunyai keluarga sendiri. Keadaan rumahnya cukup bersih. Didepan rumahnya Ibu Martik membangun warung kecil yang menjual es campur, nasi campur dan gado-gado. Setiap pagi, Ibu martik membuat pisang goreng dan dijajakan disekitar rumahnya.Sebelumnya klien merupakan binaan DINARI dalam bentuk kelompok, dan sekarang Ibu Martik kembali mengajukan pinjaman tetapi dalm bentuk individu. Pada pinjaman periode sebelumnya Ibu Martik selalu membayar angsurannya tepat waktu. Dia berharap pinjaman kali ini bisa membantunya sebagai tambahan modal usaha bagi warungnya, sehingga jenis makanan yang dijajakan lebih bervariasi.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)
